sentences.sentence: アニメや漫画は日本{1:にとどまらず}、海外でも多くのファンを増やしている。
sentences.translation: Anime and manga are gaining a lot of fans not only in Japan but also overseas.

sentences.sentence: この小説は、女性{1:にとどまらず}、若い男性にも人気そうだ。
sentences.translation: This novel seems to be popular not only with women but also with young men.

sentences.sentence: 彼はそのレストランで、文句を言う{1:にとどまらず}、テーブルをひっくり返してしまった。
sentences.translation: He not only complained to the restaurant, he flipped the table over.

sentences.sentence: 彼女の研究は科学{1:にとどまらず}、医療分野にも広がっている。
sentences.translation: Her research is not limited to science and extends to the medical field as well.

sentences.sentence: 最近は、週末{1:にとどまらず}、平日もバーベーキューをする人が増えているそうだ。
sentences.translation: Recently, it seems that more and more people are barbecuing not only on weekends but also on weekdays.

sentences.sentence: 株の暴落はその年だけ{1:にとどまらず}年が明けても続いた。
sentences.translation: The stock market crash continued not only in that year but also into the new year.

sentences.sentence: 円高の影響は、輸入業者{1:にとどまらず}、一般家庭にも及んでいる。
sentences.translation: The impact of the strong yen is not limited to importers, but extends to ordinary households as well.

sentences.sentence: 誕生日{1:でもなんでもない}のにプレゼントをもらった。
sentences.translation: I got a present even though it wasn't my birthday or anything like that.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼の冗談は面白{1:くもなんともない}。
sentences.translation: His joke is not interesting at all.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼は僕の親戚{1:でもなんでもない}。
sentences.translation: I am not related to him at all.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼のこと、好き{1:でもなんでもない}けれど、なぜか気にかかる。
sentences.translation: I don't really like him at all but there is something interesting about him.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今回の結果は不思議{1:でもなんでもない}し、当然だと思う。
sentences.translation: The result this time is nothing strange and I think was to be expected.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 苦労{1:でもなんでもない}よ。君に手伝えれば僕が嬉しいです。
sentences.translation: It's not hard work or anything. I would be very happy if I could help you.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 最初は痛{1:くもなんともない}から大丈夫だと思っていたが、次の日は筋肉の痛みを感じた。
sentences.translation: At first I thought it was okay because it didn't hurt, but the next day I felt muscle pain.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/でも何でもない-くも何ともない-demo-nan-demo-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: こんな素晴らしい賞をいただいて、光栄{1:の至り}です。
sentences.translation: It is an honor to receive such a wonderful award.

sentences.sentence: 憧れのアーティストからサインをもらえるなんて、感激{1:の至り}だ。
sentences.translation: I was deeply moved because I got a signature from the artist I admired.

sentences.sentence: そんなことをするのは愚{1:の至り}だ。
sentences.translation: Doing something like that is the height of foolishness.

sentences.sentence: 日本の首相にお目にかかって、私は光栄{1:の至り}です。
sentences.translation: It is such an honor for me to meet the Prime Minister of Japan.

sentences.sentence: 今日はお客様の名前を間違えてしまい、汗顔{1:の至り}だ。
sentences.translation: Today, I made a mistake with a customer's name, and so my face is covered in sweat.

sentences.sentence: 自分の書いた物語が本になるなど想像していませんでした。光栄{1:の至り}です。
sentences.translation: I never imagined that the story I wrote would become a book. It's such an honor.

sentences.sentence: 私の研究はそのような評価を受けたということは感激{1:の至り}です。
sentences.translation: It is such an honor that my research received such an evaluation.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は、いつもやり{1:もしないで}、できないと言う。
sentences.translation: She always gives up before she even tries.

sentences.sentence: 食べ{1:もしないで}、まずいかどうかなんてわからないでしょ。
sentences.translation: You can't know if it's bad or not without eating it first, right?

sentences.sentence: 食事{1:もしないで}ゲームばかりしていると、病気になるよ。
sentences.translation: If you just play games without eating anything, you will get sick.

sentences.sentence: 知り{1:もしないで}偉そうなことを言うな。
sentences.translation: Don't act like you're an expert when you don't know much about it.

sentences.sentence: 彼は授業に遅れてきたのに謝り{1:もしないで}席に着いた。
sentences.translation: Although he was late for class, he took his seat without apologizing.

sentences.sentence: 気持ちを相手に伝え{1:もしないで}、自分のことを解ってほしいって無理でしょ。
sentences.translation: You can't expect people to understand you without telling them how you feel.

sentences.sentence: その女優さんは彼女に声をかけたファンに見向き{1:もしないで}行ってしまった。
sentences.translation: The actress left without even looking at the fans who talked to her.

sentences.sentence: あなたが本気で勉強すれば、半年でN1合格をでき{1:ないものでもない}。
sentences.translation: If you study hard, it's not impossible to pass N1 in half a year.

sentences.sentence: 今すぐに家を出れば、コンサートに間に合わ{1:ないものでもない}。
sentences.translation: You may be able to make it in time for the concert if you leave the house right now.

sentences.sentence: 今から皆で頑張れば、この提案は成立し{1:ないものでもない}。
sentences.translation: If we all do our best from now on, this proposal may not be unsuccessful.

sentences.sentence: 条件によってはその仕事を引き受け{1:ないものでもない}。
sentences.translation: I may be willing to take the work on depending on the conditions.

sentences.sentence: 私はそのシステムを作れ{1:ないものでもない}ですが、お金と時間がかかります。
sentences.translation: It's not that I can't make that system, but it costs money and time.

sentences.sentence: ここからタクシーに乗れば、フライトの時間に間に合わ{1:ないものでもない}。
sentences.translation: If you take a taxi from here, it may not be too late to make your flight on time.

sentences.sentence: 映画館で映画を見{1:ないものでもない}んですが、家でパソコンで見ることの方が好きです。
sentences.translation: It's not that I don't watch movies at the cinema, but I prefer watching movies at home on my computer.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は外見{1:もさることながら}性格{1:も}とてもいいです。
sentences.translation: Of course she looks very nice, but her personality is also very good.

sentences.sentence: 試合に勝つには選手の実力{1:もさることながら}、運{1:も}必要なのだ。
sentences.translation: Winning the match is not only based on the ability of the players, but luck is also essential.

sentences.sentence: このカメラは、価格{1:もさることながら}、デザイン{1:も}よいので人気がある。
sentences.translation: This camera is popular because of it's price, but it's design is also very good.

sentences.sentence: 最近は忙しすぎて、疲労{1:もさることながら}、ストレス{1:も}ピークに達している。
sentences.translation: Recently, I've been so busy that I'm not only tired but also very stressed.

sentences.sentence: この映画は話の内容{1:もさることながら}映像の美しさ{1:も}評判がいい。
sentences.translation: This movie has a good reputation not only for the content of the story but also for the beauty of the footage.

sentences.sentence: あの男はビジネスの知識{1:もさることながら}、プレゼンのスキル{1:も}非常に高い。
sentences.translation: Not only does that man have general business knowledge, but his presentation skill is extremely high.

sentences.sentence: 彼のプレゼンは内容{1:もさることながら}、話し方がわかりやすくとても素晴らしいものだった。
sentences.translation: Not only was his presentation content good, but his way of speakin was very easy to understand and overall it was a great performance.

sentences.sentence: 生徒に暴力を振るなんて、先生{1:としてあるまじき}行為だ。
sentences.translation: Violence against students is something a teacher absolutely should not do

sentences.sentence: 他の人の案を盗むなんて許す{1:まじき}ことだ。
sentences.translation: Stealing someone else's ideas is an unforgivable behavior.

sentences.sentence: 彼のやったことは、人{1:としてあるまじき}残酷な行為だ。
sentences.translation: What he did was a cruel and unacceptable action for a human being.

sentences.sentence: 試験中にカンニングのような許す{1:まじき}行為をする人は０点にします。
sentences.translation: Those who do unforgivable acts such as cheating during the exam will be given 0 points.

sentences.sentence: 学生を恐喝するとは、教師{1:にあるまじき}行為だ。
sentences.translation: It is totally unacceptable for a teacher to blackmail students.

sentences.sentence: 弱い者をだましてお金を取るなど、人間{1:にあるまじき}行為だ。
sentences.translation: Things like deceiving the weak and taking their money is not something humans should do.

sentences.sentence: 一国の首相{1:にあるまじき}発言だ。凄く無責任です。
sentences.translation: That is an unacceptable statement from the prime minister of a country. It is truly irresponsible.

sentences.sentence: 彼の態度は失礼{1:極まる}。
sentences.translation: His attitude is extremely rude.

sentences.sentence: その景色は美しいこと{1:極まりない}ものだった。
sentences.translation: That scenery was extremely beautiful.

sentences.sentence: 昨日見た映画は、平凡{1:極まる}内容だった。
sentences.translation: The movie I watched yesterday was very mediocre.

sentences.sentence: あの人は社長として、無責任{1:極まりない}。
sentences.translation: As president, that person is extremely irresponsible.

sentences.sentence: 私が書いた文章には誤字が多く、恥ずかしいこと{1:極まりない}。
sentences.translation: There are many mistakes in my essay, it is very embarrassing.

sentences.sentence: 手を洗わずに料理をするのは、不衛生{1:極まりない}よ。
sentences.translation: Cooking without washing your hands is extremely unsanitary.

sentences.sentence: 仕事を部下にお願いして自分はデートするなんて、彼は勝手{1:極まりない}。
sentences.translation: He was extremely selfish when he asked his subordinates to do his work for him so he could go on a date.

sentences.sentence: 他の人の体の欠点について冗談のように言うのは不愉快なこと{1:極まりない}。
sentences.translation: It's extremely unpleasant to jokingly talk about other people's physical flaws.

sentences.sentence: 優勝できて、感激{1:の極み}です。
sentences.translation: I am beyond excited that we've won the championship.

sentences.sentence: 長時間の試合で、選手たちは疲労{1:の極み}に達していた。
sentences.translation: The players were completely exhausted during the long-lasting game.

sentences.sentence: 交通事故で多くの人が亡くなり、痛恨{1:の極み}だ。
sentences.translation: Many people lose their lives in traffic accidents, it is very tragic.

sentences.sentence: 家を建てたばかりなのに、地震で壊れてしまい、痛恨{1:の極み}だ。
sentences.translation: Our house was destroyed in the earthquake immediately after we finished building it. It is such a horrible feeling.

sentences.sentence: 私のような者がこのような名誉ある賞を頂けるとは、感激{1:の極み}だ。
sentences.translation: I'm deeply honored that someone like me to receive such an honorable award.

sentences.sentence: あなたにとっては日常的なことかもしれませんが、私にとってはそれは贅沢{1:の極み}です。
sentences.translation: It may be everyday for you, but for me it's the height of luxury.

sentences.sentence: このような盛大なる激励会を開いていただき、感激{1:の極み}です。
sentences.translation: We are very grateful that you have hosted such a great encouragement party like this.

sentences.sentence: 暑くなって、ずいぶん夏{1:めいて}きましたね。
sentences.translation: The weather is getting hotter, it seems that summer is here.

sentences.sentence: あの人はもう二十歳なのに、子供{1:めいた}行動がよくします。
sentences.translation: Even though he is 20 years old, he often behaves like a child.

sentences.sentence: あの子はまだ中学校の一年生なのに、よく大人{1:めいた}服を着ます。
sentences.translation: Even though that kid is still in the first year of junior high school, they often wear mature clothes.

sentences.sentence: 彼はどこか謎{1:めいた}雰囲気があり、女性に人気がある。
sentences.translation: He has a mysterious atmosphere and is popular with women.

sentences.sentence: 先生の皮肉{1:めいた}言い方を、生徒は不快に感じている 。
sentences.translation: It seems that the students feel uncomfortable because of the teacher's sarcastic way of speaking.

sentences.sentence: 別れた彼氏から、脅迫{1:めいた}メールが届いて、怖くなった。
sentences.translation: I got scared when I received threatening emails from my ex-boyfriend.

sentences.sentence: その記事に対する反論{1:めいた}メールが大量に出版社に届いた。
sentences.translation: A large number of e-mails appearing to object against that article have arrived at the publisher.

sentences.sentence: この番組も、遅{1:かれ}早{1:かれ}視聴者に飽きられるだろう。
sentences.translation: People will sooner or later become tired of this program, too.

sentences.sentence: 人は多{1:かれ}少な{1:かれ}、悩みをもっているものだ。
sentences.translation: More or less, everyone has something they are worried about.

sentences.sentence: 彼は仕事で遅{1:かれ}早{1:かれ}成功する見込みがある。
sentences.translation: He is likely to succeed at work sooner or later.

sentences.sentence: 子どもは良{1:かれ}悪し{1:かれ}親から影響を受けて育ちます。
sentences.translation: Children, for better or for worse, are influenced by their parents.

sentences.sentence: 緊張して失敗した経験は多{1:かれ}少な{1:かれ}誰にでもあるのではないだろうか。
sentences.translation: Perhaps everyone has more or less experienced the feeling of failing from being nervous.

sentences.sentence: 若い女性なら、多{1:かれ}少な{1:かれ}セクハラを経験したことがあるだろう。
sentences.translation: Every young women has experienced sexual harassment of some sort.

sentences.sentence: ギャンブルに明け暮れる夫は、遅{1:かれ}早{1:かれ}いずれ離婚することになる。
sentences.translation: A gambling husband will sooner or later end in divorce.

sentences.sentence: 私の息子{1:ときたら}、もうすぐ試験なのに遊んでばかりいるんですよ。
sentences.translation: My son is not studying at all although his exam is coming up soon.

sentences.sentence: うちの大学{1:ときたら}、学費が高いくせに先生たちの質が低すぎるよ。
sentences.translation: At our university, the quality of the teachers is too low despite the high tuition fees.

sentences.sentence: 最近のテレビ{1:ときたら}、似たような番組ばかりでつまらないだ。
sentences.translation: When it comes to TV lately, it's pretty boring with mostly only similar programs.

sentences.sentence: あの居酒屋{1:ときたら}、一杯ビール飲んで、少し食べただけで5000円も取られるんだよ。
sentences.translation: At that izakaya, I only drank one beer and ate a little, but it cost over 5,000 yen.

sentences.sentence: 彼女{1:ときたら}、仕事を始めて一時間も経たないなのに「もう疲れた」なんて言うんだ。
sentences.translation: She said "I'm tired" even though an hour hasn't even passed since she started working.

sentences.sentence: 最近のYouTube{1:ときたら}、お金稼ぎのためにバカなことをする人が増えて見ていて不快だ。
sentences.translation: It's unpleasant to see more and more people doing stupid things to make money on YouTube these days.

sentences.sentence: 私の主人{1:ときたら}、結婚の記念日を忘れて友達と遊びに行ったんだよ。本当に信じられない。
sentences.translation: My husband forgot our wedding anniversary and went out with his friends. I really can't believe it.

sentences.sentence: 新入社員で慣れぬ{1:こととて}、失礼があればお許しください。
sentences.translation: I am new to the company and not used to things yet, so please forgive me if I do anything disrespectful.

sentences.sentence: 私の両親が高齢の{1:こととて}、来年から一緒に住むことにしました。
sentences.translation: Since my parents are old, I decided to live with them from next year.

sentences.sentence: 年末年始は休業中の{1:こととて}、この時期の依頼にはすぐに対応ができない。
sentences.translation: We are closed because of the year-end and New Year holidays and cannot immediately respond to requests during this period.

sentences.sentence: このような場所でスピーチするのは初めての{1:こととて}、とても緊張です。
sentences.translation: It's the first time I've made a speech in a place like this, and I'm very nervous.

sentences.sentence: まだ検討中の{1:こととて}、はっきりとしたお返事はできません。
sentences.translation: Since we are still investigating, we cannot have a clear answer yet.

sentences.sentence: 急な{1:こととて}、相談せず決めてしまい、申し訳ありません。
sentences.translation: I'm sorry that I decided without consulting since it was a sudden matter.

sentences.sentence: 引っ越してきたばかりで、辺りの様子を分からぬ{1:こととて}、どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。
sentences.translation: Since I just moved here, I do not know anything about this area and so I hope you can help.

sentences.sentence: 川の水が溢れ{1:んばかりに}なっている。
sentences.translation: The river is about to flood.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は泣き出さ{1:んばかりの}顔をして、私に助けを求めてきた。
sentences.translation: She came to me for help looking as though she was about to cry.

sentences.sentence: 行きたかった大学に合格した息子は、飛び上がら{1:んばかりに}喜んでいた。
sentences.translation: My son passed the entrance exam to his target university. He was as happy as if he could fly.

sentences.sentence: 絶対に許さないと言わ{1:んばかりの}顔で睨んでいる。
sentences.translation: He glared with an expression as if to say that he would absolutely not forgive them.

sentences.sentence: 彼女のスピーチが終わると、割れ{1:んばかりの}拍手が沸き起こった。
sentences.translation: After her speech ended, the sound of the applause sounded like it was about to break the entire hall.

sentences.sentence: ずっと夜勤で、三日間何も食べずに寝{1:んばかりの}しんどい顔をしていた。
sentences.translation: I've constantly been working night shifts and so my face looked as though I hadn't slept or ate for 3 days.

sentences.sentence: 家に帰ると、ペットの犬が「待ってたよ！」と言わ{1:んばかりに}尻尾を振りながら寄ってきた。
sentences.translation: When I got home, my pet dog approached me, waving his tail as if to say, "I was waiting for you!"

sentences.sentence: 一人の青年がおぼれている子供を救わ{1:んがために}、川に飛び込んだ。
sentences.translation: A young man jumped into a river in order to save a drowning child.

sentences.sentence: 来年、自分のレストランを開店せ{1:んがために}、今一生懸命お金をためている。
sentences.translation: I'm doing my best to save money now in order to open my own restaurant next year.

sentences.sentence: 選手達は金メダルを取ら{1:んがために}、寝る時間も惜しんで練習に励む。
sentences.translation: The athletes spare no time to sleep and practice hard in order to win the gold medal.

sentences.sentence: 彼はお金をもうけ{1:んがために}、ずいぶん酷いことをやってきた。
sentences.translation: He has done a lot of terrible things in order to make money.

sentences.sentence: 自分の利益を得{1:んがための}発言では、人の心を動かせない。
sentences.translation: Words that are only for one's personal benefit cannot move people's hearts.

sentences.sentence: お母さんの手術を払わ{1:んがために}、私は同時にいろいろな仕事をします。
sentences.translation: I juggle a lot of different work at the same time in order to pay for my mom's surgery.

sentences.sentence: 自然を守ら{1:んがために}、ビニール袋やプラスチック製のストローなどは廃止すべきだ。
sentences.translation: In order to protect nature, plastic bags and plastic straws should be abolished.

sentences.sentence: 新商品を来週までに完成せ{1:んがために}、私たちは毎日会社に泊まり込んで頑張っている。
sentences.translation: In order to complete the new product by next week, we are working hard and staying overnight at the company everyday.

sentences.sentence: 明日はテストがありますから、いい点を取るために、勉強{1:せずには済まない}。
sentences.translation: I have a test tomorrow, so I have to study to get a good score.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今日レポートをかか{1:ないでは済まない}。明日提出しなければ、先生に叱れるでしょう。
sentences.translation: I must write the report today. My teacher will scold me if i don't submit it tomorrow.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 友人のパソコンを壊してしまったのだから、弁償{1:せずには済まない}。
sentences.translation: I broke my friend's computer, so I must compensate them for it.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 年末の忘年会にみんなが出席するのなら、私も行か{1:ずには済まない}。
sentences.translation: If everyone attends the year-end party, I can't help but go.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 冗談のつもりだったけど、相手を傷つけてしまったのなら謝ら{1:ずには済まない}。
sentences.translation: I intended to be a joke, but I can't help but apologize if I hurt the other person.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: こんなものまで頂いたら、今度お返し{1:せずには済まない}ですね。
sentences.translation: If you receive something great like this, you can't help but return the favor.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 先生の推薦のおかげで大学に合格できて、お礼を言わ{1:ずには済まない}。
sentences.translation: I can't help but say thank you to my teacher. Thanks to their recommendation, I was able to get accepted by the university.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 汚職が発覚した以上、彼は議員を辞職{1:せずには済まない}だろう。
sentences.translation: Since his involvement in corruption has been disclosed, he will definitely have to resign from being an assemblyman.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ずには済まない-ないでは済まない-zu-niwa-sumanai-nai-dewa-sumanai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女は美人で英語もぺらぺらだし、とても私{1:とは比べものにならない}です。
sentences.translation: She is beautiful and fluent in English, so I can't even compare to her.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: 私の料理はお母さん{1:とは比べものにならない}。
sentences.translation: My cooking skill cannot compare with my mother's.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: 今の車の性能は、昔{1:とは比べものにならない}。
sentences.translation: Cars these days are much more fuel efficient than they were in the past.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: 彼はとても優秀で、お前{1:とは比べものにならない}よ。
sentences.translation: He is so outstanding, how can he be compared to you.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: 例年{1:とは比べものにならない}ほど楽しい夏休みを過ごした。
sentences.translation: I had a summer vacation that was incomparably more enjoyable than usual.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: 彼の練習の時間は、他の選手{1:とは比べものにならない}。
sentences.translation: His practice time is incomparable to other players.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: 地球は, 大きさでは, 木星{1:とは比べものにならない}。
sentences.translation: The Earth is incomparable to Jupiter in size.
contexts: とは比べものにならない

sentences.sentence: このストーリーはただの笑い話{1:では済まされない}と思うところがある。
sentences.translation: I don't think this story is just a funny story.

sentences.sentence: どんな言語を学ぶにしても辞書なし{1:では済まない}。
sentences.translation: Whatever language you study, you cannot do without dictionary.

sentences.sentence: あなたが彼女に言ったことは、冗談{1:では済まされない}。
sentences.translation: What you said to her isn’t acceptable as "just a joke".

sentences.sentence: 自分にとっては冗談のつもりでも、相手にとっては冗談{1:では済まされない}場合もある。
sentences.translation: There are times where it may just be a joke for you, but it's not a joke for the other person.

sentences.sentence: インフルエンザが流行してるこの時期、私たちも他人事{1:では済まされない}。
sentences.translation: At this time of the flu epidemic, we can't ignore it and leave it alone.

sentences.sentence: 会社の情報を売ろうとした社員は、処分なし{1:では済まない}でしょう。
sentences.translation: Employees who intend to sell company information will certainly not get away without being punished.

sentences.sentence: この近辺で連続不審火が相次いでおり、偶然{1:では済まされない}事態だ。
sentences.translation: A series of suspicious fires occurred consecutively in this area, this cannot pass as a simple coincidence.

sentences.sentence: 私にはそれが真実{1:か否か}が分からない。
sentences.translation: I don't know whether that is true or not.

sentences.sentence: 彼が成功する{1:か否か}は、彼の努力次第だ。
sentences.translation: Whether he succeeds or not depends on his efforts.

sentences.sentence: 自分の日本語が皆さんに理解される{1:か否か}不安だ。
sentences.translation: I'm worried whether or not my Japanese will be understood by everyone.

sentences.sentence: ダイエット中だけどケーキを食べる{1:か否か}迷っている。
sentences.translation: I'm on a diet now and am struggling with whether or not I should eat cake.

sentences.sentence: 私たちは彼が必要{1:であるか否か}判断します。
sentences.translation: We will decide whether he is necessary or not.

sentences.sentence: 僕たちは大学へ行くべき{1:か否か}を決めかねている。
sentences.translation: We cannot decide whether we should go to college or not.

sentences.sentence: 私はクラスのパーティーを参加する{1:か否か}まだ決めていない。
sentences.translation: I haven't decided yet whether to attend the class party or not.

sentences.sentence: 子供{1:ではあるまいし}、泣くのはやめなさい。
sentences.translation: Stop crying! You are not a child.

sentences.sentence: 新入社員{1:ではあるまいし}、基本的なことは説明する必要ないと思います。
sentences.translation: You're not a new employee, so I don't think I need to explain the basics.

sentences.sentence: お金持ち{1:じゃあるまいし}、そんな高価なものは買えません。
sentences.translation: It's not like I'm rich, so I can't buy such an expensive item.

sentences.sentence: 一生会えなくなるわけ{1:じゃあるまいし}、そんなに悲しまないでよ。
sentences.translation: It's not like you won't be able to meet for the rest of your life, so don't be so sad.

sentences.sentence: 面接試験は初めて{1:ではあるまいし}、どうしてそんなに緊張するの？
sentences.translation: It’s not like you are having your first interview, so why are you so nervous?

sentences.sentence: 夏{1:じゃあるまいし}、この冬にTシャツ1枚で外出するなんて、頭がどうかしているよ。
sentences.translation: You must be crazy going out in the middle of winter in a T-shirt. It's not summer, you know.

sentences.sentence: 野菜が体にいいのはわかるが、馬{1:じゃあるまいし}こんなにたくさんは食べられない。
sentences.translation: I know vegetables are good for the body, but I'm not a horse and I can't eat that much.

sentences.sentence: 結婚は早いもの勝つわけ{1:ではあるまいし}、自分に合う相手をちゃんと選んだ方がいいよ。
sentences.translation: Marriage is not on a first come first served basis. You should choose the person that is right for you.

sentences.sentence: 彼女に対するこの気持ちは、愛{1:でなくてなんだろう}。
sentences.translation: The feeling of mine for her must be love.

sentences.sentence: 子供のために病気になるまで働くとは、親の愛{1:でなくてなんだろう}。
sentences.translation: Working to the point of sickness for the sake of one's child is nothing other than parental love.

sentences.sentence: 彼は裁判で無罪を主張しているが、彼のやったことは殺人で{1:でなくてなんだろう}。
sentences.translation: He is claiming to be innocent in court, but what he did was clearly murder.

sentences.sentence: あの政治家のやったことは汚職{1:でなくてなんだろう}。
sentences.translation: What that politician did was definitely corrupt.

sentences.sentence: 友達は飛行機で隣に座った人と結婚したそうだ。これが運命{1:でなくてなんだろう}。
sentences.translation: My friend married the person he was sitting next to on the plane. This must be fate.

sentences.sentence: 写真ではイケメンだったのに、実物は全然違うなんて、詐欺{1:でなくてなんだろう}か。
sentences.translation: In the picture, he looks handsome, but the reality is completely different, isn't that a scam?

sentences.sentence: 彼の押し付けがましい態度、それは愛を求める声{1:でなくてなんだろう}。
sentences.translation: His intrusive attitude is nothing other than a call for love.

sentences.sentence: JLPT N1に合格す{1:べく}、毎日頑張って勉強しています。
sentences.translation: I am studying hard every day to pass JLPT N1.

sentences.sentence: 親の期待に応える{1:べく}、努力して医者の道に進んだ。
sentences.translation: I made an effort to meet the expectations of my parents and went on to become a doctor.

sentences.sentence: 彼は良い席を手に入れる{1:べく}、2時間も前から並んでいた。
sentences.translation: He had been in line for two hours to get a good seat.

sentences.sentence: 人手不足という問題を解決す{1:べく}、社内で緊急会議が開かれた。
sentences.translation: An emergency meeting was held in-house to solve the problem of labor shortage.

sentences.sentence: 彼は一日も早く借金を返す{1:べく}、必死で働いている。
sentences.translation: He is working hard to pay off his debt as soon as possible.

sentences.sentence: 花見の場所を確保す{1:べく}、友達が早朝に公園へ向かった。
sentences.translation: A friend went to the park early in the morning to secure a place for cherry blossom viewing.

sentences.sentence: 娘の野菜嫌いを克服す{1:べく}、色々な調理法を試しているところだ。
sentences.translation: I'm trying various cooking methods to overcome my daughter's dislike of vegetables.

sentences.sentence: 新商品を海外でも販売す{1:べく}、英語訳がついた説明書を作っています。
sentences.translation: We are making an instruction manual with an English translation so that we can sell new products overseas.

sentences.sentence: 優勝できたのは、チーム全員の協力あれ{1:ばこそ}だ。
sentences.translation: We could only win because of our teamwork.

sentences.sentence: 家族を愛すれ{1:ばこそ}、自分が犠牲になることなどは恐れない。
sentences.translation: Because I love my family, I’m not afraid to sacrifice myself.

sentences.sentence: 子供のためを思え{1:ばこそ}、費用は子ども自身に用意させたのです。
sentences.translation: I made my children pay for their own expenses because I think it’s good for them.

sentences.sentence: 自分の努力を認めてくれる人がいれ{1:ばこそ}、やる気も出てくるというものだ。
sentences.translation: Only if there are people who acknowledge their efforts will they be motivated.

sentences.sentence: 忙しけれ{1:ばこそ}、時間の使い方が上手になってくるものだ。
sentences.translation: The more busy you are, the better you will be at using your time.

sentences.sentence: 夜中に一人で歩いて帰れるのも、この街が安全であれ{1:ばこそ}だ。
sentences.translation: You can walk home alone in the middle of the night only if the city is safe.

sentences.sentence: 娘の将来を思え{1:ばこそ}、彼との結婚には賛成できない。
sentences.translation: I can't agree to marry him because of my daughter's future.

sentences.sentence: 彼は勉強をせずに毎日遊んでばかりいた。N１合格は望む{1:べくもない}。
sentences.translation: He just played every day without studying. There is no hope of passing N1.

sentences.sentence: 祖父の病状は悪くなるばかりだ。回復はもう望む{1:べくもない}。
sentences.translation: My grandfather's condition is only getting worse. There is no hope for recovery anymore.

sentences.sentence: すでに5点も差があるので、この試合に勝つのは望む{1:べくもない}。
sentences.translation: There is already a difference of 5 points, so I can't hope to win this match.

sentences.sentence: 東京生まれと育ちの彼には、田舎暮らしの大変さなど知る{1:べくもない}。
sentences.translation: Born and raised in Tokyo, he doesn't know how difficult life in the countryside is.

sentences.sentence: プロとは比べる{1:べくもない}ですが、彼の歌のうまさは学校の一番だと思います。
sentences.translation: It's hard to compare with a professional, but I think his singing is the best at school.

sentences.sentence: ビートルズとは比べる{1:べくもない}が、彼らは日本ではかなり有名なバンドです。
sentences.translation: It's hard to compare to the Beatles, but they are a pretty famous band in Japan.

sentences.sentence: 日本社会における少子高齢化が大きな問題であることは疑う{1:べくもない}。
sentences.translation: There is no doubt that the declining birthrate and aging population in Japanese society is a major problem.

sentences.sentence: この調子なら、今年の売り上げ目標を達成できる{1:のではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: If this is the case, I wonder if we can reach our sales target this year.

sentences.sentence: 天気予報で今日は天気が悪いと言っていたが、雨は降らない{1:のではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: The weather forecast said that the weather would be bad today, but I wonder if it's not going to rain.

sentences.sentence: 道がすごい渋滞だね。約束の時間に間に合わない{1:のではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: The road is very congested. I wonder if we won't make it in time (to the promised time).

sentences.sentence: 100万円宝くじが当たるなんて夢{1:ではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: Isn't it a dream to win a 1 million yen lottery?

sentences.sentence: 上司は僕のチームの意見に反対する{1:のではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if my boss disagrees with my team's opinion.

sentences.sentence: 私がノーベル賞をもらえるなんて、夢{1:ではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: Isn't it a dream that I received the Nobel Prize?

sentences.sentence: 結婚したら名前を変えなければならないのは、変{1:なのではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: Isn't it strange that you have to change your name when you get married?

sentences.sentence: 親世代の教育に対する考え方はもう古い{1:のではあるまいか}。
sentences.translation: Isn't our parents' generation's way of thinking regarding education already a bit outdated?

sentences.sentence: {1:その上}、そのレストランは私たちのホテルからとても近い。
sentences.translation: In addition, the restaurant is very near to our hotel.

sentences.sentence: この靴の値段は高い、{1:その上}デザインも良くない。
sentences.translation: These shoes are expensive and furthermore the design is not good.

sentences.sentence: 今日は暑いです。{1:その上}湿度も高い。
sentences.translation: It's hot today, and in addition, it is also very humid.

sentences.sentence: この仕事は面白いし、{1:その上}給料がいいのです。
sentences.translation: This job is interesting, and in addition the pay is good.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は英語を出来るし、{1:その上}日本語も上手だ。
sentences.translation: She speaks English and in addition is good at Japanese.

sentences.sentence: {1:その上}、あなたは英語の授業も受ける必要があるよ。
sentences.translation: Besides, it is necessary that you take the English class.

sentences.sentence: サイクリングはいい運動になる。{1:その上}空気を汚染することもない。
sentences.translation: Cycling is good exercise. Moreover, it doesn't pollute the air.

sentences.sentence: 友人のお母さんは本当に優しい人だ。ピクニックの食べ物を準備したし、{1:その上}チケットのお金もくれた。
sentences.translation: My friend's mother is a truly kind person. She prepared food for the picnic and also gave me money for my ticket.

sentences.sentence: 彼らは{1:直ちに}彼女に手術をしなければならないだろう。
sentences.translation: They will have to operate on the woman immediately.

sentences.sentence: 私はこの仕事を{1:直ちに}しなければならない。
sentences.translation: I must do this work immediately.

sentences.sentence: 万一間違いを見つけたら、{1:直ちに}知らせてください。
sentences.translation: If you should find any mistakes, please let me know at once.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は仕事が終わって{1:直ちに}事務所を出た。
sentences.translation: She left the office immediately after work.

sentences.sentence: {1:直ちに}出発しないと、私は約束に遅れるだろう。
sentences.translation: Unless I leave right away, I'll be late for my appointment.

sentences.sentence: 彼の様子はよくないから、{1:直ちに}病院に連れていこう！
sentences.translation: He doesn't look good, so let's take him to the hospital right away.

sentences.sentence: 彼らはその計画を{1:直ちに}実行に移すべきだと提案した。
sentences.translation: They suggested that we should put the plan into practice right now.

sentences.sentence: 新型コロナウイルスに感染した人は{1:直ちに}隔離された。
sentences.translation: Individuals infected with the new coronavirus were immediately quarantined.

sentences.sentence: {1:幸い}彼は気づかなかった。
sentences.translation: Luckily, he did not notice.

sentences.sentence: {1:幸い}私は締切に間に合った。
sentences.translation: Fortunately, I was able to meet the deadline.

sentences.sentence: {1:幸いなことに}、母の心臓の手術はうまくいった。
sentences.translation: Fortunately, my mother's heart surgery went well.

sentences.sentence: {1:幸いなことに}、息子は新しい学校での生活にすぐに慣れた。
sentences.translation: Fortunately, my son quickly adjusted to life in his new school.

sentences.sentence: {1:幸いなことに}私たちは事故を避けることができた。
sentences.translation: Fortunately, we were able to avoid an accident.

sentences.sentence: 近所で火事が起きたが、その家の人たちは{1:幸い}無事だった。
sentences.translation: A fire broke out in the neighborhood, but luckily the people in that house were fine.

sentences.sentence: {1:幸い}大過なく仕事を終わらせることができた。
sentences.translation: Fortunately, I was able to finish my work without any serious errors.

sentences.sentence: 私はあなたのお役に立てれば{1:幸い}です。
sentences.translation: I am happy if I can help you.

sentences.sentence: たくさん仕事をした{1:せいか}、病気になってしまった。
sentences.translation: I got sick perhaps because I worked too much

sentences.sentence: 薬を飲んだ{1:せいか}頭痛が治った。
sentences.translation: My headache has gone away, likely from the medicine I took.

sentences.sentence: 今日はお天気がよい{1:せいか}、とても眠たいです。
sentences.translation: I'm very sleepy, perhaps because of the nice weather today.

sentences.sentence: 年{1:のせいか}、最近は色んなことをよく忘れた。
sentences.translation: I forget many things recently, probably because I am aging.

sentences.sentence: 睡眠不足{1:のせいか}、目まいがした。
sentences.translation: I felt dizzy, probably because of my lack of sleep.

sentences.sentence: ストレスがいっぱいある{1:せいか}、胃が痛いです。
sentences.translation: My stomach hurts, probably because I have a lot of stress.

sentences.sentence: 今朝は薬を飲んだ{1:せいか}、眠たくなった。
sentences.translation: I became sleepy, probably because of the medicine I took this morning.

sentences.sentence: 暑い{1:せいか}、食欲がないです。
sentences.translation: I don't have an appetite now, probably because of the hot weather.

sentences.sentence: 昨夜お酒をたくさん飲んだ{1:せいか}、今日は気分が悪い。
sentences.translation: I feel sick today, probably because I drink a lot of sake last night.

sentences.sentence: 来週、日本語のテストがある{1:せいか}、何だか落ち着かない。
sentences.translation: Perhaps of the Japanese test next week, I can't seem to settle down.

sentences.sentence: {1:それにしても}あなたは絵が上手ですね。
sentences.translation: At any rate, I think you are great at drawing.

sentences.sentence: {1:それにしても}私はあなたが優秀だと思います。
sentences.translation: At any rate, I think you are exceptional.

sentences.sentence: 今日は早く帰ると言ったが、{1:それにしても}8時半まで残業した。
sentences.translation: He said he would return home early today, but even so he worked overtime until 8:30.

sentences.sentence: {1:それにしても}あなたは遅くまで働くつもりですか。
sentences.translation: Even so, do you still plan to work until late?

sentences.sentence: 彼女がちょっと遅刻すると言ったが、{1:それにしても}遅くない？
sentences.translation: She said she would be a little late, but even so, isn't she too late?

sentences.sentence: 日本の夏はいつも蒸し暑いですよ。{1:それにしても}今年はずいぶん蒸し暑いですね。
sentences.translation: The Japanese summer is always muggy. Even so, this year is especially muggy.

sentences.sentence: 今日は早く帰ってねと伝えたけど、{1:それにしても}彼がいつも同じ時間に帰った。
sentences.translation: I asked him to return home early today, but nevertheless he ended up coming home at the same time as usual.

sentences.sentence: 彼らは彼がそれを解決するのに手を貸しているが、{1:それにしても}難問だ。
sentences.translation: They are helping him to solve it, but, all the same, it is a hard problem.

sentences.sentence: こんな暑い天気でピクニックするなんて、{1:少しも}楽しく{1:ない}よ。
sentences.translation: Having a picnic in such hot weather isn't fun at all.

sentences.sentence: この町は10年前と{1:少しも}変わら{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: This town hasn't changed much from 10 years ago.

sentences.sentence: あなたは{1:少しも}日本語が読め{1:ない}のですか。
sentences.translation: You can't read Japanese even a little?

sentences.sentence: 私は彼の言うことは{1:少しも}理解でき{1:なかった}。
sentences.translation: I could not make any sense of what he said.

sentences.sentence: そんな冗談は僕には{1:少しも}面白く{1:ない}よ。
sentences.translation: That kind of joke isn't one bit funny to me.

sentences.sentence: その薬は私には{1:少しも}効か{1:なかった}。
sentences.translation: The medicine had no effect on me.

sentences.sentence: 彼が刑事になった事は{1:少しも}不思議で{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: It's no surprise that he became a detective.

sentences.sentence: 昨日の手術は彼女に{1:少しも}苦痛を与え{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: She doesn't have any pain from her surgery yesterday.

sentences.sentence: 入院{1:を契機に}、今後はできるだけ毎日運動しようと思った。
sentences.translation: As a result of my hospitalization, I am thinking to work out as much as possible every day from now on.

sentences.sentence: 入社試験に落ちたの{1:を契機に}英会話の勉強を始めた。
sentences.translation: I made the best of failing the company entrance exam and started studying English conversation.

sentences.sentence: 父は病気{1:を契機に}お酒を辞めました。
sentences.translation: My father's illness helped him to quit drinking alcohol.

sentences.sentence: 昨年の事故{1:を契機として}、安全対策を強化された。
sentences.translation: Safety measures have been strengthened as a result of last year's accident.

sentences.sentence: もうすぐタバコの値上がりになるので、これ{1:を契機に}辞めることにしました。
sentences.translation: Soon the prices of cigarettes will go up, so I decided to take this as an opportunity to quit.

sentences.sentence: 夫は病気{1:を契機に}食生活を見直したり、運動したりするようになった。
sentences.translation: As a result of my husband's illness, he started improving his diet and working out.

sentences.sentence: 子供の病気になったの{1:を契機に}、健康管理をもっと注意するようにします。
sentences.translation: I will learn from this experience of my child getting sick and be more cautious about health management moving forward.

sentences.sentence: 勤めていた会社が倒産したの{1:を契機に}独立することにしました。
sentences.translation: I decided to become independent after the company I worked for went bankrupt.

sentences.sentence: 金曜日は{1:お}ひまですか？
sentences.translation: Are you free on Friday?

sentences.sentence: 今日の{1:ご}気分はどうですか。
sentences.translation: How do you feel today?

sentences.sentence: {1:お}兄さんと一緒に行った。

sentences.sentence: 今は悲しん{1:でいる場合ではない}。
sentences.translation: This is no time to be sad.

sentences.sentence: 冗談を言っ{1:ている場合じゃない}！
sentences.translation: This is no time to be saying jokes!

sentences.sentence: しっかりして！泣い{1:ている場合ではない}。
sentences.translation: Hold yourself together! This is not a time to be crying.

sentences.sentence: 今、ゆっくり休ん{1:でいる場合じゃない}ぞ！やることがたくさんあるんだ。
sentences.translation: Now is not the time to be relaxing! There are a ton of things that need to get done.

sentences.sentence: 今は携帯を触っ{1:ている場合じゃない}。早く宿題をやりなさい。
sentences.translation: This is no time to be touching your smartphone. Hurry up and do your homework.

sentences.sentence: もうすぐ大学の試験でしょう。今は遊ん{1:でいる場合じゃない}よ。
sentences.translation: You have your university exam coming up soon, right? This is no time for you to be playing around.

sentences.sentence: 行くかどうか迷っ{1:ている場合じゃない}よ。そんなことしてたら、すぐにチケットは売り切れちゃうよ。
sentences.translation: This is no time to be worrying about going or not. If we take too long, the tickets are gonna sell out!

sentences.sentence: 私が困っているとき、彼女は{1:わざわざ}助けてくれた。
sentences.translation: She went out of her way to help me when I was in trouble.

sentences.sentence: あなたは{1:わざわざ}私の為にそれを買ってくれたのですか？
sentences.translation: Did you buy that just for me?

sentences.sentence: {1:わざわざ}遠い所から会いにきてくれてありがとう。
sentences.translation: Thanks for going out of your way to see me from so far away.

sentences.sentence: 彼は忙しいだが、{1:わざわざ}市内の観光を案内してくれた。
sentences.translation: He is very busy, but he took some time to show me around the tourist spots in the city.

sentences.sentence: 友達は恋人に会いたいから、{1:わざわざ}ニューヨークへ行った。
sentences.translation: My friend really wanted to see his girlfriend, so he went all the way to New York.

sentences.sentence: {1:わざわざ}駅まで送ってくれなくてもいいよ。
sentences.translation: You don't need to trouble yourself to see me off to the station.

sentences.sentence: 彼があんな遠くから{1:わざわざ}訪ねてきてくれて本当に嬉しかった。
sentences.translation: I was really glad he came all the way here to visit from such a far distance.

sentences.sentence: 予約だったら、{1:わざわざ}店に行かなくても、電話１本で済むよ。
sentences.translation: If you need to make a reservation, there's no need to go all the way to the shop, it can be done with just 1 phone call.

sentences.sentence: そこへ行っ{1:てもしかたがない}。
sentences.translation: It is no use going there.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: こんなことをしてい{1:ても仕方がない}だろう。
sentences.translation: I don't think this will get us anywhere.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: どうにもならないことを、悩んでい{1:てもしょうがない}よ。
sentences.translation: There's no point in worrying about things beyond our control.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 全然勉強していないんだから、落ち{1:てもしかたない}よ。
sentences.translation: I haven't been studying at all, so there's no helping it if I end up failing.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: そんなに健康のことを心配し{1:ても仕方がない}。
sentences.translation: There is no sense in your worrying about your health so much.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: テストは明日だし、今から焦って勉強し{1:てもしかたがない}。
sentences.translation: The test is tomorrow, so it's no use to get flustered and start studying now.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今日中に結論はでないだろうし、これ以上続け{1:てもしかたあるまい}。
sentences.translation: The conclusion will likely not be reached today, so there's no point to continue on like this.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 空席があるのに立ってい{1:てもしょうがない}。
sentences.translation: There is no sense in standing when there are seats available.
contexts: てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てもしょうがない・ても仕方がない-temo-shou-ga-nai-temo-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 空が急に暗くなってきた{1:かと思うと}、雨が降ってきた。
sentences.translation: No sooner had the sky turned dark, when it started to rain.

sentences.sentence: 娘が帰って来た{1:かと思うと}、すぐに家を出ていった。
sentences.translation: Just as my daughter returned home, she was out the door again.

sentences.sentence: うちの近くの公園の花が咲いた{1:かと思ったら}、もう散ってしまった。
sentences.translation: No sooner than the flowers were starting to bloom at our nearby park, the pedals had fallen.

sentences.sentence: 息子が勉強を始めた{1:かと思ったら}、リビングでドラマを見ている。
sentences.translation: No sooner than my son had started studying, he was already in the living room watching TV.

sentences.sentence: 彼は食事を始めた{1:かと思ったら}寝てしまった。
sentences.translation: Just when he thought he would start eating he fell asleep.

sentences.sentence: 日曜日なのに、お父さんは忙しそうだね。さっき戻った{1:かと思うと}、また出かけて行った。
sentences.translation: Even though it is Sunday, father seems very busy. No sooner than he returned a moment ago, he was already out the door again.

sentences.sentence: さっきまで笑っていた{1:かと思ったら}、急に泣き出してしまった。
sentences.translation: I was laughing until just a moment ago when I suddenly started crying.

sentences.sentence: この時期は、晴れていた{1:かと思うと}、急に雨が降り出すことが多いから、傘をもっていったほうがいい。
sentences.translation: At this time of year it can be sunny and start raining before you know it, so you had best bring an umbrella with you.

sentences.sentence: この学校{1:は}フットボールが強い{1:ことで有名}です。
sentences.translation: This school is famous for being strong in football.

sentences.sentence: 京都{1:は}古いお寺がある{1:ことで有名}だ。
sentences.translation: Kyoto is famous for its old temples.

sentences.sentence: 日本{1:は}電子製品{1:で有名}です。
sentences.translation: Japan is famous for electric appliances.

sentences.sentence: あのレストラン{1:は}値段が安い{1:ことで有名}です。
sentences.translation: That restaurant is famous for its low prices.

sentences.sentence: 彼{1:は}珍しい動物をたくさん飼っている{1:ことで有名}です。
sentences.translation: He is famous for raising many rare animals.

sentences.sentence: この町{1:は}温泉{1:で有名}ですよ。時間があれば行ってみてください。
sentences.translation: This town is famous for its hot springs. Please go if you have time.

sentences.sentence: ハワイ{1:は}新婚旅行やバカンスの所{1:で有名}ですね。
sentences.translation: Hawaii is famous for honeymoons and vacations.

sentences.sentence: その動物園{1:は}、日本で一番パンダが多い{1:ことで有名}です。
sentences.translation: That zoo is famous for having the most pandas in Japan.

sentences.sentence: 彼女の料理は見た目{1:は別として}、味はとても美味しい。
sentences.translation: Apart from the appearance, her food tastes very good.

sentences.sentence: 天気{1:は別として}、それは楽しいピクニックだった。
sentences.translation: Apart from the weather, it was a fun picnic.

sentences.sentence: 大雨や大雪の日{1:は別として}、私は毎日ランニングをしている。
sentences.translation: Apart from days with heavy rain and heavy snow, I run every day.

sentences.sentence: 野球{1:は別として}私はすべてのスポーツが好きだ。
sentences.translation: I like all sports, aside from baseball.

sentences.sentence: 合格できる{1:かどうかは別として}、チャレンジしてみることは大切だ。
sentences.translation: Regardless of whether or not you can pass, it's important to challenge yourself.

sentences.sentence: 彼は時々出張すること{1:は別として}あまり旅をしない。
sentences.translation: He doesn't travel much apart from occasional business trips.

sentences.sentence: 値段{1:は別として}、そのドレスは私に似合わない。
sentences.translation: Putting the cost aside, that dress doesn't suit me.

sentences.sentence: 休みの日{1:は別として}、この電車にはいつも学生の乗客が多い。
sentences.translation: Apart from holidays, this train always has a lot of student passengers.

sentences.sentence: この会社の給料{1:は別として}、職場環境は本当に良い。
sentences.translation: Aside from this company's salary, the work environment is really good.

sentences.sentence: 今日は曇っている{1:上に}風が強いので、とても寒く感じられる。
sentences.translation: Today in addition to being cloudy, the wind is strong and so it feels very cold.

sentences.sentence: この店の料理はおいしい。{1:その上}、値段も安いのでいつもお客さんが多い。
sentences.translation: This restaurant's food is delicious. In addition, the prices are cheap so there are always a lot of customers.

sentences.sentence: このパソコンは安い{1:上に}、機能も多いので、最近とても売れている。
sentences.translation: This computer is not only cheap, but it has a lot of functionality, so lately it has been selling very well.

sentences.sentence: この手続きは、面倒な{1:上に}時間もかかるので、皆がいやがっている。
sentences.translation: This procedure is troublesome and time consuming so everyone hates it.

sentences.sentence: この町は、地下鉄が通った{1:上に}、デパートもできて、便利になった。
sentences.translation: This town has become convenient now is connected by subway and in addition has built some department stores.

sentences.sentence: この仕事は危険な{1:上に}、給料も低いし、最悪だ。
sentences.translation: This job is not only dangerous, but the salary is low, so it's pretty much the worst.

sentences.sentence: この本は漢字が多い{1:上に}、字が小さいので子どもには読みにくいです。
sentences.translation: This book has a lot of kanji, and to top things off the characters are small so it is difficult for children to read.

sentences.sentence: あの建物のトイレは汚い{1:上に}、いつもトイレットペーパーがないので、あまり行きたくない。
sentences.translation: That building not only has a dirty bathroom, but there is never any toilet paper so I don't really want to go there.

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}どうしよう。
sentences.translation: What shall I do now?

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}クイズの時間です。
sentences.translation: Now it's time for a quiz.

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}、お昼にしましょう。
sentences.translation: Well, let's have lunch.

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}この人は誰でしょうか。
sentences.translation: Then, who is this person?

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}本題にはいろうか。
sentences.translation: Well, let's get down to business.

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}やってみるとなるとなかなか難しいものだ。
sentences.translation: When one comes to doing it, one finds it rather difficult.

sentences.sentence: {1:さてさて}、やっかいな事になったものだ。
sentences.translation: Well then, things have become quite troublesome..

sentences.sentence: {1:さて}本論に戻りたいと思います。
sentences.translation: Now I'd like to go back to the main topic.

sentences.sentence: {1:しばらく}ここで待てください。
sentences.translation: Please wait here for a while.

sentences.sentence: こんにちは。{1:しばらく}ですね！
sentences.translation: Hello, it's been a while!

sentences.sentence: 私は{1:しばらく}暇です。
sentences.translation: I have free time for a while.

sentences.sentence: {1:しばらく}考える時間をください。
sentences.translation: Please give me some time to think about it.

sentences.sentence: {1:しばらく}お待ちくださいますか？
sentences.translation: Could you please wait for a moment?

sentences.sentence: 来年から{1:しばらく}海外に住むつもりです。
sentences.translation: From next year, I plan to live abroad for a while.

sentences.sentence: 祖父は{1:しばらく}前に亡くなりました。
sentences.translation: My grandfather passed away some time ago

sentences.sentence: どんなに辛いことがあっても、家族のために{1:しばらく}は耐えねばならない。
sentences.translation: No matter how tough things get, we have to endure it for the time being for the family.

sentences.sentence: 外国語を勉強する{1:上で}辞書はなくてはならないものだ。
sentences.translation: In order to study a foreign language, you need to have a dictionary.

sentences.sentence: 仕事をする{1:上で}大切なのは、周りとのコミュニケーションです。
sentences.translation: In order to do one's job, what's important is communication with those around you.

sentences.sentence: この薬は説明書をよく読ん{1:だ上で}、ご使用ください。
sentences.translation: Please use this medicine after reading the instructions carefully.

sentences.sentence: 実物を見{1:た上で}買うかどうか決めるつもりだ。
sentences.translation: Once I see the real thing in person, I will decide whether to buy or not.

sentences.sentence: 留学の件は家族と相談し{1:た上で}ご返事いたします。
sentences.translation: Regarding the study abroad, once you consult with your family I will give my answer.

sentences.sentence: 工事計画は、周辺住民との話し合い{1:の上で}決められるべきだ。
sentences.translation: The construction plan should be decided after discussing with the local residents.

sentences.sentence: 契約の内容をご確認{1:の上で}、サインをお願いいたします。
sentences.translation: Please sign once you confirm the contents of the contract.

sentences.sentence: 予約の時間を確認{1:の上で}、ご来店ください。
sentences.translation: Please visit us after confirming the reservation time.

sentences.sentence: この書類に署名{1:の上}、窓口に提出してください。
sentences.translation: Please sign these papers and bring them to the counter.

sentences.sentence: 規則{1:の上では}彼はまだ学生だ。
sentences.translation: According to the rules, he is still a student.

sentences.sentence: 彼は仕事{1:の上では}私の先輩だ。
sentences.translation: He has more experience on the job than I do.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は健康{1:上の}理由で学校をやめた。
sentences.translation: She quit school for health reasons.

sentences.sentence: 法律{1:上}、日本人は二十歳にならないとタバコを吸ったり、お酒を飲んだりできない。
sentences.translation: According to the law, Japanese people cannot smoke or drink until they turn 20 years old.

sentences.sentence: ニュース{1:の上では}、市役所の前で大変な事故が起こった。
sentences.translation: According to the news, a terrible accident occurred in front of the city hall.

sentences.sentence: この図{1:の上では}、去年と比べたら今年の売上が下がっています。
sentences.translation: According to this figure, compared to last year, profits this year are decreasing.

sentences.sentence: この本のすべての登場人物は想像{1:上の}ものです。
sentences.translation: All the characters in this book are imaginary.

sentences.sentence: このテレビ番組は子供の教育{1:上}よくない。
sentences.translation: This TV show is not good for children's education.

sentences.sentence: 子どものころはよく川で遊ん{1:だものだ}。
sentences.translation: When I was a child, I often played at the river.

sentences.sentence: 学生時代は毎日図書館へ通っ{1:たものだ}。
sentences.translation: When I was a student, I used to go to the library everyday.

sentences.sentence: 子供の時は、よく友達とテニスをし{1:たものだ}。
sentences.translation: When I was a child, I often played tennis with my friends.

sentences.sentence: 日本へ留学した時、すしをよく食べ{1:たものだ}。
sentences.translation: When I studied abroad in Japan, I often ate sushi.

sentences.sentence: 子供の頃は寝る前に母はいつも本を読んでくれ{1:たものだ}。
sentences.translation: When I was a child, my mother would always read a book to me before going to sleep.

sentences.sentence: 高校生の時は、よく友達とサッカーをし{1:たものだ}。
sentences.translation: During my high school days, I often played soccer with my friends.

sentences.sentence: 若いころはゲームセンターによく行っ{1:たものだ}けど、最近は行かなくなった。
sentences.translation: When I was young, I would often go to arcades, but lately I haven't gone..

sentences.sentence: 大学生の時は、よく友達と朝までカラオケをし{1:たものだ}。
sentences.translation: When I was a university student, I often sang karaoke with my friends until morning.

sentences.sentence: やると決めたことは最後まで{1:やり通す}べきだ。
sentences.translation: When you decide to do something, you should see it through to the end.

sentences.sentence: 終電を出てしまったので、１時間かけて家まで{1:歩き通した}。
sentences.translation: The last train left, so I walked home for an hour.

sentences.sentence: 50メートル以上前方を{1:見通すこと}が難しかった。
sentences.translation: It was hard to see more than 50 meters ahead.

sentences.sentence: ひと晩{1:飲み通しに}飲んだ。
sentences.translation: We kept drinking all night.

sentences.sentence: こんな長い小説は一日で{1:読み通せない}。
sentences.translation: You can't read such a long novel in a day.

sentences.sentence: 上司にバレないように、仕事のミスを{1:隠し通した}。
sentences.translation: In order to not have my boss find out, I covered up my mistake at work.

sentences.sentence: 今日のハイキングは長かった。山頂まで４時間{1:歩き通した}。
sentences.translation: Today's hiking was long. I hiked continually for 4 hours to the peak.

sentences.sentence: 追い求めると決めた夢は最後まで{1:追い求め通す}つもりだ。
sentences.translation: I plan to pursue the dream I decided on pursuing until the end.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降る{1:といけないから}傘を持って行きなさい。
sentences.translation: It would be no good if it rains, so please take an umbrella with you.

sentences.sentence: バスに乗り遅れる{1:といけないから}、すぐ出発したほうがいい。
sentences.translation: You'd better head out right away so you don't miss the bus.

sentences.sentence: 道に迷う{1:といけないから}、地図をもって行きなさい。
sentences.translation: Take a map with you in case you get lost.

sentences.sentence: 彼が怒っ{1:てはいけないから}本当の事は言わなかった。
sentences.translation: I didn't tell him the truth for fear he would be angry.

sentences.sentence: 風邪を引く{1:といけないから}、マフラーをして出かけなさい。
sentences.translation: Please wear a scarf when you go out so that you don't catch a cold.

sentences.sentence: 彼は寝てしまう{1:といけないから}、ブラックコーヒーを何杯も飲んだ。
sentences.translation: He drank multiple cups of black coffee so as not to fall asleep.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は体重が増え{1:てはいけないから}ダイエットをしている。
sentences.translation: She is on a diet in order to not gain weight.

sentences.sentence: 失敗する{1:といけないから}予備にするものが必要だ。
sentences.translation: It would not be good if we fail, so we need to take some proper preparations.

sentences.sentence: もっと{1:具体的な}アイディアを出してください。
sentences.translation: Please give more specific ideas.

sentences.sentence: これは{1:政治的な}集会だ。
sentences.translation: This is a political meeting.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は{1:金銭的な}理由で退学しました。
sentences.translation: She dropped out of school for monetary reasons.

sentences.sentence: 私は{1:基本的に}なんでも食べます。
sentences.translation: Basically, I eat everything.

sentences.sentence: {1:健康的に}こういう食べ物は体に良くないよ。
sentences.translation: Health-wise, these kinds of foods are not good for the body.

sentences.sentence: その考え方は{1:論理的に}ダメだと思いますよ。
sentences.translation: Logically, I think that way of thinking is not good.

sentences.sentence: 私は仕事を辞めてから{1:精神的に}とても楽になった。
sentences.translation: I've been very relaxed mentally since I quit my job.

sentences.sentence: その言葉は{1:一般的に}会話で使われていないよ。
sentences.translation: That word is generally not used in conversation.

sentences.sentence: 日本は{1:経済的に}強力な国家になった。
sentences.translation: Japan has economically become a powerful nation.

sentences.sentence: そんなこと、私には{1:とても}出来{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: There's no way I could do something like that.

sentences.sentence: この本の漢字は難しいので私には{1:とても}読め{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: The kanji in this book is difficult so I can barely read it.

sentences.sentence: 20万円の携帯電話など、{1:とても}買え{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: There's no way I can buy something like a 200,000 yen cellphone.

sentences.sentence: 彼女がせっかく作ってくれたから、甘いものが嫌いなんて、{1:とても}言え{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: Since she went through the trouble of making it for me, I couldn't possibly tell her I don't like sweets.

sentences.sentence: 一度にこんなにたくさんの単語は{1:とても}覚えられ{1:ません}。
sentences.translation: I could not possibly memorize so much vocabulary at once.

sentences.sentence: 歯が痛くてご飯は{1:とても}食べられ{1:なかった}。
sentences.translation: My tooth hurt and so I could hardly eat anything.

sentences.sentence: こんな難しい問題は私だけで{1:とても}解け{1:ません}。
sentences.translation: I can't solve this kind of difficult problem just by myself.

sentences.sentence: 明日までに、１０ページ分の漢字を全部覚えるなんて{1:とても}でき{1:ない}。
sentences.translation: There's no way I can memorize 10 pages worth of kanji by tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 料理がおいしくて{1:つい}食べ過ぎた。
