sentences.sentence: 友情は、他の何{1:よりも}大切だ。
sentences.translation: Friendship is more important than anything else.

sentences.sentence: 私は猫{1:より}、犬{1:のほうが}好きです。
sentences.translation: I like dogs more than cats.

sentences.sentence: 昨日{1:より}今日{1:の方が}暑いです。
sentences.translation: It's hotter today than it was yesterday.

sentences.sentence: 彼女{1:より}、君{1:の方が}きれいだよ。
sentences.translation: You're more beautiful than she is.

sentences.sentence: 日本語を読む{1:より}、話す{1:方が}上手だ。
sentences.translation: I'm better at speaking Japanese than I am at reading it.

sentences.sentence: 遅く寝る{1:より}、早く寝た{1:方が}いいですよ。
sentences.translation: Going to bed earlier is better than going to bed late.

sentences.sentence: 台湾{1:より}、北海道{1:の方が}大きいです。
sentences.translation: Hokkaido is bigger than Taiwan.

sentences.sentence: 日本語{1:より}英語{1:の方が}難しいと思う。
sentences.translation: I think English is more difficult than Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 自転車{1:の方が}車{1:より}便利だと思います。
sentences.translation: I think bicycles are more convenient than cars.

sentences.sentence: 家族{1:より}仕事{1:の方が}大切だと思う人と結婚したくない。
sentences.translation: I don't want to marry someone who thinks work is more important than family.

sentences.sentence: 今日{1:より}、毎日日本語を勉強します。
sentences.translation: From today, I will study Japanese everyday.

sentences.sentence: 昨日、山田さん{1:より}お電話を頂きました。
sentences.translation: I received a call from Mr. Yamada yesterday.

sentences.sentence: 心{1:より}感謝します。
sentences.translation: I truly appreciate it (from my heart)

sentences.sentence: 授業は9月1日{1:より}開始です。
sentences.translation: Classes start from the 1st of September.

sentences.sentence: 来週の水曜日{1:より}、大阪に出張します。
sentences.translation: From next Wednesday I will be going on a business trip to Osaka.

sentences.sentence: 四月一日{1:より}試験を行います。
sentences.translation: The exam will be held from April 1st.

sentences.sentence: 去年{1:より}日本語が上手になりましたね。
sentences.translation: Your Japanese has improved a lot from last year.

sentences.sentence: 何を飲みたい{1:んです}か。
sentences.translation: What would you like to drink?

sentences.sentence: お茶を飲みたい{1:んです}。
sentences.translation: I'd like to drink some tea.

sentences.sentence: 眠くない{1:んです}か。
sentences.translation: Aren't you sleepy?

sentences.sentence: 気分が良くない{1:んです}よ。
sentences.translation: I do not feel well.

sentences.sentence: 今からバイトに行く{1:んだ}。
sentences.translation: I'm heading to my (part time) job now.

sentences.sentence: 朝に弱い{1:んだ}。
sentences.translation: I'm not a morning person.

sentences.sentence: いつか日本に行く{1:んだ}！
sentences.translation: One day I will go to Japan!

sentences.sentence: 買いたい{1:んです}がお金がない{1:んだ}。
sentences.translation: I want to buy it, but I have no money.

sentences.sentence: 今日は昨日{1:より}暑いです。
sentences.translation: Today is more hot than yesterday.

sentences.sentence: 最近、円はドル{1:より}安い。
sentences.translation: Lately the Yen is cheaper than the dollar.

sentences.sentence: 今は恋愛{1:より}仕事だ。
sentences.translation: I'm more interested in work than love right now.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は、私{1:より}料理が上手。
sentences.translation: She's better at cooking than I am.

sentences.sentence: それ{1:より}安くは売られません。
sentences.translation: I can't sell it for any less (more cheap) than that.

sentences.sentence: 今朝はいつも{1:より}早く学校へ来ました。
sentences.translation: I came to school this morning earlier than usual.

sentences.sentence: 漢字はひらがなやカタカナ{1:より}難しいだと思います。
sentences.translation: I think kanji is more difficult than hiragana and katakana.

sentences.sentence: 先月{1:より}日本語が上手になりましたね。
sentences.translation: You're Japanese has improved compared to last month. (could also interpret as since last month)

sentences.sentence: {1:より}速い速度でやってみます。
sentences.translation: I'll try it at a faster speed. (when using より before an adjective, it translates to "more"

sentences.sentence: 鋭いナイフは、{1:より}きれいに切れる。
sentences.translation: A sharpened knife cuts more cleanly.

sentences.sentence: バスは{1:まだ}来{1:ていません}。
sentences.translation: The bus still hasn't come.

sentences.sentence: {1:まだ}、決まっ{1:ていません}。
sentences.translation: It hasn't been decided yet.

sentences.sentence: 私は{1:まだ}朝ごはんを食べ{1:ていません}。
sentences.translation: I still haven't eaten breakfast yet.

sentences.sentence: 今週の新しい単語を{1:まだ}覚え{1:ていません}。
sentences.translation: I still haven't memorized this week's new vocabulary.

sentences.sentence: 父は{1:まだ}帰ってき{1:ていない}。
sentences.translation: My father still hasn't come home yet.

sentences.sentence: {1:まだ}宿題をやっ{1:ていない}。
sentences.translation: I haven't done my homework yet.

sentences.sentence: {1:まだ}明日締め切りのレポートが終わっ{1:てない}ので、遊びに行けない。
sentences.translation: I haven't finished my report due tomorrow yet, so I can't go out today.

sentences.sentence: 俺は{1:まだ}あきらめ{1:てない}んだぞ。
sentences.translation: I haven't given up yet!

sentences.sentence: 私の知っている限りでは、彼女は{1:まだ}結婚し{1:ていません}。
sentences.translation: As far as I know she's still not married.

sentences.sentence: 私は日本語を話す{1:ことができる}。
sentences.translation: I can speak Japanese.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女は歌う{1:ことができる}。
sentences.translation: She can sing.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: このナイフはどんなものでも切る{1:ことができる}よ。
sentences.translation: This knife can cut through anything.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 何も言う{1:ことができない}。
sentences.translation: I can't say anything.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私は嘘をつく{1:ことができない}。
sentences.translation: I'm not able to tell a lie.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私は日本語を学ぶ{1:ことができない}。
sentences.translation: I can't learn Japanese.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: ここからは山を見る{1:ことができます}。
sentences.translation: You can see the mountains from here.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: どこで手を洗う{1:ことができます}か？
sentences.translation: Where can I wash my hands?
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 納豆を食べる{1:ことが出来ます}か？
sentences.translation: Can you eat natto? (fermented soybeans)
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼らは私の日本語を理解する{1:ことが出来ません}でした。
sentences.translation: They couldn't understand my Japanese.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ことができる-koto-ga-dekiru-ことができますか-meaning/

sentences.sentence: たまに彼女と一緒にテニスをしに行く{1:ことがある}。
sentences.translation: Sometimes I go to play tennis with my girlfriend.

sentences.sentence: たまに自転車で通勤する{1:ことがある}。
sentences.translation: Sometimes I commute to work by bicycle.

sentences.sentence: 私は会議中でも、寝てしまう{1:ことがある}。
sentences.translation: Sometimes I fall asleep during meetings.

sentences.sentence: 時々仕事をやめたいと思う{1:ことがある}。
sentences.translation: There are times when I feel like quitting my job.

sentences.sentence: 私の地元は6月でも寒い{1:ことがある}。
sentences.translation: In my hometown there are times where it is cold even in June.

sentences.sentence: 普段は母がご飯を作りますが、私が作る{1:こともあります}。
sentences.translation: My mother usually cooks, but there are times when I do as well.

sentences.sentence: 時々ベトナム料理を作る{1:ことがあります}。
sentences.translation: Sometimes I cook Vietnamese food.

sentences.sentence: たまに人の名前を忘れる{1:ことがあります}。
sentences.translation: There are times when I forget people's names.

sentences.sentence: 話したい{1:ことがある}。
sentences.translation: There's something I'd like to talk to you about

sentences.sentence: 今週はたくさんのやる{1:ことがあります}。
sentences.translation: This week there are a lot of things for me to do.

sentences.sentence: 難しい{1:かも}。
sentences.translation: This might be a bit difficult.

sentences.sentence: そう{1:かもしれない}。
sentences.translation: That may be the case.

sentences.sentence: 病気{1:かもしれない}。
sentences.translation: I might be sick...

sentences.sentence: 午後から雨が降る{1:かもしれない}。
sentences.translation: It might start raining in the afternoon.

sentences.sentence: 来週、台風が来る{1:かもしれない}。
sentences.translation: A typhoon is possibly coming this week.

sentences.sentence: 途中で雨が降る{1:かもしれない}から、傘を持っていきましょう。
sentences.translation: It might rain on our way there, so let's bring our umbrellas.

sentences.sentence: 転職する{1:かもしれません}。
sentences.translation: I might be changing jobs.

sentences.sentence: 走れば終電に間に合う{1:かもしれません}。
sentences.translation: If I run I might make the last train in time.

sentences.sentence: 到着が遅くなる{1:かもしれません}。
sentences.translation: My arrival could possibly be delayed.

sentences.sentence: みんなが朝食を食べ{1:終わる}まで待ちましょう。
sentences.translation: Let's wait until everyone has finished eating breakfast.

sentences.sentence: そのゲームをやり{1:終わる}までに5時間くらいかかる。
sentences.translation: It takes about 5 hours to finish that game.

sentences.sentence: 彼が話し{1:終わる}とみんな黙っていた。
sentences.translation: There was silence when he finished speaking.

sentences.sentence: 仕事をし{1:終わったら}すぐ行く。
sentences.translation: I'll go/come as soon as I finish work.

sentences.sentence: パソコンを使い{1:終わったら}、シャットダウンをしてください。
sentences.translation: Once you've finished using the computer, please turn it off.

sentences.sentence: 宿題の作文を書き{1:終わった}のでテレビを見ます。
sentences.translation: I've finished writing my essay for homework and now am going to watch some TV.

sentences.sentence: ご飯を食べ{1:終わった}あとに、みんなでカラオケに行きました。
sentences.translation: After finishing eating, everyone went out to sing some karaoke.

sentences.sentence: もう自分の部屋を掃除し{1:終わりました}か？
sentences.translation: Have you finished cleaning your room yet?

sentences.sentence: 先日お貸しした本は読み{1:終わりました}か？
sentences.translation: Have you finished reading the book I lent you the other day?

sentences.sentence: ご飯んが食べ{1:終わりましたら}、お皿を洗ってください。
sentences.translation: Once you've finished eating please wash the dishes.

sentences.sentence: 食べ{1:始める}。
sentences.translation: To begin eating.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降り{1:始めた}。
sentences.translation: It started to rain.

sentences.sentence: いつそれをやり{1:始める}の？
sentences.translation: When will you start doing that?

sentences.sentence: 今朝、歯が痛くなり{1:始めた}。
sentences.translation: My tooth started hurting this morning.

sentences.sentence: 私はまだ走り{1:始めて}いない。
sentences.translation: I still haven't started running.

sentences.sentence: 私はまだ夕食を作り{1:始めて}いない。
sentences.translation: I still haven't started cooking dinner.

sentences.sentence: この状況は変わり{1:始めて}いる。
sentences.translation: This situation is starting to change.

sentences.sentence: 私は今年から働き{1:始めた}ばかりです。
sentences.translation: I just started working from this year.

sentences.sentence: 私は再びサイクリングをやり{1:始めた}。
sentences.translation: I started cycling again.

sentences.sentence: いったん話し{1:始める}と、彼女を止めることは出来ない。
sentences.translation: Once she starts talking, there's no stopping her.

sentences.sentence: 昨日から雨が降り{1:続けている}。
sentences.translation: It's been raining nonstop since yesterday.

sentences.sentence: 父からもらった自転車を今も使い{1:続けています}。
sentences.translation: I still use the bicycle that my father gave to me even now.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は彼氏の話をしゃべり{1:続けた}。
sentences.translation: She continued talking about her boyfriend.

sentences.sentence: それをやり{1:続けた}ほうがいいのかもしれない。
sentences.translation: It might be better for me to keep doing that.

sentences.sentence: どんなに大変だったとしても、やり{1:続ける}ことが大切です。
sentences.translation: No matter how tough things get, it's important to stay consistent with what you're doing.

sentences.sentence: 一週間雨が降り{1:続けた}。
sentences.translation: It kept raining for a full week.

sentences.sentence: これからも彼を応援し{1:続けたい}。
sentences.translation: I want to keep supporting him.

sentences.sentence: 彼は高校時代からずっとサッカーをし{1:続けている}。
sentences.translation: He's been playing soccer since he was in high school.

sentences.sentence: 物価は上がり{1:続ける}だろう。
sentences.translation: Prices will likely continue to rise.

sentences.sentence: 君を永遠に愛し{1:続ける}と約束するよ。
sentences.translation: I promise to keep loving you forever.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降っ{1:ても構わない}。
sentences.translation: I don't mind if it rains.

sentences.sentence: 君が何をし{1:ても構わない}よ。
sentences.translation: I don't mind what you do.

sentences.sentence: 今帰っ{1:ても構いません}か？
sentences.translation: Do you mind if I leave now?

sentences.sentence: 間違いをし{1:ても構わない}。
sentences.translation: Don't worry about making mistakes.

sentences.sentence: 嫌なら来なく{1:ても構わない}。
sentences.translation: I don't mind you not coming if you really don't want to.

sentences.sentence: 私は毎日それを食べ{1:てもかまわない}。
sentences.translation: I wouldn't mind eating that everyday.

sentences.sentence: ここでタバコを吸っ{1:ても構いません}か？
sentences.translation: Do you mind if I smoke here?

sentences.sentence: 初心者{1:でも構いません}ので、気になる方はご連絡ください。
sentences.translation: It doesn't matter if you are a beginner, anyone who is interested please contact us.

sentences.sentence: 返事はしなく{1:ても構いません}よ。
sentences.translation: You don't have to answer / it doesn't matter if you reply or not

sentences.sentence: {1:急に}雨が降り始めました。
sentences.translation: It suddenly started raining.

sentences.sentence: 雨は{1:急に}やんだ。
sentences.translation: The rain suddenly stopped.

sentences.sentence: その車は{1:急に}曲がった。
sentences.translation: That car made an abrupt turn.

sentences.sentence: 今日は{1:急に}涼しくなった。
sentences.translation: It suddenly got a bit cooler today.

sentences.sentence: その子は{1:急に}泣き出した。
sentences.translation: That child suddenly started crying.

sentences.sentence: 彼の病気が{1:急に}悪くなった。
sentences.translation: His illness took a sudden turn for the worst.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は元気{1:かな}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if she's doing well.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降る{1:かな}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if it's going to rain.

sentences.sentence: 外は寒い{1:かな}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if it's cold outside.

sentences.sentence: もう食べていい{1:かな}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if it's OK to start eating.

sentences.sentence: 一緒に映画を見るのはどう{1:かな}？
sentences.translation: What do you think about going to see a movie together?

sentences.sentence: ここに座ってもいい{1:かな}？
sentences.translation: Do you mind if I sit here?

sentences.sentence: 私はカレーうどんにしよう{1:かな}。
sentences.translation: I think I'll go with the curry udon.

sentences.sentence: そろそろ勉強しよう{1:かな}。
sentences.translation: I guess I should start studying soon.

sentences.sentence: もし違う{1:なら}。
sentences.translation: What if you're wrong?

sentences.sentence: それ{1:なら}問題ありません。
sentences.translation: If that's the case, then there are no problems.

sentences.sentence: やる{1:なら}今しかない。
sentences.translation: If you're gonna do it, it's now or never.

sentences.sentence: 日本語を習いたい{1:のなら}、いい先生を紹介してあげる。
sentences.translation: If you want to learn Japanese I can introduce you to a good teacher.

sentences.sentence: 君{1:なら}必ずできる。
sentences.translation: Since it's you, you can definitely do it!

sentences.sentence: あの店{1:なら}何を食べても美味しい。
sentences.translation: No matter what you eat at that place, everything is good. (shows trust in the that shop)

sentences.sentence: 彼{1:なら}いつでも力になってくれるよ。
sentences.translation: If it’s him, he's always willing to help out.

sentences.sentence: 夏休みの旅行{1:なら}北海道がいいですよ。
sentences.translation: If you're thinking about summer holiday plans, I think Hokkaido is great.

sentences.sentence: あのドラマ{1:なら}まだ見ていない。
sentences.translation: If you're talking about that drama, I still haven't seen it.

sentences.sentence: 図書館{1:なら}案内してあげます。
sentences.translation: If you're looking for the library, I'll help guide you there.

sentences.sentence: 明日は休みだから、学校に行か{1:なくてもいい}。
sentences.translation: Tomorrow is a day off, so I don't need to go to school.

sentences.sentence: 空港まで来{1:なくてもいい}よ。
sentences.translation: You don't have to come all the way to the airport.

sentences.sentence: 好きじゃないなら、食べ{1:なくてもいい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: If you don't like it, you don't need to eat it.

sentences.sentence: 来{1:なくてもいい}ですよ。私一人で行くから。
sentences.translation: You don't need to come. I'll go by myself.

sentences.sentence: 無理し{1:なくてもいい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: You don't need to push yourself too hard.

sentences.sentence: 明日は授業がないから大学に行か{1:なくてもいい}です。
sentences.translation: I have no classes tomorrow so I don't need to go to university (campus).

sentences.sentence: 時間がまだいっぱいあるから、そんなに急が{1:なくていい}よ。
sentences.translation: There's still a bunch of time, so you don't need to rush.

sentences.sentence: 外食し{1:なくていい}よ。家で食べましょう。
sentences.translation: We don't need to eat out. Let's eat something at home.

sentences.sentence: その本はあげるよ，返してくれ{1:なくてもいい}からね。
sentences.translation: I'll give you that book, you don't need to return it.

sentences.sentence: 小学生以下はお金を払わ{1:なくてもいい}です。
sentences.translation: Elementary school kids and younger do not need to pay.

sentences.sentence: 彼は{1:いつも}元気ですね。
sentences.translation: He is always energetic.

sentences.sentence: 妹は{1:いつも}寝ている。
sentences.translation: My younger sister is always sleeping.

sentences.sentence: {1:いつも}夜10時に寝ます。
sentences.translation: I always go to bed at 10 o'clock.

sentences.sentence: 昼ご飯は{1:いつも}納豆を食べます。
sentences.translation: I always have natto (fermented soybeans) for lunch.

sentences.sentence: 仕事に行く前に{1:いつも}ジムに行きます。
sentences.translation: I always go to the gym before going to work.

sentences.sentence: {1:いつも}自転車で学校に来ますが今日は歩きました。
sentences.translation: I always go to school by bike, but today I walked.

sentences.sentence: 今日は{1:いつも}と同じ一日だった。
sentences.translation: Today was a normal day as always.

sentences.sentence: 君と{1:いつも}一緒に居たい。
sentences.translation: I want to be together with you always.

sentences.sentence: それはよい買い物だった{1:といってもいい}でしょう。
sentences.translation: I'd say it was a good buy.

sentences.sentence: 彼はやさしいが，だまされやすい{1:といってもいい}。
sentences.translation: He's a kind person, but could be said to be a bit easy to be deceived.

sentences.sentence: それはいい考えだ。いや，すばらしい{1:といってもいい}だろう。
sentences.translation: That's a good idea, even brilliant I might say..

sentences.sentence: それまでの中で一番の旅だった{1:と言ってもいい}でしょう。
sentences.translation: I'd say that was the best trip I had ever taken.

sentences.sentence: 彼女はネイティブ{1:と言ってもいい}くらい日本語が上手だ。
sentences.translation: Her Japanese is so good you could say she's like a native speaker.

sentences.sentence: 彼は死んだ{1:と言ってもいい}くらいのものだ。
sentences.translation: You could say he's as good as dead.

sentences.sentence: それまで受けたテストの中で、もっともむずしかった{1:と言ってもいい}でしょう。
sentences.translation: I'd say that was the most difficult test I had ever taken.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は本の虫{1:と言ってもいい}ような人だ。
sentences.translation: She's what you might call a bookworm.

sentences.sentence: 彼の話はばかばかしい{1:と言ってもいい}くらいだった。
sentences.translation: His story was on the verge of ridiculous.

sentences.sentence: トム{1:ではないか}。
sentences.translation: Well if it isn't Tom?

sentences.sentence: 何ときれい{1:ではないか}。
sentences.translation: How pretty!

sentences.sentence: すばらしい天気{1:ではないか}。
sentences.translation: What wonderful weather we're having, eh?

sentences.sentence: 明日は雨{1:ではないか}と思う。
sentences.translation: I think it will rain tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 彼は病気{1:ではないか}と思う。
sentences.translation: I suspect that he's sick.

sentences.sentence: タクシーに乗ろう{1:ではないか}。
sentences.translation: Why don't we take a taxi?

sentences.sentence: 本当のこと{1:ではないか}と思うよ。
sentences.translation: I suspect it to be true.

sentences.sentence: 彼は来ないの{1:ではないか}と思う。
sentences.translation: I'm don't think he'll be coming.

sentences.sentence: 試験を合格したとはすごい{1:ではないか}。
sentences.translation: How wonderful that you passed your exam!

sentences.sentence: {1:もう}昼ご飯の時間だ。早く食べましょう！
sentences.translation: It's lunch time already, let's hurry up and eat.

sentences.sentence: 宿題は{1:もう}終わった？
sentences.translation: Did you already finish your homework?

sentences.sentence: ビール{1:もう}一杯ください！
sentences.translation: One more beer please!

sentences.sentence: 飲み物は全部飲みました。{1:もう}ありません。
sentences.translation: We drank all of the drinks. There aren't any left.

sentences.sentence: {1:もう}少し待ってください。
sentences.translation: Please wait a little while longer.

sentences.sentence: コーヒーは{1:もう}飲まないことにしました。
sentences.translation: I've decided to not drink coffee anymore.

sentences.sentence: {1:もう}この暑さには、耐えられない。
sentences.translation: I can't handle this heat anymore.

sentences.sentence: {1:もう}我慢できない。
sentences.translation: I can't take it anymore.

sentences.sentence: {1:もう}10時ですが、彼はまだ寝ています。
sentences.translation: It's already 10 o'clock, but he's still sleeping.

sentences.sentence: 彼女と結婚してから、{1:もう}５年になります。
sentences.translation: It will already be 5 years since I married her.

sentences.sentence: 本当{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if that's true.

sentences.sentence: どこへ行った{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: I wonder where they could have gone?

sentences.sentence: 誰{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: I wonder who that is.

sentences.sentence: 彼は本気{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if he is serious.

sentences.sentence: 明日は雨{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if it will rain tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: この本は売れる{1:かしら}？
sentences.translation: I wonder if this book will sell.

sentences.sentence: 明日は晴れる{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: I wonder if it will clear up tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 今夜、外食するのはどう{1:かしら}？
sentences.translation: What do you think about eating out tonight?

sentences.sentence: 以前お会いしませんでした{1:かしら}。
sentences.translation: Have we met before?

sentences.sentence: 行こう{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: Let's go, shall we?

sentences.sentence: ダメ{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: You should know that's no good / you can't do that.

sentences.sentence: だから言った{1:じゃないか}！
sentences.translation: I told you so! (didn't I?)

sentences.sentence: 今夜外食しよう{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: Let's go out for dinner tonight, shall we?

sentences.sentence: 今日は元気そう{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: Well aren't you looking quite energetic today?

sentences.sentence: お祝いに一杯やろう{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: Let's have a drink in celebration (shall we?)

sentences.sentence: 間違えたのは君{1:じゃないか}！
sentences.translation: It was you who made the mistake, wasn't it?

sentences.sentence: 散歩しよう{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: Why don't we go for a walk?

sentences.sentence: 彼の話を最後まで聞こう{1:じゃないか}。
sentences.translation: Let's hear the rest of his story.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:も}できる。
sentences.translation: I can do that too.

sentences.sentence: 甘いもの{1:も}辛いもの{1:も}好きです。
sentences.translation: I like sweets as well as spicy foods.

sentences.sentence: カラオケにはみんなが来ました。先生{1:も}来ました。
sentences.translation: Everyone came to sing karaoke. Our teacher came too.

sentences.sentence: 私は日本語{1:も}英語{1:も}ベトナム語{1:も}話せます。
sentences.translation: I can speak English, Japanese, as well as Vietnamese.

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:も}お腹が空いたでしょう？
sentences.translation: You are probably hungry too, aren't you?

sentences.sentence: 私{1:も}日本語を勉強していますよ！
sentences.translation: I'm studying Japanese too!

sentences.sentence: 私の妻{1:も}子ども{1:も}来ます。
sentences.translation: My wife and children will come too.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:も}日本で留学したことがあります。
sentences.translation: I've also studied abroad in Japan before.

sentences.sentence: 仕事に行くとき、自転車{1:も}電車{1:も}使っています。
sentences.translation: When I go to work I use both my bike and the train.

sentences.sentence: 手伝っ{1:てやる}。
sentences.translation: I'll help you out / let me help you out.

sentences.sentence: いいよ，僕がやっ{1:てやる}よ。
sentences.translation: No problem, I'll do it for you.

sentences.sentence: 車に君を乗せ{1:てやる}。
sentences.translation: I'll give you a ride (by car).

sentences.sentence: あなたがそれを読んだら別の本を貸し{1:てやる}。
sentences.translation: Once you finish reading that I'll lend you another book.

sentences.sentence: 君のためにできることは何でもやっ{1:てやる}。
sentences.translation: I will do anything I can for you.

sentences.sentence: あなたにそれを教え{1:てやらない}。
sentences.translation: I won't tell you that.

sentences.sentence: もう二度と注意し{1:てやらない}から。
sentences.translation: I'm not going to warn you again.

sentences.sentence: 彼に手を貸し{1:てやらない}ほうがいいと思う。
sentences.translation: I think it's best to not help him out.

sentences.sentence: 利子なしでお金を貸し{1:てやる}よ。
sentences.translation: I'll lend you money without charging any interest.

sentences.sentence: {1:まだ}ですか？
sentences.translation: Is it ready yet? / are we there yet? / Still...?

sentences.sentence: {1:まだまだ}暑いだ。
sentences.translation: It's still hot out. (mada can be used twice in a row for extra emphasis)

sentences.sentence: 先生は{1:まだ}来ていない。
sentences.translation: Our teacher still hasn't come.

sentences.sentence: もう10時ですが弟が{1:まだ}寝ている。
sentences.translation: It's already 10 am, but my younger brother is still sleeping.

sentences.sentence: {1:まだ}1時間もあるよ。
sentences.translation: We still have one hour.

sentences.sentence: あきらめるのは{1:まだ}早い！
sentences.translation: It's still too early to give up!

sentences.sentence: 私は宿題が{1:まだ}終わっていません。
sentences.translation: I still haven't finished with my homework.

sentences.sentence: このシャツは大き{1:すぎる}。
sentences.translation: This shirt is too big.

sentences.sentence: 今年の夏は暑{1:すぎた}。
sentences.translation: This year's summer was too hot.

sentences.sentence: 冬の来るのが早{1:すぎた}。
sentences.translation: Winter has come too soon.

sentences.sentence: この問題は簡単{1:すぎます}。
sentences.translation: This problem is too easy.

sentences.sentence: 幸せ{1:すぎて}死にそうだ。
sentences.translation: I'm so happy I could die.

sentences.sentence: かんじを覚えるのが私には難し{1:すぎる}。
sentences.translation: Memorizing kanji is a bit too difficult for me.

sentences.sentence: このレストランはちょっと高{1:すぎる}。別のところにしましょう。
sentences.translation: This restaurant is a bit too expensive. Let's try somewhere else.

sentences.sentence: この会社は給料が少な{1:すぎます}。
sentences.translation: This company's salary is too low.

sentences.sentence: ごめんなさい、少し言い{1:すぎました}。
sentences.translation: I'm sorry, I said a bit too much. (I said more than I should have)

sentences.sentence: 昨夜ちょっと飲み{1:すぎました}。
sentences.translation: I drank a little bit too much yesterday.

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}来ないの？
sentences.translation: Why aren't you coming?

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}そうなったの？
sentences.translation: How/why did that happen?

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}それを知っている？
sentences.translation: How/why do you know that?

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}日本に来たんですか？
sentences.translation: Why did you come to Japan?

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}日本の夏はこんなに暑いんだろう。
sentences.translation: Why is Summer in Japan so hot..?

sentences.sentence: 君は{1:どうして}けがをしたか。
sentences.translation: How did you get hurt?

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}その事故が起こったのか。
sentences.translation: How did that accident come about?

sentences.sentence: {1:どうして}彼女と知り合ったのですか。
sentences.translation: How did you get acquainted with her?

sentences.sentence: 明日早く起きる{1:ようにする}。
sentences.translation: I'll try to wake up early tomorrow.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: それを忘れない{1:ようにする}。
sentences.translation: I'll be sure to remember that.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 明日から仕事に行く前に毎日ラニングをする{1:ようにします}。
sentences.translation: From tomorrow I'm going to try to go running before work every day.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今日からお酒を飲まない{1:ようにします}。
sentences.translation: I'm going to not drink alcohol anymore from today.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 毎日歩く{1:ようにしている}。
sentences.translation: I'm trying to walk every day.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 夜は10時に寝る{1:ようにしている}。
sentences.translation: I'm trying to go to bed at 10.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 肉だけじゃなくて、野菜も食べる{1:ようにしています}。
sentences.translation: I'm trying to eat more vegetables instead of just meat.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 就職してからは、毎日新聞を読む{1:ようにしています}。
sentences.translation: Since I started job hunting, I began reading newspapers every day.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようにする-you-ni-suru-ようにしている-meaning/

sentences.sentence: どれ{1:にする}?
sentences.translation: Which will you have? / Which do you want?

sentences.sentence: 飲み物は何{1:にする}？
sentences.translation: What will you have to drink?

sentences.sentence: お茶{1:にする}。
sentences.translation: I'll have tea.

sentences.sentence: 私は明日と来週の火曜日を休み{1:にする}。
sentences.translation: I'm taking work off tomorrow and next Tuesday.

sentences.sentence: これ{1:にします}。
sentences.translation: I want this / I've decided on this

sentences.sentence: 今日は部屋をきれい{1:にします}。
sentences.translation: I will clean my room today.

sentences.sentence: 君を幸せ{1:にします}。
sentences.translation: I'll make you happy.

sentences.sentence: 紅茶にしますかそれともコーヒー{1:にします}か。
sentences.translation: Do you want black tea or coffee?

sentences.sentence: 今年は素晴しい年{1:にします}！
sentences.translation: I'm gonna make this year a great one!

sentences.sentence: ちょっと寒い{1:ので}、窓を閉めてもいいですか。
sentences.translation: It's a bit cold, so is it OK to close the window?

sentences.sentence: ちょっと用事がある{1:ので}、先に帰ります。
sentences.translation: There's something I need to take care of, so I'm heading home early.

sentences.sentence: 台風が来る{1:ので}、明日のクラスに来なくていいです。
sentences.translation: Since there's a typhoon coming, it's OK to not come to tomorrow's class.

sentences.sentence: おなかが痛い{1:ので}、薬をください。
sentences.translation: I have a stomachache, so please give me some medicine.

sentences.sentence: 彼女がとてもきれい{1:なので}、すぐ好きになりました。
sentences.translation: Since she's very beautiful, I quickly fell in love.

sentences.sentence: 今から行きます{1:ので}、少々お待ちください。
sentences.translation: I'm heading over now, so please wait a moment.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降っていた{1:ので}、試合が中止になりました。
sentences.translation: Because of the rain, the match was cancelled.

sentences.sentence: 左手で食べようとしたが、難しかった{1:ので}やめました。
sentences.translation: I tried eating with my left hand, but it was difficult so I gave up.

sentences.sentence: 彼はおはしを使う{1:のが下手}だ。
sentences.translation: He is bad at using chopsticks.

sentences.sentence: 母は料理をする{1:のが下手}だ。
sentences.translation: My mother is bad at cooking.

sentences.sentence: 私は人としゃべる{1:のが下手}だ。
sentences.translation: I'm not good at talking with people.

sentences.sentence: かんじを勉強する{1:のが下手}です。
sentences.translation: I'm not good at studying kanji.

sentences.sentence: 日本語の字を書く{1:のが下手}だ。
sentences.translation: I'm not good at writing Japanese characters.

sentences.sentence: 姉は歌う{1:のが下手}だと思います。
sentences.translation: I think my older sister is bad at singing.

sentences.sentence: トライアスロンをやってみたいですが泳ぐ{1:のが下手}だ。
sentences.translation: I want to try doing a triathlon, but I'm no good at swimming.

sentences.sentence: トイレを使っ{1:てから}、手を洗わないといけません。
sentences.translation: We must wash our hands after using the restroom.

sentences.sentence: 買い物をし{1:てから}家に帰ります。
sentences.translation: I'll come home after I finish shopping.

sentences.sentence: ご飯を食べ{1:てから}散歩しました。
sentences.translation: After eating I went for a walk.

sentences.sentence: 今日は、起き{1:てから}まだ何も食べていません。
sentences.translation: I haven't eaten anything today since waking up.

sentences.sentence: アメリカに帰国し{1:てから}太りました。
sentences.translation: I gained weight since coming back to America.

sentences.sentence: 彼が禁煙し{1:てから}2ヶ月がたった。
sentences.translation: It's been 2 months since he quit smoking.

sentences.sentence: 電話をし{1:てから}来てください。
sentences.translation: Please call me before you come.

sentences.sentence: 空き缶は潰し{1:てから}ゴミとして出してください。
sentences.translation: Please crush your empty cans before putting them out as garbage.

sentences.sentence: 疲れたら、早く寝た{1:ほうがいい}。
sentences.translation: If you're tired, it's better to go to bed early.

sentences.sentence: 暑い日には、水をたくさん飲んだ{1:方がいい}。
sentences.translation: It's best to drink a lot of water on hot days.

sentences.sentence: 寝る前に、スマホを使わない{1:方がいい}。
sentences.translation: Before going to bed, it's best to not use your smartphone.

sentences.sentence: 毎日日本語を練習した{1:方がいい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: You should practice Japanese every day.

sentences.sentence: 分からないとき、先生に聞いた{1:方がいい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: When you don't understand, you're best off asking your teacher.

sentences.sentence: 肉だけじゃなくて、野菜も食べた{1:ほうがいい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: It's better to not just eat meat, but some vegetables as well.

sentences.sentence: ご飯の後で、歯を磨いた{1:方がいい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: It's best to brush your teeth after eating.

sentences.sentence: 20歳になっても、お酒を飲まない{1:方がいい}と思います。
sentences.translation: Even if you turn 20, I think it's best to not drink any alcohol.

sentences.sentence: {1:一緒に}日本語を勉強しましょう。
sentences.translation: Let's study Japanese together.

sentences.sentence: 今夜、カラオケに{1:一緒に}行こう。
sentences.translation: Let's go to karaoke together tonight.

sentences.sentence: ずっと彼{1:と一緒に}いたい。
sentences.translation: I want to be together with him forever.

sentences.sentence: 明日の朝、{1:一緒に}ジムに行きませんか？
sentences.translation: Do you want to go to the gym together tomorrow morning?

sentences.sentence: 今朝、友だち{1:と一緒に}図書館に行きました。
sentences.translation: I went to the library together with my friend this morning.

sentences.sentence: うちの犬{1:と一緒に}散歩するのが好きです。
sentences.translation: I like walking together with my family's dog.

sentences.sentence: 来週、家族{1:と一緒に}富士山を見に行くんだ。
sentences.translation: Next week I'm going together with my family to see Mt. Fuji.

sentences.sentence: 今日一緒に食べ{1:ませんか}？
sentences.translation: Do you want to eat together today?

sentences.sentence: うちで映画を見{1:ませんか}。
sentences.translation: Do you want to watch a movie at my place?

sentences.sentence: お茶にし{1:ません}か？
sentences.translation: Would you care for some tea?

sentences.sentence: 日曜日にテニスをし{1:ません}か。
sentences.translation: Do you want to play tennis on Sunday?

sentences.sentence: 明日自転車で学校へ行き{1:ません}か？
sentences.translation: Do you want to go to school tomorrow by bike?

sentences.sentence: もう暗くなりました。家へ帰り{1:ません}か。
sentences.translation: It's gotten dark already.. Shall we head home?

sentences.sentence: 写真をとっ{1:てくれません}か？
sentences.translation: Would you mind taking a photo?

sentences.sentence: 私の仕事を手伝っ{1:てくれません}か。
sentences.translation: Would you mind helping me with my work?

sentences.sentence: あなたは教える{1:のが上手}です。
sentences.translation: You're good at teaching.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼は歌う{1:のが上手}だ。
sentences.translation: He's good at singing.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女はピアノを弾く{1:のが上手}。
sentences.translation: She's good at playing piano.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: あなたはお箸を使う{1:のが上手}ですね。
sentences.translation: You're very good at using chopsticks.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私はそんなに日本語を話す{1:のが上手}ではない。
sentences.translation: I'm not very good at speaking Japanese.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 高校のとき、運動をする{1:のが上手}だったが今は違う。
sentences.translation: In high school, I was good at exercising, but things are different now.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私は母ほど料理をする{1:のが上手}ではありません。
sentences.translation: I'm nowhere near as good at cooking as my mother.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 時間を管理する{1:のが上手}ではない。
sentences.translation: I'm not good at managing time.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/のが上手-no-ga-jouzu-のがじょうずです-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼{1:がいちばん}働いた。
sentences.translation: He worked the hardest.

sentences.sentence: 秋{1:が一番}好きな季節です。
sentences.translation: Fall is my favorite season.

sentences.sentence: 私はブロッコリー{1:が一番}嫌いだ。
sentences.translation: I hate broccoli the most.

sentences.sentence: 午前中{1:が一番}調子がいい。
sentences.translation: I feel best in the morning.

sentences.sentence: {1:一番}前に座っている人は誰ですか？
sentences.translation: Who is that sitting in the very front?

sentences.sentence: {1:一番}早く予約できる日はいつですか？
sentences.translation: When is the earliest day we can make a reservation?

sentences.sentence: {1:一番}美しい花が{1:一番}早くしおれる。
sentences.translation: The most beautiful flowers are the first to fade.

sentences.sentence: 兄弟で誰が{1:一番}背が高いですか。
sentences.translation: Who is the tallest among your siblings?

sentences.sentence: これを見{1:たことがある}。
sentences.translation: I've seen this before.

sentences.sentence: フランスに行っ{1:たことがある}。
sentences.translation: I've been to France before.

sentences.sentence: それを聞い{1:たことがある}。
sentences.translation: I've heard of that before.

sentences.sentence: 一度だけカラオケをやっ{1:たことがあります}。
sentences.translation: I've only tried karaoke once before.

sentences.sentence: 日本に行っ{1:たことあります}か？
sentences.translation: Have you been to Japan before?

sentences.sentence: 日本は好きですが行っ{1:たことがない}。
sentences.translation: I love Japan, but I've never been.

sentences.sentence: 本当に、車を運転し{1:たことがない}ですか？
sentences.translation: You've really never driven a car before?

sentences.sentence: これは誰にも話{1:したことがありません}。
sentences.translation: I've never told this to anyone.

sentences.sentence: 私は一度しかすしを食べ{1:たことがありません}。
sentences.translation: I've only had sushi one time.

sentences.sentence: 外はさむい{1:けれど}、家の中は暖かいです。
sentences.translation: It’s cold outside, but inside the house it is warm.

sentences.sentence: 彼は若い{1:けれども}経験がある。
sentences.translation: Although he is young he has experience.

sentences.sentence: 眠い{1:けれど}、まだ宿題があるから寝られません。
sentences.translation: I'm sleepy but still have homework to do so I can't go to bed yet.

sentences.sentence: このカメラは高かった{1:けれど}、すぐ壊れてしまいました。
sentences.translation: This camera was really expensive, but it broke right away.

sentences.sentence: 雪が降っている{1:けれども}、スーパーに行きます。
sentences.translation: Although it is snowing outside, I'm going to the grocery store.

sentences.sentence: お金はあまり持っていません。{1:けれども}、毎日幸せです。
sentences.translation: I don't have much money. But I am happy every day.

sentences.sentence: 先生はクラスでは厳しい{1:けれど}、クラスの外ではやさしいです。
sentences.translation: My teacher is really strict in class, but outside of class they are very kind.

sentences.sentence: 列車が遅れた{1:けれども}、なんとか間に合った。
sentences.translation: Although our train was late we somehow still made it in time.

sentences.sentence: 家族{1:のなかで}父{1:がいちばん}背が高いです。
sentences.translation: In my family, my father is the tallest.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: チーム{1:の中で}山田{1:が一番}強い！
sentences.translation: On our team, Yamada is the strongest!
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 日本の食べ物{1:の中で}ラーメン{1:が一番}好きだ。
sentences.translation: Out of all the Japanese food, ramen is my favorite.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: クラス{1:の中で}ジェシカ{1:が一番}頭いい。
sentences.translation: In our class, Jessica is the smartest.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 世界{1:の中で}日本{1:が一番}安全な国です。
sentences.translation: Japan is the safest country in the world.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女はクラス{1:の中で}字{1:が一番}きれいだ。
sentences.translation: She has the most beautiful handwriting in our class.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 友達{1:の中で}は、クリス{1:が一番}先輩。
sentences.translation: Chris is the oldest (most senior) one out of my friends.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 読んだ本{1:の中で}ハリーポッター{1:が一番}好きだ。
sentences.translation: Out of all the books I've read, Harry Potter is my favorite.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/の中でが一番-のなかでがいちばん-no-naka-de-ga-ichiban-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私は寝る{1:のが好き}です。
sentences.translation: I like to sleep. / I like sleeping.

sentences.sentence: 漫画を読む{1:のが好き}だ。
sentences.translation: I like reading manga.

sentences.sentence: 妹は料理をする{1:のが好きです。}
sentences.translation: My younger sister likes to cook.

sentences.sentence: 君、運動する{1:のが好き}だね。
sentences.translation: You sure like working out don't you.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は野球の試合を見る{1:のが好き}です。
sentences.translation: She likes watching baseball games.

sentences.sentence: 私は何かを食べながら映画を観る{1:のが好き}です。
sentences.translation: I love to eat something while watching a movie.

sentences.sentence: 電車とバスのどちらに乗る{1:のが好き}ですか？
sentences.translation: Which do you like to ride more, trains or buses?

sentences.sentence: 私の夫は私が夜に外出する{1:のが好き}ではない。
sentences.translation: My husband doesn't like me going out at night.

sentences.sentence: 多くの日本人は多くの人の前で自分の意見を表現する{1:のが好き}じゃない。
sentences.translation: Most Japanese people don't like expressing their opinions in front of a lot of people.

sentences.sentence: 手伝っ{1:てくれる}？
sentences.translation: Will you help me?

sentences.sentence: 彼ならやっ{1:てくれる}。
sentences.translation: We can count on him to help us.

sentences.sentence: 母は僕{1:に}毎日弁当を作っ{1:てくれる}。
sentences.translation: My mom makes my bento lunch for me every day.

sentences.sentence: 手を貸し{1:てくれますか}？
sentences.translation: Will you please help me out?

sentences.sentence: 私{1:に}日本語を教え{1:てくれますか}？
sentences.translation: Will you please teach me Japanese?

sentences.sentence: すみません、写真を取っ{1:てくれませんか}？
sentences.translation: Excuse me, could you please take a photo for me?

sentences.sentence: 友だちが駅まで送っ{1:てくれた}。
sentences.translation: My friend helped take me to the station.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は私{1:に}クッキーを作っ{1:てくれた}。
sentences.translation: My girlfriend made some cookies for me.

sentences.sentence: 知らない人が、駅までの道を教え{1:てくれた}。
sentences.translation: A stranger helped me find my way to the station.

sentences.sentence: 部長は私{1:に}寿司をおごっ{1:てくれました}。
sentences.translation: My boss (manager) treated me to sushi.

sentences.sentence: 歩い{1:ていく}。
sentences.translation: to walk / to go by walking / to start walking

sentences.sentence: 彼は毎日駅まで歩い{1:ていきます}。
sentences.translation: He walks to the station every day.

sentences.sentence: 船は港を出{1:ていった}。
sentences.translation: The ship pulled out of the harbor.

sentences.sentence: 彼は京都へ引っ越し{1:ていった}。
sentences.translation: He moved to Kyoto.

sentences.sentence: 今年はあっという間に過ぎ{1:ていく}。
sentences.translation: This year is going by really fast.

sentences.sentence: 何も言わずに部屋を出{1:ていきました}。
sentences.translation: I left the room without saying anything.

sentences.sentence: 私は日本語を聞くことに慣れ{1:ていきました}。
sentences.translation: I've started to get used to listening in Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降るから傘を持っ{1:ていった}方がいいよ。
sentences.translation: It's going to rain so you better bring an umbrella.

sentences.sentence: それは今後決定し{1:ていきます}。
sentences.translation: We'll decide that from now on.

sentences.sentence: 結婚してからも仕事を続け{1:ていく}つもりです。
sentences.translation: I plan to continue to work even after getting married.

sentences.sentence: もっとお金{1:が欲しい}です。
sentences.translation: I want more money.

sentences.sentence: 彼女{1:がほしい}。
sentences.translation: I want a girlfriend.

sentences.sentence: お金{1:が}たくさん{1:ほしい}。
sentences.translation: I want a lot of money.

sentences.sentence: 何人子ども{1:がほしい}ですか？
sentences.translation: How many children do you want to have?

sentences.sentence: 新しいGoProカメラ{1:が欲しい}です！
sentences.translation: I want the new GoPro camera!

sentences.sentence: いつか自分の家{1:が欲しい}です。
sentences.translation: I want to have my own house one day.

sentences.sentence: 日本で作られた車{1:が欲しい}。
sentences.translation: I want a car made in Japan.

sentences.sentence: 最近、仕事が忙しすぎてリラックスする時間{1:が欲しい}。
sentences.translation: Work is too busy lately, I want some time to relax.

sentences.sentence: 彼が持っているみたいなパソコン{1:が欲しい}。
sentences.translation: I want a computer like the one he has.

sentences.sentence: 母にセーターを買っ{1:てあげた}。
sentences.translation: I bought my mother a sweater.

sentences.sentence: いいよ，僕がやっ{1:てあげる}よ。
sentences.translation: No problem, I'll do it for you.

sentences.sentence: 車に君を乗せ{1:てあげる}。
sentences.translation: I'll give you a ride (by car).

sentences.sentence: 君に見せ{1:てあげたかった}よ。
sentences.translation: I wanted to show it to you.

sentences.sentence: 私はあなたにそれを教え{1:てあげない}。
sentences.translation: I won't tell you that.

sentences.sentence: あなたがそれを読んだら別の本を貸し{1:てあげます}。
sentences.translation: Once you finish reading that I'll lend you another book.

sentences.sentence: 私は君のためにできることは何でもやっ{1:てあげます}。
sentences.translation: I will do anything I can for you.

sentences.sentence: 花子は彼に日本語を教え{1:てあげました}。
sentences.translation: Hanako taught him Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 利子なしでお金を貸し{1:てあげる}よ。
sentences.translation: I'll lend you money without charging any interest.

sentences.sentence: 彼{1:に}来{1:てもらう}。
sentences.translation: I will have him come.

sentences.sentence: 先生{1:に}作文を直し{1:てもらう}。
sentences.translation: I'll have my teacher check my writing/essay.

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:に}ぜひ見{1:てもらいたい}ものがある。
sentences.translation: There's something I want you to look at.

sentences.sentence: 彼は病院でみ{1:てもらう}必要がある。
sentences.translation: He requires hospital care.

sentences.sentence: 母{1:に}車で送っ{1:てもらった}。
sentences.translation: I had my mom drive me there.

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:に}日本語を教え{1:てもらいたい}。
sentences.translation: I want you to teach me Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 医者{1:に}見{1:てもらった}か?
sentences.translation: Have you been looked at by the doctor yet?

sentences.sentence: 知らない人{1:に}、道を教え{1:てもらいました}。
sentences.translation: A strange helped give me directions.

sentences.sentence: 私は母{1:に}早く良くなっ{1:てもらいたい}。
sentences.translation: I want my mother to get well soon.

sentences.sentence: 昨日車を修理し{1:てもらいました}。
sentences.translation: I had my car repaired yesterday.

sentences.sentence: 仕事は辛い{1:けど}楽しい。
sentences.translation: Work is tough, but fun.

sentences.sentence: 金はない{1:けど}夢はある。
sentences.translation: I don't have money, but I have dreams.

sentences.sentence: スポーツは上手じゃない{1:けど}、好きです。
sentences.translation: I'm not good at sports, but I like them.

sentences.sentence: 悪い{1:けど}、明日のパーティーに行けません。
sentences.translation: Sorry, but I can't make it to tomorrow's party.

sentences.sentence: 眠い{1:けど}、まだ宿題があるから寝られません。
sentences.translation: I'm sleepy, but I still have homework to do so I can't go to sleep yet.

sentences.sentence: たくさん勉強した{1:けど}、テストの点はよくなかったです。
sentences.translation: Although I studied a lot, my test score wasn't very good.

sentences.sentence: 泣いた{1:けど}後悔はしていません。
sentences.translation: I cried, but I don't regret it.

sentences.sentence: 家賃は高い{1:けど}このマンションが大好きです。
sentences.translation: The rent is a bit expensive, but I love this apartment.

sentences.sentence: 8時{1:までに}来てください。
sentences.translation: Please come by no later than 8AM.

sentences.sentence: この本、来週{1:までに}返してくださいね。
sentences.translation: Please return this book by next week.

sentences.sentence: レポートは金曜日{1:までに}出してください。
sentences.translation: Please have the report submitted by Friday.

sentences.sentence: いつ{1:までに}必要ですか。
sentences.translation: When do you need this by?

sentences.sentence: 参加したい人は、明日{1:までに}連絡ください。
sentences.translation: For anyone who wants to participate, please let us know by tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: それはいつ{1:までに}終わりますか？
sentences.translation: When will that finish by?

sentences.sentence: 死ぬ{1:までに}１度は海外へ行ってみたいです。
sentences.translation: Before I die I want to try going abroad.

sentences.sentence: たいはんの日本人女性は３０歳になる{1:までに}結婚したいです。
sentences.translation: Most Japanese girls want to get married before turning 30.

sentences.sentence: 彼は元気{1:なように見える}。
sentences.translation: He looks very energetic.

sentences.sentence: 彼は勉強が嫌い{1:なように見える}。
sentences.translation: He looks like he hates studying.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は教師{1:のようにみえる}。
sentences.translation: She looks like a teacher.

sentences.sentence: その子は怖い{1:ように見える}。
sentences.translation: That child looks scared.

sentences.sentence: 彼は馬{1:のように見える}。
sentences.translation: He looks like a horse.

sentences.sentence: あなたは天使{1:のように見える}。
sentences.translation: You look like an angel.

sentences.sentence: 彼は楽しんでいる{1:ように見える}。
sentences.translation: He seems to be enjoying himself.

sentences.sentence: 都会にいる人は誰でも、いつも活動している{1:ようにみえる}。
sentences.translation: Everyone in the city always seems to be on the go.

sentences.sentence: 同じ{1:に見える}。
sentences.translation: They look the same.

sentences.sentence: 彼はアメリカ人{1:に見える}。
sentences.translation: He looks like he is American.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は先生{1:にみえる}。
sentences.translation: She looks like a teacher.

sentences.sentence: その人はとてもお金持ち{1:にみえる}。
sentences.translation: That person appears to be very rich.

sentences.sentence: 寝てない{1:ように見える}。
sentences.translation: You look like you didn't sleep much.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は結婚してからとても幸せそう{1:に見える}。
sentences.translation: Since getting married, she seems very happy.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は若{1:く見える}ので、学生だと思ったら、実は先生だった。
sentences.translation: Because she looks so young, I thought she was a student, but actually she’s a teacher.

sentences.sentence: 朝は桜の花が一日中で一番美し{1:く見える}。
sentences.translation: The cherry blossoms look their most beautiful in the morning.

sentences.sentence: やっ{1:てみる}！
sentences.translation: I'll give it a shot! / Here goes nothing!

sentences.sentence: これを使っ{1:てみる}。
sentences.translation: I'll try using this.

sentences.sentence: やっ{1:てみないと}分からない。
sentences.translation: You'll never know until you try.

sentences.sentence: いつか海外に行っ{1:てみたい}な。
sentences.translation: One day I'd like to try going abroad.

sentences.sentence: おいしいかどうかわからないので、試しに食べ{1:てみます}。
sentences.translation: I don't know if this is tasty or not, so I'm gonna give it a try.

sentences.sentence: とにかく、彼女の予定を聞い{1:てみます}。
sentences.translation: Anyway, I'll try asking her about her plans.

sentences.sentence: それは私にとっては難しいですが、やっ{1:てみます}。
sentences.translation: This is a little difficult for me, but I'll give it a shot.

sentences.sentence: 花火大会に行ったら、着物を着{1:てみたい}です。
sentences.translation: If I ever go to a fireworks festival, I want to try wearing a kimono.

sentences.sentence: もしお金がたくさんあったら、何をし{1:てみたい}ですか。
sentences.translation: If you had a lot of money, what would you like to do?

sentences.sentence: 雨{1:らしい}。
sentences.translation: It looks like rain / looks like it's gonna rain.

sentences.sentence: 男{1:らしい}。
sentences.translation: Manly (like a man)

sentences.sentence: 女{1:らしい}。
sentences.translation: Womanly; feminine (like a woman)

sentences.sentence: 学生{1:らしく}もっと勉強しなさい。
sentences.translation: Study more like a real student.

sentences.sentence: 今日は君{1:らしくない}な。
sentences.translation: You don't seem like yourself today.

sentences.sentence: 遅刻するなんて彼{1:らしくない}。
sentences.translation: It's not like him to be late like this.

sentences.sentence: これからも、自分{1:らしく}生きていきたいです。
sentences.translation: From now on, I want to live more true to myself.

sentences.sentence: 寝すぎるのは、体に悪い{1:らしい}です。
sentences.translation: Sleeping too much is apparently bad for your body.

sentences.sentence: 今夜のイベントは中止になった{1:らしい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: Tonight's event was apparently cancelled.

sentences.sentence: 見え{1:てくる}。
sentences.translation: To come into view (to start coming into view/ to continue coming into view)

sentences.sentence: 雨が降っ{1:てきた}。
sentences.translation: It started raining.

sentences.sentence: 戻っ{1:てきた}よ!
sentences.translation: I'm back!

sentences.sentence: お腹がすい{1:てきた}。
sentences.translation: I'm hungry / I'm starting to get hungry.

sentences.sentence: ここまで歩い{1:てきました}。
sentences.translation: I came here by foot.

sentences.sentence: 私は彼を連れ{1:てくる}。
sentences.translation: I will bring him / pick him up.

sentences.sentence: 彼は来週戻っ{1:てくる}。
sentences.translation: He'll be back next week.

sentences.sentence: ちょっとトイレに行っ{1:てきます}。
sentences.translation: I'm gonna head to the restroom real quick.

sentences.sentence: クリスさんはまだ来ていませんね。ちょっと探し{1:てきます}。
sentences.translation: Chris still hasn't come.. I'm gonna go look for him (then come back)

sentences.sentence: ちょっと自動販売機で水を買っ{1:てきます}。
sentences.translation: I'm gonna go to the vending machine to buy some water (then come back)

sentences.sentence: いまにも、雨が降り{1:そうだ}。
sentences.translation: It seems like it's gonna start raining any moment.

sentences.sentence: その人は倒れ{1:そうです}。
sentences.translation: That person looks like they're about to fall over.

sentences.sentence: そろそろ雨がやみ{1:そう}なので、もう少し待ちましょう。
sentences.translation: It seems like the rain is going to stop soon, so let's wait a little bit more.

sentences.sentence: どうしたの？眠{1:そうだ}ね。
sentences.translation: What's wrong. You look pretty sleepy..

sentences.sentence: わぁ、おいし{1:そう}な料理がたくさんありますね。
sentences.translation: Wow, there's a lot of really good looking food here!

sentences.sentence: 彼女が料理を作ってくれたが、見た目が悪くてまず{1:そうだ}。
sentences.translation: My girlfriend cooked some food for me, but the appearance was really bad and looked very unappetizing.

sentences.sentence: 彼女と別れたとき、彼女がすごく泣き{1:そうでした}。
sentences.translation: When I broke up with my girlfriend, she looked like she was about to cry.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は嬉し{1:そう}な表情で教室に入ってきた。
sentences.translation: He entered the classroom with a happy looking expression.

sentences.sentence: アメリカで育った{1:とかで}。
sentences.translation: I heard they were raised in America.

sentences.sentence: 今度の試験はかなり難しい{1:とかで}。
sentences.translation: I heard the next test is going to be really hard.

sentences.sentence: 事故があった{1:とかで}、今、電車が止まっています。
sentences.translation: I heard there was an accident and so the train is stopped now.

sentences.sentence: 安田さんは忙しい{1:とかで}今夜の飲み会に来れないそう。
sentences.translation: I heard Mr. Yasuda is quite busy and I don't think she'll be able to make it to drinks tonight.

sentences.sentence: 今夜の花火大会は、雨で中止{1:だとか}。
sentences.translation: I heard that tonight's fireworks were cancelled due to rain.

sentences.sentence: さっき聞いたんだけど、田中さんは来年、会社を辞める{1:とか}。本当に辞めるんだろう。
sentences.translation: I just heard that Mr. Tanaka will be quitting next year. I wonder if he really is quitting..

sentences.sentence: 山田さんは熱がある{1:とかで}、今日は休むそうです。
sentences.translation: I heard that Mr. Yamada has a fever, so it looks like he'll be taking off work today.

sentences.sentence: 休みの日は水曜日{1:だったり}、日曜日{1:だったり}です。
sentences.translation: We are closed on Wednesdays and Sundays.

sentences.sentence: 日曜日は買い物し{1:たり}、映画を見{1:たりした。}
sentences.translation: On Sunday I went shopping and watched a movie.

sentences.sentence: 私の店は忙し{1:かったり}暇{1:だったり}です。
sentences.translation: My shop is sometimes busy and sometimes slow.

sentences.sentence: 今日は宿題をし{1:たり}、部屋の掃除をし{1:たり}、忙しいです。
sentences.translation: Today I'm busy with (things like) doing my homework and cleaning my room.

sentences.sentence: 冬休みは漢字を勉強し{1:たり}、運動し{1:たりする}つもりです。
sentences.translation: During winter break I plan to study kanji and exercise.

sentences.sentence: 暇なときは映画を見{1:たり}、音楽を聞い{1:たりする}。
sentences.translation: In my free time I (do things like) watch movies and listen to music.

sentences.sentence: 図書館では本や雑誌を読ん{1:だり}、勉強し{1:たりする}人が多い。
sentences.translation: In the library, there's a lot of people (doing things like) reading books/magazines and studying.

sentences.sentence: 留学中に現地の料理を食べ{1:たり}、旅行し{1:たりしました}。
sentences.translation: During my study abroad, I (did things like) ate local foods and went traveling.

sentences.sentence: 誰でも間違いを犯し{1:たり}、失敗し{1:たりします}。
sentences.translation: Everyone makes mistakes and experiences failure.

sentences.sentence: 彼は仕事をやめる{1:そうだ}。
sentences.translation: I heard that he will be quitting his job.

sentences.sentence: 彼は金持ち{1:だそうだ}。
sentences.translation: He is said to be rich.

sentences.sentence: 先生によると、来週の試験はむずかしい{1:そうだ}。
sentences.translation: According to our teacher, next week's test is going to be very hard.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は今、入院中{1:だそうだ}。
sentences.translation: I heard she's in the hospital now.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は有名{1:だそうです}。
sentences.translation: I heard she is famous.

sentences.sentence: 彼はまだ独身{1:だそうだ}。
sentences.translation: I hear he's still single.

sentences.sentence: 息子さんは今留学中{1:だそうです}ね。
sentences.translation: I heard your son is now studying abroad?

sentences.sentence: 彼女の妹は英語が得意{1:だそうです}。
sentences.translation: Her younger sister is apparently really good at English.

sentences.sentence: 楽し{1:そうに}見える。
