sentences.sentence: 彼がいな{1:くとも}けっこう間に合う。
sentences.translation: We can do very well without him.

sentences.sentence: 竹田は君の助けがな{1:くとも}自分の面倒ぐらいみれるよ。
sentences.translation: Takeda can look after himself without your assistance.

sentences.sentence: 少な{1:くとも}僕はそう思います。
sentences.translation: At the very least, that's what I think..

sentences.sentence: それは正しい{1:とも}、間違っている{1:とも}言えない。
sentences.translation: I can't say whether that is correct or not.

sentences.sentence: 行く{1:とも}行かない{1:とも}申しかねます。
sentences.translation: I can not say whether I shall go or not.

sentences.sentence: これは本物{1:とも}偽物{1:とも}判断が出来ません。
sentences.translation: I can't tell whether this is genuine or fake.

sentences.sentence: 仕事がないので毎日友達と遊んでいる。暇{1:とも}言えるし忙しい{1:とも}言える。
sentences.translation: I don't have a job, so I play with my friends every day. It could be said that I'm free or that I'm busy.

sentences.sentence: 最近のゲームは、子供にいい{1:とも}悪い{1:とも}言えません。
sentences.translation: One can't really say whether video games nowadays are good or bad for children.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は質問に対する肯定{1:とも}否定{1:とも}とれる返事が上手い。
sentences.translation: She's really good at answering questions in a way where you can't tell if she's agreeing or disagreeing.

sentences.sentence: やれ{1:とも}やるな{1:とも}言う立場にはございませんけれども、正式の発表というものを待って改めて判断をしたいと思っています。
sentences.translation: While I am not in a position to tell them whether or not to do this, I would like to reserve my judgment until after a formal announcement has been made.

sentences.sentence: 彼はバスに間に合った{1:のやら}間に合わなかった{1:のやら}．．．
sentences.translation: I wonder if he made it in time or not for the bus...

sentences.sentence: このカレーは辛すぎて、美味しい{1:のやら}美味しくない{1:のやら}分からない。
sentences.translation: This curry is too spicy I can't tell whether it tastes good or not.

sentences.sentence: 嘘{1:なのやら}本当{1:なのやら}、彼氏が｢愛してる｣と言ってくれた。
sentences.translation: I'm not sure if it was a lie or the truth, but my boyfriend told me that he loves me!

sentences.sentence: 彼女はパーティーに行く{1:のやら}行かない{1:のやら}はっきりしない。
sentences.translation: She won't say clearly whether or not she will go to the party.

sentences.sentence: 田中さんは授業内容が分かっている{1:のやら}分かっていない{1:のやら}、無表情なので分からない。
sentences.translation: I'm not sure whether or not Tanaka understands the class content since his face lacks any expression.

sentences.sentence: 仕事がないので毎日友達と遊んでいる。暇{1:なのやら}忙しい{1:のやら}。
sentences.translation: Since I'm out of work, I've just been hanging out with my friends everyday. I'm not sure if I'm "full of free time" or busy.

sentences.sentence: 喜んでいい{1:のやら}悲しんでいい{1:のやら}、最近フリーランス仕事の依頼が多く、趣味の時間が全くとれない。
sentences.translation: Lately I've gotten a lot of requests for freelance work. I'm not sure whether I should be happy or sad though, since I have no free time to enjoy myself.

sentences.sentence: 父は酒{1:だの}、タバコ{1:だの}が好きで、健康が心配です。
sentences.translation: My father really likes things like alcohol and cigarettes, so I really worry for his health.

sentences.sentence: お菓子{1:だの}、アイス{1:だの}甘いものばかり食べてるから虫歯になるんだよ。
sentences.translation: Because you only eat sweets and ice cream you are going to get some cavities.

sentences.sentence: 僕の毎月の小遣いは、飲み会{1:だの}カラオケ{1:だの}で消えていく。
sentences.translation: My monthly allowance usually disappears from drinking parties and karaoke.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は、風邪を引いた{1:だの}、頭が痛い{1:だの}と言って、よく授業を休む。
sentences.translation: She often skips class by saying things like I've caught a cold or I've got a headache..

sentences.sentence: 一生結婚しない{1:だの}、海外で暮らす{1:だの}、うちの娘は本当に自分勝手だ。
sentences.translation: She will never get married and lives abroad, my daughter is truly a selfish person.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は部屋が狭い{1:だの}、寒い{1:だの}といつも文句を言っている。
sentences.translation: She is always complaining about things like the room being too small or it being cold, etc..

sentences.sentence: 彼女は立派な家に住んでいるのに、掃除が大変{1:だの}キッチンが使いにくい{1:だの}と文句ばかり言っている。
sentences.translation: Although she lives in quite a nice house, she often complains about things like cleaning is really difficult or that the kitchen it too small.

sentences.sentence: 先生{1:が}先生{1:なら}、学生{1:も}学生{1:だ}。
sentences.translation: Like teacher like student. (with a bad teacher like this of course the students are also bad)

sentences.sentence: 味{1:が}味{1:なら}、サービス{1:も}サービス{1:だ}。
sentences.translation: With bad taste like this, of course the service is also bad.
With the kid like this, of course the parents are also bad.

sentences.sentence: あのカフェは、味{1:も}味{1:なら}、サービス{1:も}サービス{1:だ}。
sentences.translation: That cafe's food and service are both bad.

sentences.sentence: この会社の社員は常識がない。上司{1:が}上司{1:なら}、部下{1:も}部下{1:です}ね。
sentences.translation: The employees at this company have no common sense. If the managers are bad, then the general staff will be too.

sentences.sentence: このレストランは店員の態度が悪いし、料理も美味しくない。店員{1:が}店員{1:なら}、味{1:も}味{1:です}ね。
sentences.translation: This restaurant's staff has a poor attitude and the food is not good. With staff like this, of course the food is also no good.

sentences.sentence: 自分の子供が問題を起こして学校に呼び出されているのに、それを無視する親がいる。子供{1:が}子供{1:なら}親{1:も}親{1:だ}。
sentences.translation: The parent of the kid who caused a problem was called to the school, but ended up ignoring it. The apple doesn't fall far from the tree..

sentences.sentence: 熱が下がった{1:にせよ}、しばらく安静が必要です。
sentences.translation: Even if your fever has gone down, you still need to rest.

sentences.sentence: 欠席する{1:にせよ}連絡はしてください。
sentences.translation: Even if you will be absent, please contact us.

sentences.sentence: 事故で自転車がめちゃくちゃになったが、何{1:にしろ}、誰もけがをしなくてよかった。
sentences.translation: My bike got pretty messed up in an accident, but at any rate, I'm just glad nobody was hurt.

sentences.sentence: ここは不便でどの駅に行く{1:にせよ}、徒歩で30分以上かかる。
sentences.translation: This place is really inconvenient, no matter which station you go to will take at least 30 minutes by foot.

sentences.sentence: 来る{1:にせよ来ないにせよ}、必ず連絡を入れてください。
sentences.translation: Whether you will come or not, please make sure to inform us.

sentences.sentence: このレストランは、料理の味{1:といい}値段{1:といい}、文句のつけようがない。
sentences.translation: This restaurant has good food taste and good price, so I can't complain.

sentences.sentence: あの映画はストーリー{1:といい}、キャラクター{1:といい}、素晴らしかった。
sentences.translation: That movie had a good story and great characters, it was wonderful.

sentences.sentence: 運動{1:といい}勉強{1:といい}、私は何をやっても駄目だ。
sentences.translation: Whether it be exercise or study, I'm no good at anything.

sentences.sentence: デザイン{1:といい}性能{1:といい}、i-Phoneは最高のスマホだ。
sentences.translation: With good design and good performance, the iPhone is the best smartphone.

sentences.sentence: 彼はまだ若いけれど、経験{1:といい}能力{1:といい}申し分のない男性だ。
sentences.translation: He is still young, but he is a perfect man with experience as well as good abilities.

sentences.sentence: デザイン{1:といい}、色{1:といい}、すごく気に入ったシャツがあったんだけれど、サイズがなかった。
sentences.translation: I found a shirt with a design and colors that I really liked, but they didn't have any in my size.

sentences.sentence: この旅館は、窓からの眺め{1:といい}料理{1:といい}、申し分がない。
sentences.translation: This traditional Japanese inn is flawless. The view from the window and the food are both great.

sentences.sentence: 顔{1:といわず}、手{1:といわず}泥まみれだ。
sentences.translation: Their face and hands and everything are covered in mud.

sentences.sentence: 晴れ{1:といわず}雨{1:といわず}ジョギングをしている。
sentences.translation: Rain or sunshine or whatever the weather may be, I always go jogging.

sentences.sentence: 社長は平日{1:といわず}週末{1:といわず}仕事をしている。
sentences.translation: The company president is always working, both on weekdays and on weekends.

sentences.sentence: 僕は、鶏肉{1:といわず}、牛肉{1:といわず}、肉は食べません。
sentences.translation: I don't eat meat of any kind, be it chicken, beef, or whatever.

sentences.sentence: 日本人は、子ども{1:といわず}、大人{1:といわず}、漫画をよく読みます。
sentences.translation: Japanese people, both children and adults, love to read comics.

sentences.sentence: お隣の赤ちゃんは、昼{1:といわず}、夜{1:といわず}、一日中よく泣いている。
sentences.translation: The baby next door is always crying all day long, both day and night.

sentences.sentence: 娘の部屋は、壁{1:といわず}天井{1:といわず}、ディズニープリンセスのポスターだらけである。
sentences.translation: My daughters room is covered in Disney princess posters, from the walls, to the ceiling, to pretty much everywhere...

sentences.sentence: 最近の若者は、食事中{1:といわず}、勉強している間{1:といわず}、いつも携帯電話を手にしている。
sentences.translation: Young people lately are always touching their phones, be it while eating, while studying, or whenever.

sentences.sentence: こんなに雨が降っ{1:ては}、買い物ができないな。
sentences.translation: I can't go shopping if it keeps raining like this.

sentences.sentence: 彼の成績がこんなに悪く{1:ては}、卒業もできないだろう。
sentences.translation: When his grades are this bad, he may not be able to graduate.

sentences.sentence: 彼が相手{1:では}勝てるわけがない。
sentences.translation: If he is my opponent, there is no way I can win.

sentences.sentence: 君のレストランの料理がまずく{1:ては}誰も来ませんよ。
sentences.translation: If your restaurant's food is not good, no one will come.

sentences.sentence: この仕事、彼に任せ{1:ては}いかがでしょう？
sentences.translation: How about leaving this work to him?

sentences.sentence: 静かに！大きな声で話し{1:ては}魚が逃げてしまう。
sentences.translation: Be quiet! If you talk in a loud voice, all of the fish will go away.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は日本に来{1:ては}、お土産でスーツケースをいっぱいにして国に帰る。
sentences.translation: Whenever she comes to Japan, she always goes back home with a suitcase full of souvenirs.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は亡くした子どもの写真を見{1:ては}泣いた。
sentences.translation: She cried whenever she looked at a picture of her lost child.

sentences.sentence: 娘はニキビに悩んでいて、鏡を見{1:ては}ため息をついている。
sentences.translation: My daughter is really worried about her pimples and sighing every time she looks at a mirror.

sentences.sentence: 授業をサボっ{1:ては}先生に叱られたりしたあの頃のことが懐かしく思われる。
sentences.translation: I have fond memories of when I used to skip class and get scolded by my teacher.

sentences.sentence: 気温が低すぎて、寒い{1:というか}痛い。
sentences.translation: The temperature is too low. It's more painful than cold.

sentences.sentence: あんこが好き{1:というか}、ないと生きていけない。
sentences.translation: I really like "anko" (sweet red bean paste), or rather I should say I can't live without it.

sentences.sentence: それは、面白い{1:というか}、珍しい{1:というか}、とにかく変わったものだ。
sentences.translation: That's interesting, or rather it's rare. In any case, it's strange.

sentences.sentence: たぶん行かないと思う。{1:というか}、お金がないから、行けない。
sentences.translation: I don't think I will go. Or rather I should say I don't have any money and so I can't go.

sentences.sentence: 私は合格したが、親友は不合格だった。嬉しい{1:というか}、残念{1:というか}、複雑な気持ちだ。
sentences.translation: I passed the exam, but my best friend did not. I'm happy, or perhaps I should say I'm sad. It's a complicated feeling.

sentences.sentence: あんなところに一人で行くなんて、無茶{1:というか}、無知{1:というか}、彼女のすることは理解できません。
sentences.translation: To go somewhere like that alone, she is either crazy or ignorant. I can't understand her actions.

sentences.sentence: たくさんお祝いをしていただき、嬉しい{1:というか}感謝{1:というか}、言葉になりません。
sentences.translation: I don't have the words to express my happiness or gratitude for your many congratulations.

sentences.sentence: 彼が来{1:ようが}来{1:まいが}、私とは関係ない。
sentences.translation: It doesn't matter to me whether he comes or not.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 雨が降{1:ろうと}降る{1:まいと}試合は行われる。
sentences.translation: The match will be held rain or shine.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: あなたが反対し{1:ようと}し{1:まいと}僕は一人で行くつもりだ。
sentences.translation: I plan on going alone regardless if you are against it or not.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 君が信じ{1:ようが}信じ{1:まいが}、俺は盗んでない。
sentences.translation: Whether you believe me or not, I didn't steal it.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私がい{1:ようが}い{1:まいが}関係なく、彼らはケンカを始めた。
sentences.translation: Regarless of me being there, they started fighting.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼が来{1:ようが}来{1:まいが}結果は同じだろう。
sentences.translation: Whether he comes or not, the result will be the same.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 気に入{1:ろうと}入る{1:まいと}、過半数の意見のとおりに決められる。
sentences.translation: Whether you like it or not, the decision is made by majority.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようと～まいと-ようが～まいが-you-to-mai-to-you-ga-mai-ga-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 君が何歳{1:であろうが}関係ない。仕事が出来ればいい。
sentences.translation: As long as you can do the job, it doesn't matter how old you are.

sentences.sentence: 誰と{1:結婚しようが}、私の勝手でしょ。
sentences.translation: Who I marry is my choice.

sentences.sentence: あなたがどんなに謝{1:ろうとも}、今回は許しません。
sentences.translation: No matter how much you apologize, I'm not going to forgive you this time.

sentences.sentence: このマンションはどんなに{1:騒ごうとも}、外からは何も聞こえません。
sentences.translation: No matter how loud you are in this apartment, you can't hear anything from outside.

sentences.sentence: 必要だから、どんなに{1:高かろうが}これを買わないといけません。
sentences.translation: It's necessary, so I will buy it no matter how high the price may be.

sentences.sentence: 僕が{1:何をしようが}勝手だ。あなたに言う必要はない。
sentences.translation: Whatever I do is my choice and none of your business.

sentences.sentence: 電車が遅れたせいで、どんなに{1:急ごうと}、飛行機の時間に間に合いそうにない。
sentences.translation: Because the train is running late, no matter how much I hurry it doesn't look like I will make the flight on time.

sentences.sentence: 俺は魚{1:だろうが}肉{1:だろうが}、何でも食べる。
sentences.translation: Whether it be fish or meat, I'll eat anything.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 雨が降{1:ろうと}雪が降{1:ろうと}明日のイベントには必ず行くよ。
sentences.translation: Come rain or snow, I'm definitely going to tomorrow's event!
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 速{1:かろうが}ゆっくり{1:であろうが}、注意して運転しなさい。
sentences.translation: Whether you drive fast or slow, drive carefully.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 良{1:かろうが}悪{1:かろうが}、自分の子だ。
sentences.translation: Whether good or bad, it's my own child.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 新品{1:であろうと}、中古{1:であろうと}、そんな型の古いパソコンは買うべきではないと思います。
sentences.translation: Whether that is a new or used, I don't think you should buy such and old model..
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 毎日、時間が{1:あろうと}なか{1:ろうと}、連絡だけは入れてください。
sentences.translation: Please make sure to contact me every day, whether you are busy or not.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 君が病気にな{1:ろうが}、貧乏{1:であろうが}、僕は君を一生愛す。
sentences.translation: No matter if you are sick or poor, I will love you forever.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ようが～ようが-ようと～ようと-you-ga-you-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 雨だ。買い物をしに{1:行こうか、行くまいか}。
sentences.translation: It's raining.. Should I go to buy groceries or not?

sentences.sentence: 本当のことを{1:話そうか話すまいか}迷ったが、結局全部話した。
sentences.translation: I didn't know whether to say the truth or not, but in the end I told everything.

sentences.sentence: 彼と結婚{1:しようかするまいか}悩むくらいなら、やめたほうがいいと思う。
sentences.translation: If you're not sure if you want to marry him or not, I think it's best you don't.

sentences.sentence: その新聞記者は、記事を掲載{1:しようかすまいか}悩んだあげく、掲載をやめた。
sentences.translation: That newspaper reporter was deciding whether or not to to submit an article for publication, but ended up worrying too much and decided not to.

sentences.sentence: 留学{1:しようかすまいか}迷うこと自体働かなければならない者から見れば幸せなことだと思う。
sentences.translation: I'm unsure if I should study abroad or not, but for people who are unable to go because of work, it is surely a wonderful dream experience.

sentences.sentence: 食べたいけど、太りたくないし、{1:食べようか食べまいか}悩んでいます。
sentences.translation: I want to eat it, but I don't want to gain weight, so I'm worrying about whether to eat it or not.

sentences.sentence: 彼がお金持ち{1:であれ}貧乏{1:であれ}、私の気持ちが変わることはない。
sentences.translation: It doesn't matter whether he is rich or poor, my feelings will not change.

sentences.sentence: 先生{1:であれ}学生{1:であれ}、規則には従わなければなりません。
sentences.translation: Whether you are a teacher or a student, everyone must follow the rules.

sentences.sentence: オクラ{1:であれ}納豆{1:であれ}、ネバネバしたものはとにかく嫌いだ。
sentences.translation: Whether it be okra or natto, I hate these kinds of sticky foods.

sentences.sentence: たとえ雨{1:であろうと}雪{1:であろうと}、明日の試合は予定通り行います。
sentences.translation: Even if it rains or snows, tomorrows match will continue as scheduled.

sentences.sentence: 正社員{1:であろうと}、パート{1:であろうと}、仕事に対する責任は変わりません。
sentences.translation: Whether you are a full-timer or part timer, one's responsibility towards work does not change.

sentences.sentence: 車{1:であれ}電車{1:であれ}この天候では無理だろう。
sentences.translation: Whether it be by car or train, it's impossible in this weather.

sentences.sentence: 社長{1:であれ}社員{1:であれ}、顧客にこの件を説明すべきだった。
sentences.translation: Whether it be the company president or an employee, someone should have explained this to the client.

sentences.sentence: 日本人{1:であれ}外国人{1:であれ}、法律には従わなければならない。
sentences.translation: Whether you are a Japanese citizen or a foreigner, you must obey the law.

sentences.sentence: 家を出る{1:なり}、雨が降りだした。
sentences.translation: It started raining as soon as I left the house.

sentences.sentence: 窓を開ける{1:なり}、変な虫が入ってきた。
sentences.translation: As soon as I opened the window, some strange bug entered the room.

sentences.sentence: 赤ん坊は、私の顔を見る{1:なり}、大声で泣き出した。
sentences.translation: Once the baby saw my face, it started crying.

sentences.sentence: 入ってくる{1:なり}、彼は倒れた。
sentences.translation: The instant he came in, he fell down.

sentences.sentence: うちの息子は学校から帰る{1:なり}、パソコンばっかり。
sentences.translation: Once our son returns from school, all he does is use the computer.

sentences.sentence: 彼の姿を見る{1:なり}私は恐怖で震えた。
sentences.translation: I trembled with fear from the moment I saw him.

sentences.sentence: 社長は電話を切る{1:なり}、部屋を出て行った。
sentences.translation: The company president left the room as soon as they hung up the phone.

sentences.sentence: キムさんはJLPTの結果を見る{1:なり}、大きな声を出して喜んだ。
sentences.translation: Kim shouted with joy after seeing the JLPT exam results.

sentences.sentence: いくらおいしい{1:にしたって}、その見た目じゃ食べる気にならない。
sentences.translation: No matter how delicious it may be, with that appearance I don't feel like eating it.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 走った{1:としたって}間に合わないだろうから、次の電車にしよう。
sentences.translation: Even if I ran, I wouldn't be in time, so let's take the next train.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: どちら{1:にしたって}状況が悪いことには変わりない。
sentences.translation: Either way, the situation is still bad.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今から急いだ{1:としたって}間に合わないだろう。
sentences.translation: Even if you hurry from now on, you won't make it in time.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: これから毎日勉強する{1:にしたところで}、3ヶ月じゃ合格できないだろう。
sentences.translation: Even if you studied every day from now on, you won't be able to pass in just 3 months.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 手元には１円もない。通帳{1:にしたって}同じだ。
sentences.translation: I don't have a single yen at hand. It's the same for my bankbook.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: これは忘れよう{1:としたところで}、忘れられない出来事です。
sentences.translation: Even if I tried to forget, I could not forget this unforgettable event.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: この会社で成果をあげ{1:たところで}、自分の給料が増えることはない。
sentences.translation: Even if I demonstrated good results at this company, my salary wouldn't increase at all.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/にしたって-にしたところで-ni-shitatte-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 選ぶ{1:とすれば}、僕はこれだな。
sentences.translation: If I were to choose, I would go with this.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: そこまで歩いていく{1:とすれば}、40分くらいかかるだろう。
sentences.translation: If we go by walking, it will likely take about 40 minutes.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: もし車を買い換える{1:とすれば}、次はアメリカの車が欲しい。
sentences.translation: If I were to buy a new car, I would want to get an American car.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 一日25時間{1:だとしたら}、何をしますか？
sentences.translation: If there were 25 hours in a day, what would you do?
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 電車で行く{1:としたら}、時間はどのくらいかかりますか。
sentences.translation: Assuming we go by train, about how much time will it take?
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: その話が本当だ{1:としたら}、嬉しいです！
sentences.translation: If that story is true, then I'd be really happy!
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: その話が本当だ{1:とすると}、大変なことだ。
sentences.translation: If that story is true, then that's pretty serious..
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: これを航空便で送る{1:とすると}いくらかかりますか？
sentences.translation: How much would it cost to send this by airmail?
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼が犯人だ{1:とすると}、犯罪を犯した動機は何だろう。
sentences.translation: If we assume that he is the culprit, then what is his motive?
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/とすれば-としたら-とすると-sureba-shitara-suru-to-meaning/

sentences.sentence: どうせ暇なら、掃除{1:なり}洗濯{1:なり}してくれない？
sentences.translation: Since you have nothing to do, could you please help with the cleaning or laundry?

sentences.sentence: メール{1:なり}電話{1:なり}で、彼女に連絡してください。
sentences.translation: Please get in touch with her by e-mail or phone.

sentences.sentence: 顔色が悪いですよ。座る{1:なり}横になる{1:なり}、楽にしてください。
sentences.translation: You're face is pretty pale. Please sit down or lay down, whatever makes you comfortable.

sentences.sentence: 休みで仕事がないなら、掃除する{1:なり}洗濯する{1:なり}、家事を手伝ったらどう？
sentences.translation: Since you're off of work, why don't you help out with the housework like cleaning or laundry?

sentences.sentence: この魚は生では食べられないから、煮る{1:なり}焼く{1:なり}してください。
sentences.translation: This fish can't be eaten raw, so please boil or fry it somehow.

sentences.sentence: もう使わないなら、人にあげる{1:なり}捨てる{1:なり}したほうがいいと思います。
sentences.translation: If you're not going to use it anymore, I think it's best you either give it to someone else or throw it away.

sentences.sentence: 会社が倒産しました。家のローンもあるし、朝も夜もバイトする{1:なりなんなり}して、なんとかこの状況を乗り越えないといけません。
sentences.translation: My company went bankrupt and since I have a mortgage on the house, I'll need to find a new job or work morning and night shifts at various part time jobs, whatever it takes to overcome this situation.

sentences.sentence: 初心者{1:なりに}よくやった。
sentences.translation: He did well for a beginner.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:なりに}頑張ったつもりだったが、結果はダメだった。
sentences.translation: I planned to give it my best in my own way, but the result was not good.

sentences.sentence: 自分{1:なりの}魅力を出したい。
sentences.translation: I want to show my own appeal in my own way.

sentences.sentence: 彼は足が遅いが、遅い{1:なりに}全力で走った。
sentences.translation: Although he is slow, he ran giving his best effort.

sentences.sentence: 山田は彼{1:なりに}良いやつだ。
sentences.translation: In his own way, Yamada is a pretty good guy.

sentences.sentence: 先輩が会社を辞めた理由は私{1:なりに}理解しています。
sentences.translation: I think I understand why my senior quit his job.

sentences.sentence: 出来ないなら出来ない{1:なりに}、無理をしないで少しずつやりましょう。
sentences.translation: If you can't do it well at this pace, then don't push yourself too hard and go at a slower pace.

sentences.sentence: 貧しいなら貧しい{1:なりの}生活をしないといけません。
sentences.translation: If you are poor, then you must live within your means.

sentences.sentence: 結婚式に出席するなら、それ{1:なりの}服装をするべきです。
sentences.translation: If you are going to attend the wedding, you should dress appropriately.

sentences.sentence: 若い時はどんな仕事{1:であれ}、一生懸命取り組みました。
sentences.translation: When I was young, no matter what the work was I always gave it my best effort.

sentences.sentence: 嘘をつくとは、どんな理由{1:であれ}、許されないことだ。
sentences.translation: Whatever the reason, lying is an unforgivable act.

sentences.sentence: 彼女が誰{1:であれ}、特別扱いするのはダメでしょう。
sentences.translation: Regardless of whoever she may be, preferential treatment is surely not acceptable.

sentences.sentence: 彼の話が真実{1:であろうと}無かろうと違いは無い。
sentences.translation: It makes no difference whether his story is true or not.

sentences.sentence: 故意{1:であろうと}なかろうと人を傷つけたことには変わりはありません。
sentences.translation: Whatever the intent may be, that doesn't change the fact that someone was hurt.

sentences.sentence: 犯人が誰{1:であれ}、どこにいようと、必ず私が捕まえる。
sentences.translation: Whoever the criminal may be, wherever they may be, I absolutely will catch them.

sentences.sentence: 人は、どんなに悪い状況{1:であれ}、前を向いて行きていく必要がある。
sentences.translation: No matter how bad of a situation one may be in, it is essential to move forward.

sentences.sentence: どの大学{1:であろうと}、進学先が決まってほっとした。
sentences.translation: No matter what university it may be, I'm just relieved to know which university I am going to.

sentences.sentence: お忙しい{1:ところを}お集まりいただき、ありがとうございます。
sentences.translation: Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedules to gather here.

sentences.sentence: 先生、お忙しい{1:ところを}すみません。ちょっとこれを教えていただけませんか。
sentences.translation: Teacher, I'm sorry to disturb you when you are busy, but could you please teach me about this?

sentences.sentence: いつもは電車で会社に行く{1:ところを}、今日は車で行った。
sentences.translation: Although I normally go to work by train, today I went by car.

sentences.sentence: 交通事故で命が危ない{1:ところを}、その医者に助けてもらいました。
sentences.translation: I was saved by a doctor when I was in a life threatening traffic accident.

sentences.sentence: すぐにご報告しなければならない{1:ところを}遅くなってしまって申し訳ありません。
sentences.translation: I am very sorry for the delay in time to report this when it should have been reported immediately.

sentences.sentence: ただ今、大雪の影響で電車が遅れております。お急ぎ{1:のところを}申し訳ございません。
sentences.translation: Right now, the train is delayed due to heavy snow. I'm truly sorry for the disturbance (although you must be busy / in a hurry).

sentences.sentence: 彼は試験中に隣の人の答えを見ている{1:ところを}先生に注意された。
sentences.translation: He was warned by the teacher while he was looking at the next person's answer during the test.

sentences.sentence: 犬{1:のように}働いている。
sentences.translation: I'm working like a dog

sentences.sentence: その二人は燃える{1:ような}愛がありますね。
sentences.translation: Those two seem to have a smoldering-like love for each other.

sentences.sentence: 彼は家族のためだけに生きていた{1:ように}思える。
sentences.translation: He seemed to live only for his family in my opinion.

sentences.sentence: 見える{1:ように}、このパソコンはとても古いですがまだ使われている。
sentences.translation: As you can see, this computer is very old, but it's still being used.

sentences.sentence: 私を子ども{1:のように}扱わないで。
sentences.translation: Don't treat me as a kid.

sentences.sentence: 日本語で新聞が読める{1:ように}、漢字の勉強をしています。
sentences.translation: I'm studying kanji so that I can read the newspaper in Japanese.

sentences.sentence: これはお茶{1:のような}味だ。
sentences.translation: This tastes like tea.

sentences.sentence: 学生達はあの先生が山{1:のような}宿題を出すので大嫌いである。
sentences.translation: They hate that teacher because he gives them a mountain of homework.

sentences.sentence: どんなに走っ{1:たところで}、絶対に間に合わないだろう。
sentences.translation: Even if I run, there's no way I'd make it in time.

sentences.sentence: 何回読ん{1:だところで}、意味は全く理解できない。
sentences.translation: Even if I read it numerous times, I wouldn't be able to understand anything.

sentences.sentence: その学校は、卒業し{1:たところで}、いい就職先はないだろう。
sentences.translation: Even if I graduate from that school, it's doubtful there are any good work opportunities after that.

sentences.sentence: 怒っ{1:たところで}、何も解決しないし、まずは落ち着いて話をきこう。
sentences.translation: Being upset won't help resolve anything. First calm down and then let's hear what you have to say.

sentences.sentence: そんな多額の借金は、家を売っ{1:たところで}、到底返せない。
sentences.translation: With such a large amount of debt, even if I sold my house, I wouldn't be able to pay it off.

sentences.sentence: 試験はもう終わったんだし、後悔し{1:たところで}結果は何も変わらないよ。
sentences.translation: The test is already over. Even if you have regrets now, that won't change the results at all.

sentences.sentence: 彼の借金は、休みなく毎日働い{1:たところで}、返せるような額ではない。
sentences.translation: With his loan, even if he worked everyday without taking weekends off, he still wouldn't be able to pay it off.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は多く見ても２０歳{1:というところだ}。
sentences.translation: She is 20 years old at most.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: ジムに行くのは週2、3回{1:というところだ}。
sentences.translation: I go to the gym at best 2 to 3 times a week.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 日本語の勉強時間は2、3時間{1:というところだ}。
sentences.translation: The time I spend studying Japanese is no more than 2 to 3 hours each day.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 時給は850円から1,000円{1:というところだ}。
sentences.translation: The hourly wage is from 850 to no more than 1,000 yen.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 明日の気温は２０度から３０度{1:といったところです}。
sentences.translation: Tomorrow's temperature will be around 20 to 30 degrees Celsius.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 毎日の勉強時間は1～2時間{1:というところなんです}が、もう少し増やすべきでしょうか。
sentences.translation: I spend roughly 1~2 hours studying every day, but perhaps I should increase it a little more?
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: もう少し今の仕事を続けようかと思っていますが、長くてもあと１年{1:といったところです}。
sentences.translation: I'm thinking of continuing my current job for a while, but for no more than a year.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 仕事が立て込んでて、いったい何時に帰れるのか{1:ってところだ}。
sentences.translation: I'm busy with work and I'm wondering what time I can go home.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/というところだ-といったところだ-iu-tokoro-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女は、店員が中国人だ{1:とみると}、中国語で話しかける。
sentences.translation: After realizing the shop staff is Chinese, she speaks to them in Chinese.

sentences.sentence: 本格的なイタリア料理屋ではない{1:とみると}、彼女はガッカリしていて、少ししか食べなかった。
sentences.translation: After realizing that it wasn't a full-fledged Italian restaurant, she was disappointed and only ate a little.

sentences.sentence: 妹は、男の人にお金げない{1:とみると}、急にその人に興味がなくなるようだ。
sentences.translation: As soon as she notices that a man has no money, she loses interest.

sentences.sentence: 困難になっている人{1:とみると}、必ず助けてあげたくなる。
sentences.translation: After realizing someone is in trouble, I definitely want to help them right away.

sentences.sentence: 同僚は問題がちょっと難しい{1:とみると}、自分で考えないで人に聞く。
sentences.translation: As soon as my colleague finds a question a little difficult, he ask others for help without thinking for himself.

sentences.sentence: 私はただ建前のことしか言わない人{1:とみると}、相手と付き合いたくなくなるタイプだ。
sentences.translation: I'm the type of person who doesn't want to hang out with other people after realizing they never share their private thoughts with me and only show me their public face (tatemae).

sentences.sentence: この店のパスタは冷凍した{1:ものと思われる}。
sentences.translation: The pasta in this shop is supposedly frozen.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 日本の少子化問題はさらに進む{1:と見られている}。
sentences.translation: The problem of Japan's declining birthrate is expected to go further.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼は、今一番人気のあるアイドルだ{1:と見られている}。
sentences.translation: He is believed to be the most popular idol right now.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 兄の普段の成績から、合格は間違いない{1:と見られている}。
sentences.translation: From his brother's usual grades, it is believed that he will pass.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 愛知県では、今後も大きいな地震が来る{1:と思われている}。
sentences.translation: It is expected that a large earthquake will occur in Aichi Prefecture.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: あの事件は事故ではなく、殺人である可能性が高い{1:と見られている}。
sentences.translation: It is believed that the incident was likely a murder, not an accident.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 近くの茂みから犯人が使った{1:ものと思われる}凶器が発見された。
sentences.translation: A weapon believed to have been used by the criminal was found in a nearby bush.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/ものと思われる-ものと見られる-mono-to-omowareru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 母は私に自分の部屋を片付け{1:させた}。
sentences.translation: My mother made me clean up my own room.

sentences.sentence: この仕事は部下に{1:やらせます}。
sentences.translation: I'll make one of my subordinates do this task.

sentences.sentence: 君を泣{1:かせる}つもりはなかった！
sentences.translation: I didn't mean to make you cry!

sentences.sentence: 僕に{1:やらせて}ください
sentences.translation: Please allow me to do it.

sentences.sentence: 息子はアニメを見たがっていますが、宿題が終わっていないので、見{1:させません}。
sentences.translation: My son wants to watch anime, but he hasn't finished his homework, so I won't let him watch it..

sentences.sentence: 雨の{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: It looks like rain..

sentences.sentence: その{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: It seems to be that way.

sentences.sentence: 今日は寒くなる{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: It looks like it's gonna get pretty cold today.

sentences.sentence: 彼女はうれしくない{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: She doesn't seem happy.

sentences.sentence: だいぶ変わった{1:ようだ}な。
sentences.translation: (it) seems to have changed considerably

sentences.sentence: 教室に来たけど誰もいない。今日は授業がない{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: I came to the classroom, but nobody was there. It seems like there's no class today.

sentences.sentence: それは本当に夢の{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: That's truly like a dream.

sentences.sentence: 今日は落ち込んでいる{1:ようです}ね。
sentences.translation: You seem down today.

sentences.sentence: 嵐はやんだ{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: It appears as if the storm has passed

sentences.sentence: 私は無知だった{1:ようだ}。
sentences.translation: It seems that I was a bit ignorant.

sentences.sentence: 彼のやったことは法律違反{1:とされる}。
sentences.translation: What he did is considered a violation of the law.

sentences.sentence: 息子は社会人として必要{1:とされている}知識に欠ける。
sentences.translation: My son is lacking knowledge considered necessary to survive in society as an adult.

sentences.sentence: 世界的に１３日の金曜日は不吉な日{1:とされている}。
sentences.translation: Friday the 13th is considered an unlucky day worldwide.

sentences.sentence: この会社には、良い指導者がいないのが一番の問題{1:とされている}。
sentences.translation: The fact that there aren't any good leaders is considered to be this company's biggest problem.

sentences.sentence: この物質は植物の生長を促進する{1:とされる}。
sentences.translation: This substances is considered to promote plant growth.

sentences.sentence: この新薬は、効果があるが副作用が強い{1:とされる}。
sentences.translation: This new drug is said to be effective but have strong side effects.

sentences.sentence: 木野子は「肉を食べる時」の最も近い食感を持つ植物{1:とされる}。
sentences.translation: Mushrooms are said to be the plant with the most similar food texture to "eating meat".

sentences.sentence: 彼は病気{1:だとみえる}。
sentences.translation: He appears to be sick.

sentences.sentence: 彼は運が向いてきた{1:と見える}。
sentences.translation: Luck seems to be heading his way.

sentences.sentence: 山田さんは忙しい{1:とみえて}、このごろ電話もしてこない。
sentences.translation: Mr. Yamada seems busy now, which may be why he hasn't called.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降った{1:とみえて}、道が濡れている。
sentences.translation: It seems that it just rained, as the road is wet.

sentences.sentence: 彼は苦労した{1:とみえて}、実際の年齢より老けて見える。
sentences.translation: He seems as if he has worked very hard through his life since he looks older than his actual age.

sentences.sentence: 彼は日本語の勉強が真剣になってきた{1:と見える}。
sentences.translation: He seems to have started to get more serious with his Japanese studies.

sentences.sentence: 今日は山田さんが席に座ったのを見ていない。山田さんは忙しい{1:とみえる}。
sentences.translation: Today I haven't seen Mr. Yamada in his seat at all. It seems that he is busy..

sentences.sentence: インフルエンザが治ったと{1:みえても}ウイルスはまだ残っている場合があるので、しばらくは薬を続けてください。
sentences.translation: Even if it seems as if you've recovered from the flu, the virus may still be lingering, so please continue to use your medicine.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:に言わせれば}、日本の一番美味しい料理はやっぱりラーメンだ。
sentences.translation: If you ask me, I would say that the best Japanese food is ramen.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:に言わせれば}、彼女は少し変わっている。
sentences.translation: If you ask me, she's a little strange.

sentences.sentence: ４０歳なんて、私{1:に言わせれば}まだまだ若いですよ。
sentences.translation: If you ask me, 40 is still young!

sentences.sentence: 父は天才と言われているが、私{1:に言わせれば}、単なる努力家だ。
sentences.translation: People often say my dad is a genius, but if you ask me, he's simply a hard worker.

sentences.sentence: 我々の世代の人間{1:に言わせれば}、あの人の行動は普通ではない。
sentences.translation: If you ask anyone from our generation, they'll agree that that person's actions are not normal.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:に言わせれば}、タバコを止められないやつは意志が弱いだけだと思う。
sentences.translation: If you ask me, I think people who can't quit smoking are just weak-willed.

sentences.sentence: 仕事を辞め{1:させられた}。
sentences.translation: I was forced to quit my job.

sentences.sentence: 息子は退学{1:させられた}。
sentences.translation: My son was expelled from school.

sentences.sentence: 彼女に2時間も待{1:たせられた}。
sentences.translation: She made me wait over 2 hours.

sentences.sentence: その映画は考え{1:させられる}。
sentences.translation: That movie makes you think.

sentences.sentence: 毎日母に野菜を食べ{1:させられる}。
sentences.translation: Every day, my mother forces me to eat vegetables.

sentences.sentence: フィアンセのお父さんにお酒を飲{1:ませられた}。
sentences.translation: My fiance's father made me to drink alcohol with him.

sentences.sentence: 親に毎日宿題を{1:させられる}。
sentences.translation: I am made to do my homework everyday by my parents.

sentences.sentence: 週末には家族のレストランで手伝{1:わせられる}。
sentences.translation: On weekends, I am forced to help out with the family restaurant.

sentences.sentence: 彼は支店から支店へと転勤{1:させられた}。
sentences.translation: He was forced to transfer from one company branch to another.

sentences.sentence: そんなことを{1:信じられない}。
sentences.translation: I am not able to believe such a story..

sentences.sentence: そこにあるいちごはすべて{1:食べられる}。
sentences.translation: You can eat any of the strawberries in there.

sentences.sentence: 今日は忙しすぎて、朝ごはんを{1:食べられなかった}。
sentences.translation: Today I was so busy and wasn't able to eat breakfast.

sentences.sentence: 納豆が{1:食べられる}の？
sentences.translation: Are you able to eat natto? (fermented soybeans)

sentences.sentence: 夜は寒くて{1:寝られない}。
sentences.translation: The nights are too cold to sleep.

sentences.sentence: 私はここにあまり長く{1:いられない}。
sentences.translation: I can't stay here for too long.

sentences.sentence: 私たちがここで何を{1:見つけられる}か見に行ってみましょう。
sentences.translation: Let's go to see what we can find here.

sentences.sentence: 私が{1:やれる}限りの事をしたい。
sentences.translation: I want to do everything that I can.

sentences.sentence: 入学式は4月1日に行う{1:ことになりました}。
sentences.translation: The entrance ceremony will be held on April 1st.

sentences.sentence: 私の母が入院する{1:ことになった}。
sentences.translation: My mother has been hospitalized.

sentences.sentence: 大阪に転勤する{1:ことになりました}。
sentences.translation: It's been decided that I'll be transferring to Osaka for work.

sentences.sentence: どうしてそれを学ぶ{1:ことになった}の？
sentences.translation: How did you come to learn that?

sentences.sentence: 両親は離婚という{1:ことになった}。
sentences.translation: My parents ended up deciding to get a divorce.

sentences.sentence: 明日新しい企画についての会議が行われる{1:ことになっている}。
sentences.translation: It's been decided that there will be a meeting regarding the new plan tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 日本では車は道路の左側を運転する{1:ことになっています}。
sentences.translation: In Japan cars drive on the left side of the road.

sentences.sentence: A会社では新入社員は朝、掃除する{1:ことになっている}。
sentences.translation: It's been decided that new employees at company A will do cleaning in the morning.

sentences.sentence: 今日は朝食を食べる{1:ことなしに}学校へ行った 。
sentences.translation: I went to school without eating breakfast.

sentences.sentence: 努力する{1:ことなしに}N１に合格はできない。
sentences.translation: One cannot pass the N1 without putting in the hard work.

sentences.sentence: 教えられる{1:ことなしに}できるようになる。
sentences.translation: They learn to do without being taught.

sentences.sentence: 今の状況を知る{1:ことなしに}、未来を予測することはできません。
sentences.translation: Without knowing the present situation, we will not be able to predict what will happen in the future.

sentences.sentence: 他人に迷惑をかける{1:ことなしに}は、生きてはいけない。
sentences.translation: You can't go through life without causing problems for others.

sentences.sentence: お互いが助け合う{1:ことなしに}、人間は生きていけない。
sentences.translation: Without cooperation with one another, humans will not be able to continue to exist.

sentences.sentence: 過去の事例を見る{1:ことなしに}、解決方法は見えてこないでしょう。
sentences.translation: It is not possible to find a solution without looking at past cases.

sentences.sentence: いつも深く考える{1:ことなしに}行動を起こしてしまう。
sentences.translation: I always take action without thinking too much about it.

sentences.sentence: これから毎日ランニングをする{1:ことにする}。
sentences.translation: I've decided to go running every day from now on.

sentences.sentence: タバコをやめる{1:ことにした}。
sentences.translation: I've decided to quit smoking.

sentences.sentence: 春休みに彼女と一緒に台湾に行く{1:ことにします}。
sentences.translation: I've decided to go to Taiwan with my girlfriend during spring break.

sentences.sentence: 寝る前に食べない{1:ことにした}。
sentences.translation: I've decided to stop eating before going to bed.

sentences.sentence: 毎朝、30分ジョギングする{1:ことにしています}。
sentences.translation: I've decided to go jogging every morning for 30 minutes.

sentences.sentence: 夏休みに友達と沖縄に旅行する{1:ことにします}。
sentences.translation: I've decided to go to Okinawa over summer break with my friends.

sentences.sentence: 太らないように夜9時を過ぎたら、私は食べない{1:ことにしています}。
sentences.translation: In order to not gain weight, I've decided to stop eating anything after 9pm.

sentences.sentence: それは、私にとって重要{1:なことだから}答えて。
sentences.translation: It is very important for me, so please answer it.

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:のことだから}上々でしょう。
sentences.translation: I'm sure you did an excellent (since it's you we're talking about).

sentences.sentence: 明るい彼女{1:のことだから}、どこへ行ってもすぐ友達ができるでしょう。
sentences.translation: Since she has a bright personality, she is able to make friends no matter where she goes.

sentences.sentence: 急を要する{1:ことだから}急いでください。
sentences.translation: Please hurry, it's urgent.

sentences.sentence: ケチで有名な彼{1:のことだから}百円だって貸してくれないだろうな。
sentences.translation: He's got a reputation of being stingy with money, so it's doubtful he'd lend even just 100 yen.

sentences.sentence: もう誰も来ない{1:ことだし}、店を閉めよう。
sentences.translation: Since no one else will come, let's go ahead and close up shop.

sentences.sentence: 君は遅刻したが, 昨夜の後で{1:のことだから}無理はない。
sentences.translation: You were late, but no wonder after last night.

sentences.sentence: それは無かっ{1:たことにして}下さい。
sentences.translation: Please just pretend that didn't happen.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: この話は聞かなかっ{1:たことにして}ください。
sentences.translation: Please pretend as if you did not hear anything.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 夫の不倫を見なかっ{1:たことにする}。
sentences.translation: I decided that I will pretend I did not see my husband's affair.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 風邪{1:だということにして}学校を休んだ。
sentences.translation: I pretended to have a cold and took a break from school.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女は、大学を卒業し{1:たことになっている}けれど、実際は中退したらしい。
sentences.translation: She is supposed to have graduated from college, but she seems to have dropped out.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 友達が書いたレポートを、自分が書い{1:たことにして}提出した。
sentences.translation: I submitted a report written by a friend as if I had written it.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 正式には社長は引退し{1:たことになっている}が, 実際は解任されたのだ。
sentences.translation: Officially the president retired, but actually he was dismissed.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/たことにする-たことになる-ta-koto-ni-suru-ta-koto-ni-naru-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 昼ごはんは何を食べ{1:ている}の？
sentences.translation: What do you eat for lunch?

sentences.sentence: 私もその本を読ん{1:でいる}！
sentences.translation: I'm also reading that book!

sentences.sentence: いつからサッカーをやっ{1:ている}のですか。
sentences.translation: How long have you been playing soccer?

sentences.sentence: 今日の日本は雨が降っ{1:ています}。
sentences.translation: It's raining in Japan today.

sentences.sentence: どれくらい日本に住ん{1:でいます}か？
sentences.translation: How long have you been living in Japan?

sentences.sentence: そのお店は何時までやっ{1:ている}のですか？
sentences.translation: Until what time is that shop open?

sentences.sentence: 山田さんはまだ寝{1:ている}と思います。
sentences.translation: I think Mr. Yamada is still sleeping.

sentences.sentence: 私もあなたを愛し{1:ています}。
sentences.translation: I love you too.

sentences.sentence: 第５条議長は全会議を主宰する{1:ものとする}。
sentences.translation: Article 5. The president shall preside at all meetings.

sentences.sentence: 科料は2万円を超えない{1:ものとする}。
sentences.translation: The fine shall not exceed 20,000 yen.

sentences.sentence: 契約の延長は、双方の同意による{1:ものとする}。
sentences.translation: The contract extension must be agreed by both parties.

sentences.sentence: 住所変更の通知は、その到達によって効力が発生する{1:ものとする }。
sentences.translation: Notice of a change of address shall be effective only upon receipt of concerned parties.

sentences.sentence: 委員会の決定は，その委員の過半数による{1:ものとする}。
sentences.translation: The board shall take its decisions by majority.

sentences.sentence: 商標は，登録した後に公告する{1:ものとする}。
sentences.translation: The trade mark shall be published after registration.

sentences.sentence: 本契約書は日本の法律に準拠し、日本の法律に従って解釈され、強制される{1:ものとする}。
sentences.translation: This agreement shall be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with the law of Japan.

sentences.sentence: そんなことをする{1:くらいなら}、死んだほうがましだ。
sentences.translation: I'd rather die than do that.

sentences.sentence: あんな嫌な人と一緒に働かなくちゃいけない{1:くらいなら}、私は会社を辞める。
sentences.translation: If I had to work with such an unpleasant person, I'd rather quit my job.

sentences.sentence: 家で休む{1:くらいなら}むしろ外出したい。
sentences.translation: I would rather go out than rest at home.

sentences.sentence: 友人を傷つける{1:くらいなら}、自分が我慢したほうがいい。
sentences.translation: I'd rather deal with it myself than hurt my friend.

sentences.sentence: 中途半端にやる{1:くらいなら}、やらない方がましだ。
sentences.translation: You may as well not do it at all rather than do it halfheartedly.

sentences.sentence: 彼と一緒に行く{1:くらいなら}家にいた方がましだ。
sentences.translation: I would rather stay at home than go with him.

sentences.sentence: 私は毎朝早く起きる{1:くらいなら}死んだ方がましだ。
sentences.translation: I would sooner die than get up early every morning.

sentences.sentence: 息子が病気で苦しむのを見る{1:くらいなら}、自分が病気になったほうがいい。
sentences.translation: I'd rather get sick myself than watch my son suffer.

sentences.sentence: そんな給料の低い会社で夜遅くまで働く{1:くらいなら}、アルバイトのほうがいいんじゃない。
sentences.translation: Rather than working late with a low salary at that company, wouldn't you be better off just working part time?

sentences.sentence: 息子が電話をよこすのは、お金に困った時{1:ぐらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: My son only calls me when he needs money.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: そんな事をするのは君{1:くらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: No one but you would do such a thing.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 仕事が忙しくて、ゆっくりできるのは週末{1:ぐらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: I'm busy with work and can only relax on weekends.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: あの学校は生徒が四五百{1:くらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: The school has not more than four or five hundred students.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女が仕事を辞めないように説得できるのは、君{1:ぐらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: You're the only one who can convince her to not quit her job.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私たちが買える家は、これ{1:ぐらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: The only house we can buy is one like this.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 君が受かるのは、このランクの大学{1:ぐらいのものだ}。
sentences.translation: You can only aim for the universities at this ranking / level.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: あの人のできるのは語学{1:くらいのものだろう}。
sentences.translation: Languages are almost the only things that he knows.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/くらいのものだ-ぐらいのものだ-kurai-no-mono-da-meaning/

sentences.sentence: スミスさんはもう来ない{1:ものとして}、始めましょう。
sentences.translation: Let's assume Mr. Smith is not coming and get started.

sentences.sentence: 何も知らない{1:ものとして}説明してください。
sentences.translation: Please explain it to me as though I know nothing.

sentences.sentence: 予算はそれしかない{1:ものとして}準備してくれ。
sentences.translation: Please make preparations under the assumption that this is all the budget we have.

sentences.sentence: 私はいない{1:ものとして}、授業を続いてください。
sentences.translation: Please continue the lesson as though I were not here.

sentences.sentence: 初級漢字は出来る{1:ものとして}、中級漢字のクラスを取った。
sentences.translation: I took the mid-level kanji class assuming I understood basic kanji.

sentences.sentence: たぶん行けないと思うので、私はいない{1:ものとして}、話を進めてください。
sentences.translation: I don't think I will be able to go, so please continue the talk assuming I will not be there.

sentences.sentence: 道に迷う{1:ことのないように}、グーグルマップで場所を確かめておいた。
sentences.translation: In order to not get lost, I checked the location on Google Maps.

sentences.sentence: 読書で目を使い過ぎる{1:ことのないように}しなさい。
sentences.translation: Make sure you don't overwork your eyes by reading too much.

sentences.sentence: 思い残す{1:ことのないように}、今を全力で生きる。
sentences.translation: In order to not have any regrets, I live now to the fullest.

sentences.sentence: 災害が来ても慌てる{1:ことのないよう}、日頃から準備しておこう。
sentences.translation: We should be more generally prepared for a disaster so that we do not panic when it happens.

sentences.sentence: 二度とこのような事故が起きる{1:ことのないよう}、安全対策を講じます。
sentences.translation: We will come up with a safety strategy to ensure that this kind of accident never happens again.

sentences.sentence: 今後、二度と同じことが起きる{1:ことがないよう}、努力いたします。
sentences.translation: I will work hard to ensure something like this doesn't happen again.

sentences.sentence: 今後、このような犯罪と関わる{1:ことのないように}注意して下さい。
sentences.translation: From now on, be careful to not get mixed up in this kind of crime again.

sentences.sentence: ここには私の名前が書い{1:てあります}。
sentences.translation: My name is written here.

sentences.sentence: ドアがわざと開け{1:てある}。
sentences.translation: The door has been left intentionally opened.

sentences.sentence: 宿題はもうやっ{1:てあります}。
sentences.translation: I have already finished my homework.

sentences.sentence: 夜には学校の入り口が閉め{1:てある}。
sentences.translation: At night, the school entrance is closed.

sentences.sentence: ここに何て書い{1:てある}の？
sentences.translation: What is written here?

sentences.sentence: 料理が作っ{1:てある}から、今日は家で食べる。
sentences.translation: I've already made some food, so today I will eat at home.

sentences.sentence: テニスをしよう。１０時３０分にコートを予約し{1:てある}から。
sentences.translation: Let's play tennis. I've booked a court for 10:30.

sentences.sentence: すでに言っ{1:てある}ように、これもあなたの仕事のうちだ。
sentences.translation: This is also part of your work, as I told you before.

sentences.sentence: テーブルの下に猫{1:がいる}。
sentences.translation: There is a cat below the table.

sentences.sentence: あなたは彼氏{1:がいる}の？
sentences.translation: Do you have a boyfriend?

sentences.sentence: 私には兄弟{1:がいない}んだ。
sentences.translation: I don't have any siblings.

sentences.sentence: 弟一人妹一人{1:がいます}。
sentences.translation: I have one younger brother and one younger sister.

sentences.sentence: その部屋に犬{1:がいる}。
sentences.translation: There is a dog in that room.

sentences.sentence: 今学校{1:に}だれも{1:いません}。
sentences.translation: There is no one at school right now.

sentences.sentence: 東京駅に観光者{1:が}いっぱい{1:いる}。
sentences.translation: There are a lot of tourists in Tokyo station.

sentences.sentence: 彼らは休む{1:必要がある}。
sentences.translation: They need to rest.

sentences.sentence: もっと勉強する{1:必要がある}。
sentences.translation: I need to study more.

sentences.sentence: 私の弟は今日学校に行く{1:必要がない}。
sentences.translation: My younger brother doesn't need to go to school today.

sentences.sentence: 俺にはもう{1:必要がない}。
sentences.translation: I have no need for this anymore.

sentences.sentence: 何でそんなことをする{1:必要がある}んですか？
sentences.translation: Why is it necessary to do that?

sentences.sentence: 医者は彼にタバコをやめる{1:必要がある}と言った。
sentences.translation: The doctor told him that he needs to quit smoking.

sentences.sentence: まず、部屋を掃除する{1:必要がある}。
sentences.translation: First, we need to clean this room.

sentences.sentence: 私はわざわざ店にまで買いに行く{1:必要がない}。
sentences.translation: I don't need to go out of my way to go and buy it at the store.

sentences.sentence: 日本の会社で働くために、JLPT N3に合格する{1:必要がある}。
sentences.translation: To work at a Japanese company, you need to pass JLPT N3.

sentences.sentence: あの人は誰{1:でしょう}？
sentences.translation: I wonder who that person is..

sentences.sentence: いい{1:でしょう}。
sentences.translation: That sounds/seems good.

sentences.sentence: この問題は簡単{1:でしょう}？
sentences.translation: This problem is easy, right?

sentences.sentence: 彼はもうすぐ来る{1:でしょう}。
sentences.translation: He should be here any second.

sentences.sentence: 頑張れば、いい大学に行ける{1:でしょう}。
sentences.translation: If you work hard, you should be able to get into a good university.

sentences.sentence: 今日の試合では、Aチームが勝つ{1:でしょう}。
sentences.translation: In today's match, surely team A will win.

sentences.sentence: この問題は、明日の試験に出る{1:でしょう}か。
sentences.translation: Will this question be on tomorrow's test?

sentences.sentence: 人気{1:がある}。
sentences.translation: to be popular.

sentences.sentence: 先月お金{1:が}ぜんぜん{1:なかった}。
sentences.translation: Last month I had no money.

sentences.sentence: へやにテレビ{1:があります}。
sentences.translation: I have a TV in my room.

sentences.sentence: 日本の好きじゃないところ{1:はあります}。
sentences.translation: There are some things I don't like about Japan.

sentences.sentence: このマンションにはへや{1:が}三つ{1:あります}。
sentences.translation: There are three rooms in this apartment.

sentences.sentence: 彼は金{1:がある}から新車が買える。
sentences.translation: He has money so he can buy a new car.

sentences.sentence: 今夜用事{1:がある}から行けない。
sentences.translation: I have things to do tonight so I can't go.

sentences.sentence: 彼はもうすぐ来る{1:だろう}。
sentences.translation: He should be coming any moment now.

sentences.sentence: そう{1:だろう}と思ったよ。
sentences.translation: I thought (figured) as much.

sentences.sentence: 明日はたぶん雨が降る{1:だろう}。空に雲がたくさんあるから。
sentences.translation: It will likely rain tomorrow.. There's a lot of clouds in the sky now..

sentences.sentence: 間違いない{1:だろう}。
sentences.translation: Surely there's no mistake.

sentences.sentence: たぶんこの雨は１時間ぐらいでやむ{1:だろう}。
sentences.translation: This rain will probably be over in about an hour or so.

sentences.sentence: あそこにいる人は誰{1:だろう}。
sentences.translation: I wonder who that person is over there.

sentences.sentence: この肉は、もう食べないほうがいい{1:だろう}。もう悪くなってしまった。
sentences.translation: It's probably best to not eat this meat. It's already gone bad..

sentences.sentence: どうして日本の夏はこんなに暑いん{1:だろう}。
sentences.translation: Why is Summer in Japan so hot..?

sentences.sentence: あなたは一人{1:じゃない}。
sentences.translation: You are not alone.

sentences.sentence: 危険{1:じゃない}の？
sentences.translation: Isn't it dangerous?

sentences.sentence: そんなつもり{1:じゃなかった}。
sentences.translation: That wasn't my plan/intention.

sentences.sentence: ごめんなさい！わざと{1:ではありませんでした}。
sentences.translation: I'm so sorry! It wasn't intentional.

sentences.sentence: 肉はあまり好き{1:じゃない}です。
sentences.translation: I don't really like meat.

sentences.sentence: 若いころはやさいが好き{1:じゃなかった}。
sentences.translation: I didn't like vegetables when I was younger.

sentences.sentence: 私は日本語が上手{1:ではない}。
sentences.translation: I am not good at Japanese (language).

sentences.sentence: ちょっと待っ{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Please wait a moment.

sentences.sentence: やめ{1:てください}！
sentences.translation: Please stop!

sentences.sentence: もっとゆっくり言っ{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Please speak more slowly.

sentences.sentence: 静かにし{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Please quiet down.

sentences.sentence: やって{1:みてください}。
sentences.translation: Give it a try!

sentences.sentence: どうぞ座っ{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Please go ahead and sit down.

sentences.sentence: 先生、この問題分かりません。もう一回説明し{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Teacher, I don't understand this question. Could you please explain one more time?

sentences.sentence: 日本語を教え{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Please teach me Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 私に知らせ{1:てください}。
sentences.translation: Please let me know.

sentences.sentence: 今日は暑い{1:です}ね。
sentences.translation: It's pretty hot today, isn't it?

sentences.sentence: かれは私の友だち{1:です}。
sentences.translation: He is my friend.

sentences.sentence: 日本の文化が好き{1:です}。
sentences.translation: I like Japanese culture

sentences.sentence: 昔はサッカーが趣味{1:だった}が、今はやっていない。
sentences.translation: Soccer used to be my hobby, but I don't play anymore.

sentences.sentence: 天気がいい{1:から}、外に行きたい。
sentences.translation: Since the weather is nice, I want to go outside.

sentences.sentence: 私はすぐ戻る{1:から}、ここでちょっと待ってください。
sentences.translation: I'll return shortly, so please wait here just a moment.

sentences.sentence: これ{1:から}もよろしくお願いします。
sentences.translation: From now on, let's have a good relationship (I'll be counting on you).

sentences.sentence: ここ{1:から}あの駅まで歩いてどれぐらいかかりますか？
sentences.translation: How long does it take to walk from here to that station?

sentences.sentence: お店は何時{1:から}何時まで開いていますか？
sentences.translation: What are the shop's opening hours?

sentences.sentence: 私の持っているお金はこれ{1:だけ}だ。
sentences.translation: This is the only money I have.

sentences.sentence: ちょっと見ている{1:だけ}です。
sentences.translation: I'm just looking around.

sentences.sentence: 好きじゃない食べ物はトマト{1:だけ}だ。
sentences.translation: The only food I dislike are tomatoes.

sentences.sentence: ただ話していた{1:だけ}です。
sentences.translation: I was just speaking.

sentences.sentence: 問題はそれ{1:だけ}だと思うかい？
sentences.translation: You think that's all there is to this problem?

sentences.sentence: 私は一人{1:だけ}でできます。
sentences.translation: I can do it (just) by myself.

sentences.sentence: 出来る{1:だけ}新しい漢字を勉強したい。
sentences.translation: I want to study as much new kanji as possible.

sentences.sentence: その女の子はただ泣く{1:だけ}だった。
sentences.translation: That little girl did nothing but cry.

sentences.sentence: 彼女が信頼できるのは彼{1:だけ}だ。
sentences.translation: He is the only one that she can trust.

sentences.sentence: 泣か{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: Please don't cry.

sentences.sentence: このパソコンを使わ{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: Please don't use this computer.

sentences.sentence: 明日の予定を忘れ{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: Don't forget about our plans tomorrow!

sentences.sentence: 私のことを心配し{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: Please don't worry about me.

sentences.sentence: 道の邪魔をし{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: Please don't block the street.

sentences.sentence: 事務所で食べ{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: Please don't eat in the office.

sentences.sentence: 一人にしたいからここに来{1:ないでください}。
sentences.translation: I want to be alone, so please don't come over here.

sentences.sentence: 日本に来{1:てはじめ}てラーメンを食べた。
sentences.translation: I had never eaten ramen before coming to Japan.

sentences.sentence: 日本語を勉強し{1:てはじめて}、勉強の楽しさが分かった。
sentences.translation: Only after I started studying Japanese did I realize the joys of studying.

sentences.sentence: 試験に落ち{1:てはじめて}、ちゃんと勉強しないといけないと思った。
sentences.translation: I felt like I really needed to start studying seriously after failing that exam.

sentences.sentence: 先生に教えていただい{1:てはじめて}、プログラミングの面白さが分かりました。
sentences.translation: I didn’t realize how interesting programming was until my teacher taught me.

sentences.sentence: 海外に行っ{1:てはじめて}、自分の世界の狭さを知った。
sentences.translation: Only after going abroad, did I realize how small my world was.

sentences.sentence: 自分の子供が出来{1:てはじめて}、大人になった気がした。
sentences.translation: I did not feel like I had become an adult until I had my own child.

sentences.sentence: 歯医者に行っ{1:てはじめて}、虫歯があることを知った。
sentences.translation: I didn't know I had a cavity until I went to the dentist.

sentences.sentence: 社会人になっ{1:てはじめて}、責任感を持つようになった。
sentences.translation: I didn't feel a sense of responsibility until I became a working adult.

sentences.sentence: 図書館で宿題をし{1:たあとで}、帰ります。
sentences.translation: I will head home after I finish my homework at the library.

sentences.sentence: 晩ご飯{1:の後で}アイスを食べた。
sentences.translation: After dinner, I had some ice cream.

sentences.sentence: 授業が終わった{1:後で}、部活に行く。
sentences.translation: After classes finish, I will go to my club activities.

sentences.sentence: お酒を飲んだ{1:後で}、運転してはダメですよ！
sentences.translation: Driving after drinking is not permitted.

sentences.sentence: 昼ご飯を食べた{1:後で}、30分ほど昼寝をした。
sentences.translation: After eating dinner, I took a nap for about a half hour.

sentences.sentence: 大学を卒業した{1:後で}、本当の社会人になりました。
sentences.translation: After graduating from university, I became a true member of society.

sentences.sentence: 宿題{1:の後で}、友だちと遊びに行きます。
sentences.translation: After finishing my homework, I'm going out with my friend.

sentences.sentence: 仕事{1:の後で}、飲み会があります。
sentences.translation: People are going out for drinks after work tonight!

sentences.sentence: 彼女は寂し{1:がり屋}です。
sentences.translation: She is a lonely person.

sentences.sentence: この仕事は恥ずかし{1:がり}の人には向いていない 。
sentences.translation: This job is not suited for shy people.

sentences.sentence: 彼は強{1:がり}だけど、優しい心の人です。
sentences.translation: He acts tough, but he has a kind heart.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は怖{1:がり}だからホラー映画はダメだ。
sentences.translation: She tends to scare easily so horror movies are not good.

sentences.sentence: 私は寒{1:がり}なので、冬はあまり好きじゃない。
sentences.translation: I'm sensitive to the cold, so I don't really like winter.

sentences.sentence: 彼の奥さんは目立ち{1:たがり}屋だ。
sentences.translation: His wife likes to be the center of attention.

sentences.sentence: 日本語をもっと勉強し{1:たい}です。
sentences.translation: I want to study more Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 先生、聞き{1:たい}ことがありますが。
sentences.translation: Sensei, there is something I'd like to ask you..

sentences.sentence: 早く結婚し{1:たい}。
sentences.translation: I want to hurry up and get married.

sentences.sentence: 自転車がこわれたから、新しいのを買い{1:たい}。
sentences.translation: My bicycle broke, so I want to buy a new one.

sentences.sentence: 子どものころから、ずっと日本に行き{1:たかった}。
sentences.translation: Ever since I was little, I always wanted to go to Japan.

sentences.sentence: つかれたから、もう勉強し{1:たくない}。
sentences.translation: I'm tired and don't want to study anymore.

sentences.sentence: 将来は日本の会社で働き{1:たい}です。
sentences.translation: In the future, I'd like to work for a Japanese company.

sentences.sentence: お金がたくさんあったら、何をし{1:たい}ですか？
sentences.translation: What would you want to do if you had a lot of money?

sentences.sentence: その子が家に帰り{1:たがっている}。
sentences.translation: That kid seems like he wants to go home.

sentences.sentence: 木村さんが、あなたに{1:会いたがって}いましたよ。
sentences.translation: Kimura-san wanted (wants) to see you.

sentences.sentence: 娘は新しいi-phoneを買い{1:たがっています}。
sentences.translation: My daughter wants to buy the new i-phone.

sentences.sentence: 息子が塾に行き{1:たがらない}。
sentences.translation: My son is reluctant to go to cram school.

sentences.sentence: 息子はアニメを見{1:たがっています}が、宿題が終わっていないので、見させません。
sentences.translation: My son wants to watch anime, but he hasn't finished his homework, so I won't let him watch it..

sentences.sentence: 彼女は仕事を辞め{1:たがっています}が、転職先が見つからず、なかなか辞めることができません。
sentences.translation: She wants to quit her job, but is unable to find a new job so she can't quite do it yet.

sentences.sentence: みんな早く帰り{1:たがっている}のに、部長の話が長くてなかなか帰れません。
sentences.translation: Although everyone wants to head home early, the section manager talks for a long time and nobody can leave..

sentences.sentence: 息子が全然学校に行き{1:たがらない}んですが、学校で何かあったのでしょうか。
sentences.translation: My son doesn't want to go to school at all. I wonder if something happened there..

sentences.sentence: 私はそれが気になっ{1:てしょうがない}。
sentences.translation: I can't help thinking about that.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今日は寒く{1:てしょうがない}。
sentences.translation: It's simply too cold today.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 今日は何もすることがなくて、暇で{1:仕方がない}。
sentences.translation: I have nothing to do today and am very bored.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: お金をくれて、嬉しく{1:てしょうがない}。
sentences.translation: I was given some money and feel so happy.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: バスで行くのは、時間がかかっ{1:てしょうがない}。
sentences.translation: Going by bus takes more time, but it can't be helped.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 海外で一人暮らしを始めたばかりなので、寂しく{1:てしかたがありません}。
sentences.translation: I feel a little lonely because I just started living abroad alone, but it cannot be helped.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 最近はやることがないので、毎日が暇{1:でしかたがない}。
sentences.translation: I have nothing to do lately and am bored everyday, but it can't be helped.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 好きなアイドルのライブのチケットが売れ切った。遅刻して、もう買えないので残念{1:でしょうがない}。
sentences.translation: The concert tickets for the idol I like sold out. I didn't buy them in time and unfortunately there's nothing I can do..
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/てしょうがない-te-shou-ga-nai-て仕方がない-shikata-ga-nai-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 一度だけ{1:ならまだしも}、二度も失敗してしまった。
sentences.translation: It would be alright if I only messed up once, but I failed twice..

sentences.sentence: あの人、wordやexcelが使えないの{1:はまだしも}、メールもできないらしいよ。
sentences.translation: It's one thing that they don't know how to use word and excel, but apparently they don't even know how to use email.

sentences.sentence: 僕の英語力では、旅行{1:はまだしも}、留学なんて無理です。
sentences.translation: With my English ability, I can handle a bit of traveling, but studying abroad is out of the question.

sentences.sentence: 数分{1:ならまだしも}、30分も待ってません。
sentences.translation: I'm alright waiting a few minutes, but 30 minutes is unacceptable.

sentences.sentence: 50年前{1:ならまだしも}、今そんなことを信じてる人はいません。
sentences.translation: If it were 50 years ago, someone may believe you, but no one is going to believe that story now.

sentences.sentence: 数日{1:ならまだしも}、10日間も滞納しています。
sentences.translation: It would be alright if it were just a few days, but you are currently 10 days behind on your payment.

sentences.sentence: 文句を言うだけ{1:ならまだしも}、女性に暴力を振るうのは絶対にいけません。
sentences.translation: It's one thing to voice a complaint, but violence against women is absolutely not OK.

sentences.sentence: ハンバーガーはマスタード{1:抜きで}お願いします。
sentences.translation: No mustard on the hamburger please!

sentences.sentence: 冗談{1:抜きで}真面目に考えってください。
sentences.translation: Stop joking around and think about it seriously.

sentences.sentence: 今夜、仕事の話は{1:抜きにして}楽しく飲みましょう！
sentences.translation: Tonight, let's not talk about work and just enjoy ourselves!

sentences.sentence: すみません、チーズ{1:抜きで}お願いできますか。
sentences.translation: Excuse me, can I please have mine without cheese?

sentences.sentence: 毎回遅刻してくるし、今度のパーティーはトムさん{1:抜きで}やろうか。
sentences.translation: Since he always comes late, let's have the next party without Tom.

sentences.sentence: 彼女{1:抜きでは}、このプロジェクトは成功しなかっただろう。
sentences.translation: Without her, this project would likely not have succeeded.

sentences.sentence: ベトナム{1:と言えば}、バイクが多いですね。
sentences.translation: Speaking of Vietnam, there are a lot of bikes.

sentences.sentence: 大阪の食べ物{1:と言えば}、たこ焼きです。
sentences.translation: Speaking of Osaka food, takoyaki comes to mind.

sentences.sentence: 本{1:と言えば}これを読んだか？
sentences.translation: Speaking of books, have you read this one?

sentences.sentence: 日本の夏{1:と言えば}、とても暑いです！
sentences.translation: Speaking of summer in Japan, it's extremely hot!

sentences.sentence: 外国語{1:と言えば}、中国語を話せますか。
sentences.translation: Speaking of foreign languages, can you speak Chinese?

sentences.sentence: 日本{1:と言えば}、ラーメンとお寿司が名物です。
sentences.translation: Speaking of Japan, it's famous foods are ramen and sushi.

sentences.sentence: 彼はどちらか{1:と言えば}ケチなほうだ。
sentences.translation: He's a bit on the stingy side.

sentences.sentence: 春{1:と言えば}、卒業の季節だ。
sentences.translation: Speaking of spring, it's graduation season (in Japan).

sentences.sentence: 行くか行かないか{1:はともかく}、レストランの予約だけはしておこう。
sentences.translation: Whether or not we are going, let's at least make the restaurant reservation.

sentences.sentence: この店の品物は、質{1:はともかく}種類は多い。
sentences.translation: Regardless of the quality of the goods at this store, they have a lot of variety.

sentences.sentence: 奥さんの料理は見た目{1:はともかく}味は美味しい。
sentences.translation: Regardless of weather it looks good or not, my wife's cooking tastes pretty good.

sentences.sentence: 漢字を読むこと{1:はともかく}、書くことは苦手だ。
sentences.translation: I can't even write kanji, let alone read it.

sentences.sentence: あの俳優は、顔{1:はともかくとして}演技が素晴らしい。
sentences.translation: Whether or not he/she has a nice face, they are a great actor.

sentences.sentence: {1:ともかく}無事でよかった。
sentences.translation: In any case, I'm glad you're OK.

sentences.sentence: 値段{1:はともかく}、今晩泊まれるホテルが見つかってよかった。
sentences.translation: Regardless of the price, I'm just glad I found a hotel to stay at tonight.

sentences.sentence: 結婚相手は、顔{1:はともかく}、料理ができる人がいいなぁ。
sentences.translation: For a marriage partner, their face isn't so important to me, but I'd really like to have someone who can cook.

sentences.sentence: 桜{1:というと}、花見だ。
sentences.translation: Speaking of cherry blossoms, flower viewing comes to mind.

sentences.sentence: 人気があるアニメ{1:というと}、ワンピースだ。
sentences.translation: Speaking of popular anime, One Piece comes to mind.

sentences.sentence: 日本料理{1:というと}、すしが一番有名だ。
sentences.translation: Speaking of Japanese food, sushi is the most popular.

sentences.sentence: どちらか{1:というと}暇です。
sentences.translation: If anything, I'm bored.

sentences.sentence: デトロイト市{1:と言うと}、どんなイメージをしますか？
sentences.translation: When you think of Detroit city, what image do you have?

sentences.sentence: 日本の都会{1:と言うと}、東京と大阪でしょう。
sentences.translation: Speaking of Japan's big cities, Tokyo and Osaka come to mind.

sentences.sentence: 日本{1:というと}、美味しいものの天国だ。
sentences.translation: Speaking of Japan, it's a delicious food paradise!

sentences.sentence: 海外で人気のあるアニメ{1:というと}ドラゴンボールでしょう！
sentences.translation: When thinking of anime that is popular abroad, surely Dragon Ball comes to mind!

sentences.sentence: あなたに会いたく{1:てたまらない}。
sentences.translation: I want to see you so bad...

sentences.sentence: 日本の夏は暑すぎ{1:てたまらない}。
sentences.translation: I can't stand Japan's hot summer.

sentences.sentence: 私は外国へ行きたく{1:てたまらない}。
sentences.translation: I am aching to go abroad.

sentences.sentence: 子どものことが心配{1:でたまらない}。
sentences.translation: I'm overwhelmed with worry about my children.

sentences.sentence: 私は目が痛く{1:てたまらない}。
sentences.translation: My eyes hurt so much I can't stand it.

sentences.sentence: 彼女が出来て嬉しく{1:てたまらない}。
sentences.translation: I'm so glad that I was able to get a girlfriend!

sentences.sentence: あの新しい映画を観たく{1:てたまらない}。
sentences.translation: I can't wait to watch that new movie!

sentences.sentence: そんなことをす{1:べきではない}。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't do such a thing.

sentences.sentence: 寝る前にアイスを食べる{1:べきではない}。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't eat ice cream before going to bed.

sentences.sentence: 私達は遅く寝る{1:べきではありません}。
sentences.translation: We shouldn't go to bed late.

sentences.sentence: 約束を破る{1:べきではありません}。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't break your promises.

sentences.sentence: 過去を忘れる{1:べきではありません}。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't forget about your past.

sentences.sentence: 人の迷惑になることをす{1:べきではありません}。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't do anything that causes trouble for others.

sentences.sentence: 希望を捨てる{1:べきではありません}。
