sentences.sentence: {1:そのために}英語で話せるようになりたい。
sentences.translation: I want to become able to speak English for that reason.

sentences.sentence: 英語の教師になりたいです。{1:そのために}いろいろな資格も取らないといけません。
sentences.translation: I want to become an English teacher. In order to do so, I need to obtain various certifications.

sentences.sentence: 来年留学するつもりだ。{1:そのために}、アルバイトしてお金をためている。
sentences.translation: I am planning to study abroad next year so I am working part-time to save money for my trip.

sentences.sentence: 隣の駅で事故があったらしい。{1:そのために}電車がまだ着いていない。
sentences.translation: I heard that there was an accident at the next station. Because of that, the train still hasn't arrived.

sentences.sentence: やる{1:しかない}。
sentences.translation: You just gotta do it.

sentences.sentence: 卒業できなかったから、バイトをする{1:しかない}。
sentences.translation: Because I did not graduate, my only option is part time work.

sentences.sentence: パソコンが直せないから、新しいのを買う{1:しかなかった}。
sentences.translation: My computer could not be fixed so I had no choice but to buy a new one.

sentences.sentence: 電車もバスも止まってしまったから、歩く{1:しかない}。
sentences.translation: Since the train and bus are not working, there is no choice but to walk.

sentences.sentence: あの大学に合格したかったら、毎日勉強する{1:しかない}ですよ。
sentences.translation: If you want to get into that university, you need to study every single day.

sentences.sentence: コンビニでお弁当を買ったらお箸が入ってなかったので、手で食べる{1:しかなかった}。
sentences.translation: I bought a bento lunch box from a convenient store, but there were no chopsticks included so I had to eat it by hand.

sentences.sentence: バスはここまでしか行かないので、この先は歩く{1:しかない}。
sentences.translation: The bus only comes up to here, so from here on out there is no option but to walk.

sentences.sentence: 自分で何とかしたかったんですが、こうなったら、もう両親に頼む{1:しかありません}。
sentences.translation: I really wanted to do this by myself, but with things this bad I've got no option but to rely on my parents.

sentences.sentence: {1:なぜなら}彼は病気だったからです。
sentences.translation: The reason is because he was sick.

sentences.sentence: 私は毎日本を読みます。{1:なぜかというと}、本が大好きだからです。
sentences.translation: I read books everyday. The reason is because I love books.

sentences.sentence: 買いたいけど買えません。{1:なぜならば}お金がないからです。
sentences.translation: I want to buy it, but I cannot because I have no money.

sentences.sentence: 学校を変えた。{1:なぜなら}、サッカー部がなかったからだ。
sentences.translation: I changed schools because there was no soccer club at my old school.

sentences.sentence: 来月、アメリカに帰る予定です。{1:なぜなら}、妹の結婚式に出席するからです。
sentences.translation: Next month I am going back to America because I will be attending my younger sister's wedding.

sentences.sentence: 仕事を辞めたくても辞められません。{1:なぜなら}、借金があるからです。
sentences.translation: Even if I wanted to, I cannot quit my job because I have debts to pay.

sentences.sentence: 私は獣医になりたい。{1:なぜなら}私は動物が大好きだからです。
sentences.translation: I want to become a veterinarian because I love animals.

sentences.sentence: 私は数学が好きです、{1:なぜなら}数学は最も得意な科目だからです。
sentences.translation: I like math because it is my best subject.

sentences.sentence: 彼、彼女ができた{1:んだって}。
sentences.translation: I heard he got a girlfriend.

sentences.sentence: 知らない{1:んだって}。
sentences.translation: They said that they did not know.

sentences.sentence: クリスさんがJLPTのN2合格した{1:んだって}。
sentences.translation: I heard that Chris passed the JLPT N2!

sentences.sentence: 妹が結婚する{1:んだって}。
sentences.translation: I heard that my sister is going to get married.

sentences.sentence: この店のカレー、美味しい{1:んだって}。
sentences.translation: I heard that this restaurant’s curry is delicious.

sentences.sentence: 聞いた？トムさんは卒業したら国に帰る{1:んだって}。
sentences.translation: Did you hear? Tom is heading back to his home country after graduation.

sentences.sentence: 明日はめちゃくちゃ寒くなる{1:んだって}。出かける時に上着を着てね。
sentences.translation: I heard tomorrow is going to get much worse. Make sure to wear a jacket when you go out.

sentences.sentence: あの二人は来月結婚する{1:だって}。付き合うのは1ヶ月にも経ってないのに、早いですね！
sentences.translation: I hear those 2 are getting married next month. They've only been dating for 1 month, that's really fast!

sentences.sentence: 試験の範囲は、教科書の100ページから150ページまで{1:なんですって}。
sentences.translation: I heard that the test will cover from page 100 until page 150.

sentences.sentence: 彼は獣医、{1:つまり}、動物の医者です。
sentences.translation: He’s a veterinarian. In other words, he’s an animal doctor.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は姉の娘だ。{1:つまり}、私にとっては姪です。
sentences.translation: She is my sister's daughter. In other words, my niece.

sentences.sentence: 母の兄、{1:つまり}僕の伯父は、大学の先生です。
sentences.translation: My mother's older brother, in other words, my uncle, is a college professor.

sentences.sentence: 彼女はその日の前日、{1:つまり}５月５日に彼に会った。
sentences.translation: She met him the day before, that is to say May fifth.

sentences.sentence: 彼は今日から１週間後、{1:つまり}１２月１０日に帰ってくる。
sentences.translation: He will be back a week from today, that is, on December 10.

sentences.sentence: {1:つまり}、うちの学校の生徒だということ？
sentences.translation: You mean you’re a student at my school?

sentences.sentence: 祖母は耳が遠い、{1:つまり}、耳が少し不自由なのだ。
sentences.translation: My grandmother is hard of hearing. In other words she is slightly deaf.

sentences.sentence: ビルさんは、携帯もパソコンも持っていません。{1:つまり}、メールで連絡はできません。
sentences.translation: Bill does not have a cell phone or computer. In other words, we cannot contact him by email.

sentences.sentence: 母は天文学、{1:つまり}星に関する科学を研究しています。
sentences.translation: My mother studies astronomy, or the science of stars.

sentences.sentence: 彼は仕事をサボっ{1:た結果}として首になった。
sentences.translation: As a result of him skipping work, he was fired.

sentences.sentence: みんなで相談し{1:た結果}、今回は参加しないことにした。
sentences.translation: After consulting with everyone, I've decided to not participate this time.

sentences.sentence: ほとんど勉強をしなかった。{1:その結果}、試験に落ちてしまった。
sentences.translation: I barely studied. As a result, I failed my exam.

sentences.sentence: これは君の努力{1:の結果}だと思います。
sentences.translation: I think this is a result of your hard effort.

sentences.sentence: 毎日ご飯の量を減らし{1:た結果}、1ヶ月で3キロ体重が減った。
sentences.translation: As a result of reducing the amount of food I eat every day, I lost 3 kilograms after 1 month.

sentences.sentence: 半年ダイエットを続けた。{1:その結果}、10キロをやせた。
sentences.translation: I continued to diet for half a year. As a result, I lost 10 kilos.

sentences.sentence: 兄は、人の何倍も努力した。{1:その結果}、大学で成功した。
sentences.translation: My older brother worked way harder than anyone else. As a result, he has succeeded in college.

sentences.sentence: 無理をし{1:た結果}、体を壊して入院することになった。
sentences.translation: As a result of overdoing it, I ended up in the hospital.

sentences.sentence: 私たちは話し合っ{1:た結果}、それは不要と考える。
sentences.translation: As a result of what we discussed, we believe that is unnecessary.

sentences.sentence: 料金を10％安くし{1:た結果}、利用者がいつもより30％も増えた。
sentences.translation: As a result of reducing the fee by 10%, there was an increase of 30% of users.

sentences.sentence: 風邪ぎみなら、早く寝る{1:ことです}よ。
sentences.translation: If you feel like you're catching a cold, you should go to bed early.

sentences.sentence: 無理をしない{1:ことだ}よ。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't push yourself too hard

sentences.sentence: N2に合格したかったら、とにかく漢字を覚える{1:ことだ}よ。
sentences.translation: If you want to pass the N2, you should memorize kanji.

sentences.sentence: 日本語がうまくなりたかったら、日本人の恋人をつくる{1:ことです}よ。
sentences.translation: If you want to improve your Japanese, you should get a Japanese boyfriend/girlfriend.

sentences.sentence: 一度に全部は無理です。毎日少しずつ勉強する{1:ことです}。
sentences.translation: It is impossible to do it all at once. It is best to study a little bit everyday.

sentences.sentence: いやなことを忘れるにはとにかく笑う{1:ことです}よ。
sentences.translation: In order to help forget something negative, you should start by smiling.

sentences.sentence: 仕事をしながら休息する術を覚える{1:ことだ}。
sentences.translation: You should learn to relax while you are working.

sentences.sentence: 信頼されたければ、信頼性のある人になる{1:ことだ}。
sentences.translation: If you want to be trusted, first become a trustworthy person yourself.

sentences.sentence: 何度注意した{1:ことか}？
sentences.translation: How many times have I warned you?

sentences.sentence: この景色はなんときれい{1:なことか}。
sentences.translation: This scenery is incredibly beautiful!

sentences.sentence: 僕は合格できたら、どんなに嬉しい{1:ことか}。
sentences.translation: If I am able to pass, I will be immeasurably happy!

sentences.sentence: 今まで何度酒をやめようと思った{1:ことか}。
sentences.translation: Until now how many times have I thought about quitting drinking?

sentences.sentence: 学生時代、奨学金がもらえてどれほど助かった{1:ことか}。
sentences.translation: Getting a scholarship when I was a student really saved me..

sentences.sentence: 大好きな人に好きって伝えられることがどんなに幸せな{1:ことか}。
sentences.translation: It is such a happy feeling being able to tell the person you love that you love them.

sentences.sentence: どれほどこの機会を待ちわびた{1:ことか}。
sentences.translation: I have waited too long for this chance!

sentences.sentence: 出産後、また働ける職場がないと言う事がどんなにひどい{1:ことか}。
sentences.translation: It is beyond horrible that after giving birth I am not able to find a place where I can work again.

sentences.sentence: ニュースによると、明日は雨が降る{1:ということだ}。
sentences.translation: I heard on the news that it will rain tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 先ほど、山田さんから電話があって、少し遅れる{1:とのことです}。
sentences.translation: I heard Mr. Yamada called earlier and said he would be a bit late.

sentences.sentence: 田中さんは熱があるので、明日は行けない{1:とのことだ}。
sentences.translation: Mr. Tanaka has a fever, so it doesn't seem like he will be able to go tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 6月は暑くなる{1:とのことでした}が、それほど暑くなかったです。
sentences.translation: It seemed like it would get really hot in June, but it didn't end up being that hot.

sentences.sentence: 先輩は来月で会社を辞める{1:とのことです}が、その話は本当ですか。
sentences.translation: Is the story I heard that you will be quitting next month true?

sentences.sentence: 物価は来月からさらに上がる{1:ということだ}。
sentences.translation: I heard that prices will rise again even higher next month.

sentences.sentence: 試験の結果は８５％、つまり合格{1:ということだ}。
sentences.translation: Your test score was 85%. In other words, you passed.

sentences.sentence: 彼の姿は今日も見えない。つまりまたサボった{1:ってことだ}。
sentences.translation: I haven't see him around at all today either. In other words, he is skipping work again.

sentences.sentence: ここは「立入禁止」{1:ということは}、つまり、「入ってはいけない」{1:ということだ}。
sentences.translation: This sign for "tachiiri kinshi" means that one most not enter.

sentences.sentence: 部長に「明日から来なくてもいい」と言われた。つまり首{1:ということ}かな。
sentences.translation: My manager told me not to come to work tomorrow. In other words, I guess I'm fired.

sentences.sentence: 独身でい続けるのは一人で寂しく死ぬ{1:ということ}だ。
sentences.translation: Continuing on single as you are now means you will die sad and alone.

sentences.sentence: 次のテストっていつ{1:だっけ}？
sentences.translation: When is the next test again?

sentences.sentence: あなたの誕生日、いつ{1:だったっけ}？
sentences.translation: When was your birthday again?

sentences.sentence: どこに住んでいるん{1:だっけ}？
sentences.translation: Where did you live again?

sentences.sentence: 自己紹介し{1:たっけ}？
sentences.translation: Have I already introduced myself?

sentences.sentence: 何の話をしてい{1:たっけ}？
sentences.translation: What were we talking about again?

sentences.sentence: 誰{1:だっけ}？
sentences.translation: Who were you again? (I can't seem to remember)

sentences.sentence: 東京へ行くのは、来週{1:だったっけ}？
sentences.translation: When were you going to Tokyo again, was it next week?

sentences.sentence: あの歌手の名前はなんと言いまし{1:たっけ}？
sentences.translation: What was that singer's name again..?

sentences.sentence: 君{1:ほど}美しい人はいません！
sentences.translation: There is no one that rivals your beauty.

sentences.sentence: 死ぬ{1:ほど}のどがかわいている。
sentences.translation: I'm so thirsty I could die..

sentences.sentence: 今年{1:ほど}雨の降った年はなかった。
sentences.translation: It rained more this year than any other year.

sentences.sentence: 年をとる{1:ほど}体が弱くなる。
sentences.translation: My body becomes weaker as I grow older.

sentences.sentence: ビックリする{1:ほど}大きい赤ちゃん。
sentences.translation: The child was surprisingly large.

sentences.sentence: JLPT先生{1:ほど}、生徒のことを大切に思っている先生はいません。
sentences.translation: There is no teacher that cares as much about their students as JLPT Sensei.

sentences.sentence: 彼はあなたの父親でもおかしくない{1:ほど}年上だ。
sentences.translation: He's old enough to be your dad.

sentences.sentence: 駅に近い{1:ほど}家賃が高い。
sentences.translation: The closer to the station, the more expensive the rent.

sentences.sentence: 謝る{1:ことはない}よ。
sentences.translation: There is no need for you to apologize

sentences.sentence: 明日のテストは簡単だから、心配する{1:ことはない}よ。
sentences.translation: Tomorrow's test will be easy, so it's nothing to worry about.

sentences.sentence: 何も怖がる{1:ことはない}。
sentences.translation: You have nothing to fear.

sentences.sentence: 時間は十分あるから急ぐ{1:ことはない}。
sentences.translation: There is plenty of time so there is no need to rush.

sentences.sentence: 自分を責める{1:ことはない}。
sentences.translation: There's no need to blame yourself..

sentences.sentence: ただの風邪ですから、心配する{1:ことはない}よ。
sentences.translation: It's just a basic cold, so there is no need to worry.

sentences.sentence: そんなにびっくりする{1:ことはない}でしょう。
sentences.translation: This shouldn't come as a surprise to you.

sentences.sentence: この本を最後まで読めば、失望する{1:ことはない}だろう。
sentences.translation: You won't be let down if you read this book all the way until the end.

sentences.sentence: 謝る{1:ことはない}よ。君が悪いわけじゃないんだもの。
sentences.translation: There's no need to apologize. You didn't do anything wrong.

sentences.sentence: 弟は、母{1:にかわって}ご飯を作った。
sentences.translation: My little brother made dinner instead of my mom.

sentences.sentence: 部長{1:にかわり}、私は会議に参加しました。
sentences.translation: I participated in the meeting instead of my manager.

sentences.sentence: DVD{1:にかわり}、ブルーレイが使われるようになった。
sentences.translation: Bluray is starting to be used now instead of DVDs.

sentences.sentence: 父{1:にかわって}一言お礼を申し上げます。
sentences.translation: I will say a word of thanks in place of my father.

sentences.sentence: 来週の出張は大阪{1:にかわって}、京都に行くことになりました。
sentences.translation: Next week's business trip was changed from Osaka to Kyoto.

sentences.sentence: 出張中の部長{1:にかわって}、私がごあいさつさせていただきます。
sentences.translation: Please accept my greetings in place of my boss who is currently away on a business trip.

sentences.sentence: ただいま山田が外出しておりますので、山田{1:にかわりまして}、私が対応させていただきます。
sentences.translation: Mr. Yamada is currently out of the office, so please allow me to deal with it instead.

sentences.sentence: 兄{1:にかわり}、私は家庭の経営を受け入れました。
sentences.translation: I inherited the family business instead of my brother.

sentences.sentence: 私が部長{1:の代わりに}出張に行きます。
sentences.translation: I will go on a business trip on behalf of my manager.

sentences.sentence: 今朝はコーヒー{1:の代わりに}お茶を飲んだ。
sentences.translation: This morning, I drank tea instead of coffee.

sentences.sentence: 昨日残業した{1:代わりに}、今日は少し早く帰っていいと言われた。
sentences.translation: In exchange for working overtime yesterday, I was told I could leave a little earlier today.

sentences.sentence: 今日は仕事へ車で行く{1:代わりに}自転車で行った。
sentences.translation: Today, instead of going to work by car, I went by bicycle.

sentences.sentence: お箸がないので、{1:その代わりに}フォークを使う。
sentences.translation: Since I do not have any chopsticks, I will use a fork instead

sentences.sentence: 車で来たので、ビール{1:の代わりに}コーラをください。
sentences.translation: Since I came by car, I will have a cola instead of beer.

sentences.sentence: 仕事は毎日とても忙しい{1:代わりに}、給料がいい。
sentences.translation: My work is very busy every day, but in return the pay is good.

sentences.sentence: 最近は、メール{1:の代わりに}LINEで連絡をとる人が増えている。
sentences.translation: Lately, the number of people using LINE instead of email for contacting others is increasing.

sentences.sentence: どれ{1:くらい}日本に住んでいますか？
sentences.translation: How long have you been living in Japan?

sentences.sentence: どの{1:ぐらい}練習したんですか？
sentences.translation: About how long did you practice?

sentences.sentence: 試験が難しくて、{1:泣きたいくらい}だ。
sentences.translation: The test was so difficult, I felt like I wanted to cry.

sentences.sentence: お客様はどの{1:ぐらい}いますか？
sentences.translation: About how many customers are there?

sentences.sentence: 家から駅まで自転車で20分{1:ぐらい}かかります。
sentences.translation: It takes about 20 minutes from my house to the station by bicycle.

sentences.sentence: 日本語どれ{1:ぐらい}話せますか？
sentences.translation: How much Japanese can you speak?

sentences.sentence: どの{1:くらい}海外にいましたか？
sentences.translation: About how long were you abroad?

sentences.sentence: 今日{1:くらい}は家族と過ごそう。
sentences.translation: Let's at least spend today together as a family.

sentences.sentence: 試験も近いし、テレビ{1:など}見ている暇はない。
sentences.translation: Exams are close and I don't have time to do things like watch TV.

sentences.sentence: 中国語やスペイン語{1:など}、仕事で役に立ちそうな外国語を勉強したいです。
sentences.translation: I want to study foreign languages that would be useful for work, like Chinese or Spanish.

sentences.sentence: 彼は私{1:なんか}よりすごい人だよ。
sentences.translation: He is a much better man than I am.

sentences.sentence: 彼は私{1:など}には目もくれようとしないだろう。
sentences.translation: He would never bother to notice (someone like) me.

sentences.sentence: カラオケ{1:なんか}行きたくない
sentences.translation: I don't really want to go to karaoke..

sentences.sentence: 納豆{1:なんて}嫌いだ。
sentences.translation: I really hate natto (Japanese fermented soybean)

sentences.sentence: お前の話{1:なんか}誰が信じるもんか。
sentences.translation: Who's going to believe you're story?

sentences.sentence: 幽霊{1:なんか}いるもんか。
sentences.translation: How could anyone believe in ghosts!

sentences.sentence: 彼女{1:のおかげで}、私は毎日幸せだ。
sentences.translation: Thanks to her, I am happy everyday.

sentences.sentence: 日本へ来た{1:おかげで}、日本語が上手になりました。
sentences.translation: I improved my Japanese because I came to Japan.

sentences.sentence: 先生{1:のおかげで}JLPT N3に合格できました。
sentences.translation: Thanks to my teacher, I passed the JLPT N3.

sentences.sentence: 薬を飲んだ{1:おかげで}、すっかり元気になりました。
sentences.translation: I healed up thanks to taking my medicine.

sentences.sentence: 日本語を習った{1:おかげで}、いい仕事を見つけることができました。
sentences.translation: I was able to find a good job because I learned Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 友達{1:のおかげで}、私は今の彼女と出会うことができました。
sentences.translation: Thanks to my friend, I was able to meet my current girlfriend.

sentences.sentence: とてもいい医者にみてもらった{1:おかげで}病気が治りました。
sentences.translation: Thanks to being looked at by a very good doctor, my illness was healed.

sentences.sentence: 今日、皆さん{1:のおかげで}私の夢を実現しました。
sentences.translation: Today, thanks to you all my dream became a reality.

sentences.sentence: さっきコーヒーを飲んだ{1:せいで}、なかなか寝られません。
sentences.translation: Because I drank coffee a little while ago, I can't seem to fall asleep.

sentences.sentence: 頭が痛い。疲れた{1:せい}かな。
sentences.translation: My head hurts. Maybe it's because I am tired..

sentences.sentence: バスが遅れた{1:せいで}、授業に遅れてしまった。
sentences.translation: I was late for class because my bus was late.

sentences.sentence: あなたの失敗を、私{1:のせいに}しないでよ！
sentences.translation: Don't blame me for your mistake!

sentences.sentence: 体調が悪かった{1:せいで}、試験に集中できなかった。
sentences.translation: As a result of not feeling well, I wasn't able to concentrate on the exam.

sentences.sentence: バスが遅れた{1:せいで}、飛行機に乗れなかった。
sentences.translation: I missed my flight because the bus was late.

sentences.sentence: 食べすぎた{1:せいで}、ちょっと太ってしまった。
sentences.translation: I've gained a bit of weight from eating too much.

sentences.sentence: ちゃんと勉強しなかった{1:せいで}、テストは合格できなかった。
sentences.translation: As a result of not studying properly, I wasn't able to pass the test.

sentences.sentence: この犬はバディー{1:という}名前です。
sentences.translation: This dog is called "Buddy".

sentences.sentence: 昨日、トム{1:という}人に会いました。
sentences.translation: Yesterday, I met a person called Tom.

sentences.sentence: 明日{1:という}日もある。
sentences.translation: There's always tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: あなたにとって日本{1:という}国はどういう国ですか？
sentences.translation: What kind of country is Japan to you?

sentences.sentence: 英語で「宿題」は、なん{1:といいます}か？
sentences.translation: How do you say "shukudai" (homework) in English?

sentences.sentence: 猫みたいだ{1:という}人もいる。
sentences.translation: Some people think he is like a cat.

sentences.sentence: 彼はかっこいい{1:という}よりかわいい。
sentences.translation: He is more cute than cool.

sentences.sentence: 彼が外国に行く{1:という}話がある。
sentences.translation: There's talk of his going abroad.

sentences.sentence: あなたに会いたい{1:という}人がいます。
sentences.translation: There's somebody who wants to meet you.

sentences.sentence: 赤などの色物と白いシャツは一緒に洗わないほうがいいだ{1:という}。
sentences.translation: It is said that it is best not to wash colored materials (like red) together with white shirts.

sentences.sentence: 赤は、生命の色で、愛や勇気を表す色だ{1:という}。
sentences.translation: Because red is the color of life, it is said to expresses love and courage.

sentences.sentence: 彼は年の{1:わりに}元気だ。
sentences.translation: He is in good shape for his age.

sentences.sentence: このカメラは高い{1:わりに}、よく売れる。
sentences.translation: This camera sells unexpectedly well considering the high price.

sentences.sentence: このコンピューター、中古{1:のわりに}高くない？
sentences.translation: Isn't this computer expensive for being used?

sentences.sentence: 今日は休日{1:のわりに}人が少ないね。
sentences.translation: There are unusually few people today considering it's a holiday.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は年{1:の割には}若く見える。
sentences.translation: She looks young for her age.

sentences.sentence: この寿司は高い{1:割に}まずい。
sentences.translation: This sushi is bad for the price.

sentences.sentence: お金がないと言っている{1:割に}、よく旅行するね。
sentences.translation: Although you say you don't have any money, you seem to travel a lot.

sentences.sentence: テストの勉強をしなかった{1:割には}、よく出来た。
sentences.translation: Considering you did not study for the test, you did well.

sentences.sentence: 彼は聞こえない{1:ふりをした}。
sentences.translation: He pretended to not hear.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は宿題をし終わった{1:ふりをして}テレビを見ている。
sentences.translation: She pretended that she finished her homework and is watching TV.

sentences.sentence: 分かった{1:ふりをしていた}が、実はよく分からない。もう一度言ってください。
sentences.translation: I gave the impression that I understood, but I really didn't. Could you please say it once again?

sentences.sentence: 彼はいつも人の話を全く聞かないのに、分かっている{1:ふりをしている}。
sentences.translation: Even though he never listens to anyone's stories, he always acts as if he understands.

sentences.sentence: 知らない{1:ふりをしている}けど本当は知っているでしょう？
sentences.translation: You're just pretending to not know, but really you do. Right?

sentences.sentence: 彼は政治について知っている{1:ふりをしている}が、本当は知らないだと思う。
sentences.translation: He acts like he knows about politics, but I don't think that he really does.

sentences.sentence: 山田さんは独身の{1:ふりをしている}が、結婚していて２人も子供がいる。
sentences.translation: Mr. Yamada acts like he is single, but he actually is married and has 2 children.

sentences.sentence: 彼女が一生懸命作ってくれた料理なので、まずいとは言えず、美味しそうな{1:ふりをした}。
sentences.translation: Not being able to say the food she worked so hard to make for me was bad, I pretended that it tasted good.

sentences.sentence: あなたが日本へ来る{1:際には}連絡ください。
sentences.translation: Please contact me if you come to Japan.

sentences.sentence: お帰りの{1:際には}忘れ物のないようご注意ください。
sentences.translation: Please don’t leave anything behind when you go home.

sentences.sentence: お困り{1:の際は}、いつでもご連絡ください。
sentences.translation: Please contact me whenever you are in trouble.

sentences.sentence: 入院の{1:際は}、いろいろお世話になりました。
sentences.translation: Thank you so much for everything when I was in the hospital.

sentences.sentence: 入会を申し込む{1:際}、何が必要でしょうか。
sentences.translation: What is necessary at the time of application?

sentences.sentence: 免許を更新する{1:際}、写真が必要です。
sentences.translation: When you renew your license, a picture is necessary.

sentences.sentence: 留学{1:の際には}、いろいろお世話になりました。
sentences.translation: Thank you for all of your help during my study abroad.

sentences.sentence: お帰り{1:の際には}傘をお持ちになるのを忘れないでください。
sentences.translation: Don't forget to take your umbrella with you when you leave.

sentences.sentence: 勉強の{1:際には}、静かな場所が勉強の効率を上げるのに最適である。
sentences.translation: When studying, a quiet place is optimal to increase learning efficiency.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:にとって}、漢字の勉強はとても楽しい。
sentences.translation: For me, studying kanji is a lot of fun!

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:にとって}、一番大切な物は何ですか？
sentences.translation: What is the most important thing for you?

sentences.sentence: 家族は私{1:にとって}、一番大切な物です。
sentences.translation: For me, the most important thing is family.

sentences.sentence: 水は人間の体{1:にとって}必要なものだ。
sentences.translation: Water is essential for the human body.

sentences.sentence: スポーツ選手{1:にとって}、健康管理はとても重要です。
sentences.translation: For athletes, health management is extremely important.

sentences.sentence: 転校は、子ども{1:にとって}大きな変化だ。
sentences.translation: Changing schools is a big change for a child.

sentences.sentence: 学生{1:にとって}、良い教育環境が必要です。
sentences.translation: A good academic environment is essential for students.

sentences.sentence: タバコの煙や匂いは、吸わない人{1:にとって}は苦痛だ。
sentences.translation: For people who do not smoke, tobacco's smoke and smell can be very painful.

sentences.sentence: 背が高い{1:くせに}早く走れない。
sentences.translation: Despite being tall, he/she cannot run fast.

sentences.sentence: 元気{1:なくせに}、病気のふりをしている。
sentences.translation: Although he is healthy, he is pretending to be sick.

sentences.sentence: 医者でもない{1:くせに}。
sentences.translation: You aren't even a doctor (so don’t act like you are one).

sentences.sentence: 彼女はお金持ち{1:のくせに}ケチだ。
sentences.translation: Although she is rich, she is very frugal with her money.

sentences.sentence: 田中さんはお母さんが日本人{1:のくせに}、日本語が全然分からない。
sentences.translation: Although Tanaka's mother is Japanese, he doesn't understand any Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 彼は男{1:のくせに}犬が怖いだ。
sentences.translation: Even though he is a man, he is scared of dogs..

sentences.sentence: 彼女は医者{1:のくせに}タバコを吸っている。
sentences.translation: Even though she is a doctor, she smokes cigarettes.

sentences.sentence: 子ども{1:のくせに}、生意気なことを言うな
sentences.translation: You're just a kid, don't get too cocky.

sentences.sentence: 彼は新人{1:のくせに}、態度が悪い。
sentences.translation: Although he's new, he has a pretty bad attitude.

sentences.sentence: 人は誰でも間違いをする{1:ものだ}。
sentences.translation: Everybody makes mistakes.

sentences.sentence: 人は見かけでは分からない{1:ものだ}。
sentences.translation: People cannot be understood by just their outward appearance.

sentences.sentence: 人は誰でも失敗する{1:ものです}。
sentences.translation: Everybody experiences failure.

sentences.sentence: たくさん運動したら疲れる{1:ものです}。
sentences.translation: Working out a lot will naturally make one tired.

sentences.sentence: 子供は早く寝る{1:もんだ}よ。
sentences.translation: Children must go to bed early.

sentences.sentence: 人の悪口は言う{1:ものじゃない}。
sentences.translation: One should not say bad things of others.

sentences.sentence: お年寄りには優しくする{1:ものだ}。
sentences.translation: One should be kind to their elders.

sentences.sentence: 知らない人を簡単に信じる{1:もんじゃない}よ。
sentences.translation: You shouldn't easily trust people you don't know.

sentences.sentence: この町は昔{1:のまま}変わっていない。
sentences.translation: This town hasn't changed at all.

sentences.sentence: この野菜は、生{1:のまま}で食べてもおいしいですよ。
sentences.translation: These vegetables taste good even raw.

sentences.sentence: どうぞ靴{1:のまま}、お入りください。
sentences.translation: Please enter with your shoes on.

sentences.sentence: その格好{1:のまま}でこのレストランに入れないよ。
sentences.translation: You can't enter this restaurant with those clothes..

sentences.sentence: 昨夜は、勉強し{1:たまま}寝てしまった。
sentences.translation: Last night, I fell asleep while studying.

sentences.sentence: 鍵をかけ{1:ないまま}出かけてしまった。
sentences.translation: I accidentally left without locking the door.

sentences.sentence: 私は勉強し{1:ないまま}そのテストを受けた。
sentences.translation: I took that test without studying.

sentences.sentence: 仕事は中途半端{1:なまま}にしてはいけない。
sentences.translation: You can't leave your work unfinished..

sentences.sentence: 日本語を教え{1:てほしい}です。
sentences.translation: I want you to teach me Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 先生{1:に}は、もっとゆっくり話し{1:てほしい}です。
sentences.translation: I wish the teacher would speak more slowly

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:に}見{1:てほしい}写真を持っています。
sentences.translation: I have a picture I want you to see.

sentences.sentence: ぜひ私と一緒に来{1:てほしい}。
sentences.translation: I'd love for you to come with me.

sentences.sentence: 私{1:に}何をし{1:てほしい}のですか?
sentences.translation: What do you want me to do?

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:に}家に来{1:てほしくない}。
sentences.translation: I don't want you to come to my house.

sentences.sentence: あなた{1:に}幸せになっ{1:てほしい}のです。
sentences.translation: I want you to be happy.

sentences.sentence: それを忘れ{1:ないで欲しい}。
sentences.translation: I don't want you to forget that.

sentences.sentence: すみません、昨日のノートを見せ{1:て欲しい}んですが・・・
sentences.translation: Excuse me, could you please show me yesterday's notes?

sentences.sentence: 冬が早く来{1:て欲しい}です。
sentences.translation: I want winter to come sooner!

sentences.sentence: 私はそれについてもっと知る{1:べきだ}。
sentences.translation: I should know more about that.

sentences.sentence: 約束は守る{1:べきだ}。
sentences.translation: You should keep your promises.

sentences.sentence: 早く帰宅す{1:べきだ}。
sentences.translation: You should go home early.

sentences.sentence: 真実を言う{1:べきだ}。
sentences.translation: You should tell the truth.

sentences.sentence: おもちゃは、先ず安全{1:であるべきです}。
sentences.translation: Safety comes first for toys.

sentences.sentence: 最初に私に電話する{1:べきだった}。
sentences.translation: You really should have called me first.

sentences.sentence: 何を{1:すべき}か、もう彼女の心は決まっていた。
sentences.translation: She had already decided in her heart what she should do.

sentences.sentence: 小学生の先生は、子どもが好き{1:であるべきだ}と思います。
sentences.translation: I believe that elementary school teachers should love children.

sentences.sentence: 食事{1:の最中に}大きな地震が起こった。
sentences.translation: During dinner there was a big earthquake.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私はテニス{1:の最中に}自分で怪我をしてしまった。
sentences.translation: I hurt myself while I was playing tennis.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 私はパリを旅行し{1:ている最中に}彼女に会いました。
sentences.translation: I met her while I was traveling in Paris.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 会議をし{1:ている最中に}、携帯電話が鳴った。
sentences.translation: My cell phone started to ring in the middle of the meeting.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼女は嵐{1:の真っ最中に}家を出た。
sentences.translation: She went out of the house right in the middle of a storm.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: みんなが大笑い{1:の最中}彼が会議室に戻ってきた。
sentences.translation: He returned to the meeting room just as everyone burst out laughing.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 彼の声が出なくなってしまったのはテレビ番組で歌っ{1:ている最中}でした。
sentences.translation: The time he unfortunately lost his voice was when he was singing on a television show.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 試合{1:の最中に}雨が降って、結局中止となった。
sentences.translation: It started raining during the middle of the match and it ended up getting cancelled.
sentences.attrurl: https://jlptsensei.com/learn-japanese-grammar/真っ最中に-まっさいちゅうに-saichuu-ni-meaning/

sentences.sentence: 怖{1:がらないで}ください。
sentences.translation: Please don't feel scared.

sentences.sentence: 彼は死ぬのを怖{1:がっている}。
sentences.translation: He is afraid of death.

sentences.sentence: 彼は彼女が欲し{1:がる}バッグを買ってあげた。
sentences.translation: He bought her the bag she wanted.

sentences.sentence: 彼は負けて残念{1:がっている}。
sentences.translation: He appears to be disappointed at his defeat.

sentences.sentence: 恥ずかし{1:がらないで}、前に出てきてください。
sentences.translation: Please don't feel shy and come up to the front.

sentences.sentence: 彼女はその少年をまるで実の子のようにかわい{1:がっている}。
sentences.translation: She loves the boy as if he were her own child.

sentences.sentence: あんな所に駐車したら近所の人に迷惑{1:がる}よ。
sentences.translation: The neighbors will get annoyed if you park in such a place!

sentences.sentence: このバンドが解散したらファンが悲し{1:がる}だろう。
sentences.translation: If this band breaks up, their fans will be very sad.

sentences.sentence: このドアはいつも開け{1:っぱなし}だ。
sentences.translation: This door is always left open.

sentences.sentence: 水を出し{1:っぱなし}にしないでください。
sentences.translation: Please do not leave the water running.

sentences.sentence: 窓を開け{1:っぱなし}で出てきた。
sentences.translation: I left the windows open when I went out.

sentences.sentence: 私は4時間立ち{1:っぱなし}でした。
sentences.translation: I stood for four hours straight.

sentences.sentence: また使い{1:っぱなし}じゃない！使い終わったら片付けなさいって、いつも言ってるでしょう。
sentences.translation: This is still left out again? I've told you countless times to clean this up after you are finished using it!

sentences.sentence: アルバイトが忙しくて休む時間がない。ずっと立ち{1:っぱなし}でやっている。
sentences.translation: My part-time job is busy with no time to rest. I'm standing the entire time.

sentences.sentence: あの映画は3時間近くもあったから、ずっと座り{1:っぱなし}でお尻が痛くなった。
sentences.translation: That movie was close to 3 hours long and my butt hurts from sitting the entire time.

sentences.sentence: 夜、ドアを開け{1:っぱなし}で寝ていたら、泥棒に入られてしまった。
sentences.translation: Last night I left my door open and a robber came in while I slept.

sentences.sentence: 彼は言われた{1:とおりに}した。
sentences.translation: He did as he was told.

sentences.sentence: 彼は時間{1:どおりに}やって来た。
sentences.translation: He arrived on time.

sentences.sentence: すべてはスケジュール{1:どおりに}進んでいる。
sentences.translation: Everything is going according to schedule.

sentences.sentence: じゃあ、先生が書く{1:とおりに}、一緒に漢字を書いてください。
sentences.translation: Let's get started, please write the kanji character together as the teacher draws it.

sentences.sentence: 先生が言った{1:とおり}、試験が難しかった。
sentences.translation: The exam was difficult, just as the teacher said it would be.

sentences.sentence: 天気が晴れってきた。予報{1:どおり}だ。
sentences.translation: The weather started to clear up. The weather forecast was right.

sentences.sentence: 何もかも、私の願った{1:とおりに}なりました。
sentences.translation: Everything turned out as I had hoped.

sentences.sentence: 店員さんがかいてくれた地図の{1:とおり}に来たが、道に迷った。
sentences.translation: I followed the map that the employee drew for me, but ended up getting lost.

sentences.sentence: 山田さんの言った{1:とおりに}、昨日の夜、街ではお祭りがありました。
sentences.translation: Just as Mr. Yamada said, last night there was a festival in town.

sentences.sentence: 買い物{1:のついでに}、本屋に寄りました。
sentences.translation: I stopped by a book store while shopping.

sentences.sentence: コンビニに行くなら、{1:ついでに}お茶も買ってきてくれない？
sentences.translation: If you're already going to the convenience store, could you please also buy me some tea?

sentences.sentence: 仕事へ行く{1:ついでに}駅まで送ってあげるよ。
sentences.translation: I'll give you a lift to the station on my way to work.

sentences.sentence: 出かけるの？それなら{1:ついでに}ゴミを出してくれる？
sentences.translation: Are you heading out? If so, could you please also take out the garbage when you go?

sentences.sentence: 引っ越し{1:のついでに}、新しい家具を買いたいです。
sentences.translation: While I am moving, I want to buy some new furniture.

sentences.sentence: 散歩{1:のついでに}、この手紙を出してくれませんか。
sentences.translation: Since you are going for a walk, could you please mail this letter for me?

sentences.sentence: 自分のご飯を作る{1:ついでに}、友達のご飯も作った。
sentences.translation: While I made my own meal, I also made some for my friend.

sentences.sentence: 郵便局へ行った{1:ついでに}、葉書を買った。
sentences.translation: Since I went to the post office, I bought a postcard.

sentences.sentence: 家を出{1:たとたん}、雨が降ってきた。
sentences.translation: It started raining after I left my house.

sentences.sentence: 窓を開け{1:たとたん}、強い風が入ってきた。
sentences.translation: As soon as I opened the window, a strong wind came in.

sentences.sentence: 旅行から帰ってき{1:たとたん}、風邪を引いてしまった。
sentences.translation: I caught a cold just after I got back from travelling.

sentences.sentence: 疲れていたので、ベッドに入っ{1:たとたん}、眠ってしまった。
sentences.translation: I was really tired and fell asleep right after getting in bed.

sentences.sentence: 夏は窓を開け{1:たとたん}、蚊が入ってくる。
sentences.translation: In summer, after opening the window mosquitoes will come inside.

sentences.sentence: その二人は、出会っ{1:たとたん}に、恋に落ちたそうです。
sentences.translation: Those two apparently fell in love after meeting each other.

sentences.sentence: あの子は私の顔を見{1:たとたん}、泣き出した。どうしたのだろう。
sentences.translation: That child started crying after seeing my face. I wonder what's wrong..

sentences.sentence: ビール一本を飲ん{1:だとたん}、顔が赤くなった。
sentences.translation: My face turned red after drinking only 1 beer.

sentences.sentence: 激辛カレーを食べ{1:たとたん}、汗が出てきた。
sentences.translation: I started sweating after eating the super spicy curry.

sentences.sentence: 掃除機のスイッチを入れ{1:たとたん}、家の電気がすべて消えてしまった。ブレーカーが落ちたのだ。
sentences.translation: When I turned on the switch for the vacuum cleaner, the power for the entire house suddenly went out. The circuit breaker tripped.

sentences.sentence: 言った{1:つもりだった}。
sentences.translation: I thought I said it.

sentences.sentence: 私はそのメールを送った{1:つもりだった}。
sentences.translation: I'm sure I sent that email.

sentences.sentence: コーヒーを注文した{1:つもりだった}。
sentences.translation: I'm sure I ordered a coffee..

sentences.sentence: それは予約した{1:つもりだった}。
sentences.translation: I thought I had made the reservation.

sentences.sentence: 名前を書いた{1:つもりだった}が、書いていなかったようだ。
sentences.translation: I thought I wrote my name down, but apparently I did not.

sentences.sentence: 返事をした{1:つもりだった}が、送れていなかった。
sentences.translation: I thought I had responded, but I had not sent it.

sentences.sentence: あれ、カバンの中に入れた{1:つもりなのに}、弁当がない。
sentences.translation: Oh no.. I thought I put my lunch box in my bag, but it's not in there..

sentences.sentence: 僕は冗談に言った{1:つもりなのに}彼は真面目にとった。
sentences.translation: I said it to him as a joke, but he took it seriously.

sentences.sentence: あなたなら分かる{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: You should know this.

sentences.sentence: 彼は今学校にいる{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: He should be in school right now.

sentences.sentence: お父さんがそろそろ家に帰る{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: Father should be returning home anytime now.

sentences.sentence: 今日は祝日だから、銀行は休み{1:のはずだ}。
sentences.translation: Today is a national holiday, so surely the banks are closed.

sentences.sentence: それは明らか{1:なはずだ}。
sentences.translation: That should be obvious.

sentences.sentence: あなたは法律を知っている{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: You should know the law.

sentences.sentence: 田中さんは今、旅行中だから、家にいない{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: Tanaka-san can't be home right now since he is currently travelling.

sentences.sentence: 彼らはそのテーマについて話し合っている{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: They should be discussing that theme.

sentences.sentence: 彼は英語を専門にやったのだからできる{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: He ought to be a good scholar, for he has made a specialty of English.

sentences.sentence: 私の知る限りでは彼は遅れたことはない{1:はずだ}。
sentences.translation: He has never been late to the best of my knowledge.

sentences.sentence: この曲を聞く{1:たびに}、家族を思い出す。
sentences.translation: Every time I hear this song, it reminds me of my family.

sentences.sentence: 友人は旅行の{1:たびに}お土産を買ってきてくれます。
sentences.translation: Every time my friend travels, they buy me a souvenir.

sentences.sentence: あの人を会う{1:たびに}用事を頼まれる。
sentences.translation: That person asks me for favors every time I see them.

sentences.sentence: ミスをする{1:たびに}部長にしかられる。
sentences.translation: Every time I make a mistake my boss chews me out.

sentences.sentence: 買い物の{1:たびに}、袋をたくさんもらう。
sentences.translation: I always get a lot of bags every time I go shopping.

sentences.sentence: YouTubeを見る{1:たびに}、広告が表示されるのはうんざりだ。
sentences.translation: I'm sick of adds popping up every time I watch videos on YouTube.

sentences.sentence: 彼はコンビニに行く{1:たびに}アイスを買ってしまう。
sentences.translation: He buys ice cream every time he goes to the convenience store..

sentences.sentence: 彼女は会う{1:たびに}、綺麗になっていく。
sentences.translation: She gets more beautiful every time I see her.

sentences.sentence: 私は一人{1:きり}で暮らすのが嫌だ。
sentences.translation: I don't want to live all alone.

sentences.sentence: 二人{1:っきり}で話をしたいです。
sentences.translation: I want to talk privately with you, just the two of us.

sentences.sentence: 彼女に会ったのは１回{1:きり}です。
sentences.translation: I've only met her one time.

sentences.sentence: 今日は寒いから、Ｔシャツ一枚{1:きり}で外に出たら寒いよ。
sentences.translation: It's cold out today, so if you go out with just one t-shirt you're gonna be cold.

sentences.sentence: 彼女とは別れた{1:きり}、一度も会っていない。
sentences.translation: I haven't met with her at all since we broke up.

sentences.sentence: その男の人は、森に入った{1:きり}、帰ってきませんでした。
sentences.translation: That man hasn't come back since he entered the woods.

sentences.sentence: 大学時代のクラスメイトとは卒業した{1:きり}会っていない。
sentences.translation: I haven't met my university classmates at all since we graduated.

sentences.sentence: 日本語は5年前に話した{1:きり}、全然使っていないから忘れちゃった。
sentences.translation: I haven't spoke Japanese at all since 5 years ago and so I forgot it.

sentences.sentence: 風は{1:次第に}おさまった。
sentences.translation: The wind gradually died down.

sentences.sentence: それは{1:次第に}消えた。
sentences.translation: That gradually disappeared.

sentences.sentence: 彼らは{1:次第に}仲良くなっていった。
sentences.translation: They gradually became closer.

sentences.sentence: 今朝は雨でしたが、午後から{1:次第に}天気は回復してきました。
sentences.translation: It rained this mornin, but the weather gradually got better from the afternoon.

sentences.sentence: 練習を続ければ、{1:次第に}結果が出るようになりますよ。
sentences.translation: If you keep practicing, you will gradually be able to get results.

sentences.sentence: 戦争によってその国は資源を{1:次第に}失った。
sentences.translation: The war gradually drained the country of its resources.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は{1:次第に}この田舎の生活に慣れてきている。
sentences.translation: She is gradually getting used to this countryside life.

sentences.sentence: {1:手当たり次第に}本を読んだ。
sentences.translation: I read whatever I could get my hands on.

sentences.sentence: {1:そして}行ってしまった。
sentences.translation: And then (he) was gone.

sentences.sentence: {1:そして}私はあなたに出会った。
sentences.translation: And then I met you.

sentences.sentence: {1:そして}、私は朝ごはんを食べました。
sentences.translation: And then, I ate breakfast.

sentences.sentence: ご飯を買った。{1:そして}、家に帰った。
sentences.translation: I bought dinner and then went home.

sentences.sentence: 母は料理をする。{1:そして}、父は皿を洗う。
sentences.translation: My mother cooks and my father washes the dishes.

sentences.sentence: 昨日は朝7時に起きました。{1:そして}、夜10時半に寝ました。
sentences.translation: Yesterday I woke up at 7 o'clock. And then went to bed at 10:30 pm.

sentences.sentence: 私は走りました。{1:そして}、のどが渇いたので水を飲みました。
sentences.translation: I ran. And then was thirsty so I drank some water.

sentences.sentence: 私は朝5時に起きました。{1:そして}、散歩に出かけました。
sentences.translation: I woke up at 5 o'clock. And then I went out for a walk.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は{1:少なくとも}３０歳だ。
sentences.translation: She is not less than thirty.

sentences.sentence: 彼は{1:少なくとも}1日に10時間働いた。
sentences.translation: He worked for at least 10 hours a day.

sentences.sentence: 人数が足りませんね。{1:少なくとも}あと3人は必要です。
sentences.translation: We are short on people. We need at least 3 more people.

sentences.sentence: あなたは{1:少なくとも}10時には寝るべきだ。
sentences.translation: You should go to bed at 10 o'clock at the very least.

sentences.sentence: {1:少なくとも}週に１度は自分の部屋を掃除しなさい。
sentences.translation: Clean your room at least once a week.

sentences.sentence: その肉は{1:少なくとも}１時間は火にかける必要がある。
sentences.translation: The meat needs to cook for at least an hour.

sentences.sentence: 今一人暮らしをしていますが、毎月の生活費のうち、{1:少なくとも}5万円は食費で消えますね。外食が多いですから。
sentences.translation: Now I am living alone, but every month at least 50,000 yen of food expenses is added to my living expenses. This is because I often eat out.

sentences.sentence: 海外旅行に行くなら、現地の言葉のうち、{1:少なくとも}挨拶の表現ぐらいは覚えておいた方がいい。
sentences.translation: If you're going to travel abroad, you should at least memorize some greeting expressions of the local language.

sentences.sentence: {1:それから}、私は昼ごはんを食べました。
sentences.translation: And then, I ate lunch.

sentences.sentence: あなたは{1:それから}どうするのですか。
sentences.translation: What will you do after that?

sentences.sentence: あなたは、{1:それから}どこにいましたか？
sentences.translation: Where were you after that?

sentences.sentence: {1:それから}、私たちはアイスを食べました。
sentences.translation: And then, we ate ice cream.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は優しい。{1:それから}きれいだ。
sentences.translation: She is kind and beautiful.

sentences.sentence: 1年前に日本に来ました。{1:それから}、日本語を勉強しています。
sentences.translation: I came to Japan 1 year ago. Since then, I have been studying Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 朝ご飯はご飯、みそ汁、{1:それから}、魚ですよ。
sentences.translation: Breakfast is rice, miso soup, and fish.

sentences.sentence: あッ{1:とばかりに}驚いた。
sentences.translation: I had my breath taken away.

sentences.sentence: 彼は出て行け{1:とばかりに}、ドアを開けた。
sentences.translation: He opened the door as if to tell me to get out.

sentences.sentence: カッコいいだろう{1:とばかりに}新車を自慢してくる。
sentences.translation: He keeps bragging about his new car as if wanting me to tell him it's cool.

sentences.sentence: 早く来い{1:とばかりに}こちらに向かって大きく手を振っている。
sentences.translation: They are waving their hand in large gestures towards me as if telling me to hurry up and come over.

sentences.sentence: 彼女が新しいドレスを見てよ{1:とばかりに}、アピールしてくる。
sentences.translation: She keeps acting as if she wants people to look at her new dress.

sentences.sentence: その話はやめなさい{1:とばかりに}、彼女は私を睨んできた。
sentences.translation: She glared at me as if telling me to stop talking about that story.

sentences.sentence: 彼に彼女がいないことを知り、ここぞ{1:とばかりに}告白した。
sentences.translation: Knowing that he didn't have a girlfriend, she felt that this was the right moment and confessed her feelings to him.

sentences.sentence: 彼はお話にもならない{1:とばかりに}、肩をすくめてみせた。
sentences.translation: He shrugged his shoulders as if to say that's out of the question.

sentences.sentence: これ、お土産だよ。{1:ちなみに}ベトナムで買ったんだよ。
sentences.translation: Here is a souvenir. I bought it in Vietnam by the way.

sentences.sentence: {1:ちなみに}、私のことを覚えていますか？
sentences.translation: By the way, do you remember me?

sentences.sentence: {1:ちなみに}、私は刺身と寿司は好きではない。
sentences.translation: Incidentally, I do not like sashimi or sushi.

sentences.sentence: N2に合格したよ！{1:ちなみに}満点だったよ！
sentences.translation: I passed the N2! And by the way, I got a full score!

sentences.sentence: {1:ちなみに}、私の日本語が間違ってたら遠慮なく言ってください。
sentences.translation: By the way, please feel free to tell me if my Japanese is wrong.

sentences.sentence: {1:ちなみに}今日は2月23日、妻の誕生日です。
sentences.translation: By the way, today is February 23rd, my wife's birthday.

sentences.sentence: 来月、台湾旅行に行きます。{1:ちなみに}台湾へは、これまでに20回も行ったんですよ。
sentences.translation: Next month, I will be going to travel to Taiwan. By the way, I've gone to Taiwan over 20 times now.

sentences.sentence: 「この大学には、学部生が1,000名、大学院生が100名います。」「{1:ちなみに}、そのうち女性は何割ぐらいですか。」
sentences.translation: "This university has 1,000 undergraduate students and 100 graudate students.""By the way, among them around what percent are female?"

sentences.sentence: {1:せっかく}勉強した{1:のに}合格できなかった。
sentences.translation: Even though I went through the effort of studying, I couldn't pass (the test).

sentences.sentence: {1:せっかく}レポートを書いた{1:のに}提出しなくてもよくなった。
sentences.translation: Even though I went through the effort of writing my report, I ended up not having to turn it in.

sentences.sentence: {1:せっかく}母がお弁当を作ってくれた{1:のに}家に忘れてしまった。
sentences.translation: Although my mother went through the effort of making my lunch box for me, I forgot it at home.

sentences.sentence: {1:せっかく}のお志{1:ですが}お断り致します。
sentences.translation: I am sorry, but I must decline your kind offer.

sentences.sentence: {1:せっかく}来たのだから楽しまなきゃ。
sentences.translation: Since I've come all the way here I may as well enjoy myself.

sentences.sentence: {1:せっかく}日本にいるのですから、色んな所に旅行に行ってみたいです。
sentences.translation: Since I am in Japan, I want to take advantage and travel to many places.

sentences.sentence: あんまり店員の態度が悪いから、よっぽど食べずに帰ろうと思ったが、{1:せっかく}注文したから食べることにした。
sentences.translation: I really thought about leaving without eating because the staff's attitude was so bad, but I had already ordered so I decided to stay and eat.

sentences.sentence: 彼女が{1:せっかく}作ってくれたから、甘いものが嫌いなんて、とても言えない。
sentences.translation: Since she went through the trouble of making it for me, I couldn't possibly tell her I don't like sweets.

sentences.sentence: お茶を{1:一気に}飲みました。
sentences.translation: I drank all of the tea at once.

sentences.sentence: 私はこの本を{1:一気に}読みました。
sentences.translation: I read this book all in one go.

sentences.sentence: 彼は{1:一気に}１０時間働いた。
sentences.translation: He worked for 10 hours without stopping.

sentences.sentence: こういう仕事は{1:一気に}やった方がいいんだよ。
sentences.translation: This kind of work is best done all at once.

sentences.sentence: 買ってきたお菓子は{1:一気に}食べないで、少しずつ食べましょうね。
sentences.translation: Don't eat all of the sweets you bought in one go, let's take our time eating them.

sentences.sentence: その仕事を{1:一気に}やってしまいなさい。
sentences.translation: Please finish that job immediately.

sentences.sentence: 値段が{1:一気に}高くなっている。
sentences.translation: The price suddenly jumped high.

sentences.sentence: 彼の日本語は{1:一気に}上達した。
sentences.translation: His Japanese improved in no time.

sentences.sentence: お金があれば幸せ{1:だというものでもない}。
sentences.translation: Having money is no guarantee that you will be happy.

sentences.sentence: 私の仕事は誰でもできる{1:というものではない}！
sentences.translation: My work is not something that just anybody can do!

sentences.sentence: 日本に留学すれば、日本語が上手になる{1:というものでもない}。
sentences.translation: If you study abroad in Japan, that does not necessarily mean you will get good at speaking Japanese.

sentences.sentence: 情報が多ければ判断が楽{1:というものではない}。
sentences.translation: Having more information does not always necessarily make a decision easier.

sentences.sentence: 外国語はただ文法を覚えれば話せる{1:というものではない}。
sentences.translation: With foreign languages, just memorizing grammar does not necessarily mean you will be able to speak the language.

sentences.sentence: 値段が高ければ良い品物{1:だというものでもない}。
sentences.translation: Just because the price is high doesn't mean that it is a good quality item.

sentences.sentence: 健康のためにはただ食べればよい{1:というものではなく}、運動もしなければならない。
sentences.translation: Being healthy doesn't just mean eating the right foods, but one also needs exercise.

sentences.sentence: 電車は早ければいい{1:というものではない}、お客さんの安全は第一だ。
sentences.translation: It is not necessarily the case that the faster the train the better. The customer's safety is the number one priority.

sentences.sentence: 今{1:のままに}しておこう。
sentences.translation: Let's leave this as is.

sentences.sentence: 思う{1:ままに}どうぞ意見を言ってください。
sentences.translation: Please tell me your honest opinion.

sentences.sentence: 上司に命令される{1:ままに}行動していただけだ。
sentences.translation: I just acted as directed by my boss.

sentences.sentence: 感想を思う{1:ままに}アンケートに書いてください。
sentences.translation: Please fill in the questionnaire as you like.

sentences.sentence: 一日一日を、思う{1:がままに}生きたい。
sentences.translation: I want to live each and everyday to my heart's content.

sentences.sentence: セールスマンに言われる{1:まま}、契約書にサインをしてしまった。
sentences.translation: I signed the contract as I was told by the salesman.

sentences.sentence: 特に好きなデザインがなかったから、店員に勧められる{1:ままに}靴を買ってしまった。
sentences.translation: I didn't really have a favorite design, so I bought the shoes as recommended by the clerk.

sentences.sentence: ある{1:がままに}物事を見るようにしなさい。
sentences.translation: Try to see things as they are.

sentences.sentence: 友達ですが、子供の頃からずっとそばにいるので兄弟{1:も同然です}。
sentences.translation: He is my friend, but we have always been together since our childhood so he is just like my brother.

sentences.sentence: この車は中古車といっても新品{1:も同然だ}。
sentences.translation: Although this is a used car, it is almost as good as a new one.

sentences.sentence: 目標がないなら死んだ{1:も同然だ}。
sentences.translation: Having no goals is just like being dead.

sentences.sentence: 社会人になったけど、毎日試験の勉強をしているので、学生{1:同然}の生活だ。
sentences.translation: I became a working adult, but every day I am studying for exams so my life is just like a student's.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は料理が上手で、プロ{1:同然}といっても過言ではない。
sentences.translation: She's good at cooking, and it's no exaggeration to say she's at a professional level.

sentences.sentence: 彼女と2年間一緒に住んでいたから、これは結婚生活{1:も同然だ}。
sentences.translation: I lived together with my girlfriend for 2 years, so it's just like married life.

sentences.sentence: 1点の差だけがあったが、これでも負ける{1:も同然だ}。
sentences.translation: There may have just been a difference of 1 point, but even so this is the same thing as losing.

sentences.sentence: 彼の給料は家賃と生活費で使ったので、財産はない{1:も同然だ}。
sentences.translation: Since his salary is spent on rent and living expenses, it's the same as having no assets.

sentences.sentence: そんなに甘いものばかり食べ{1:ていては}、太りますよ。
sentences.translation: If you only eat sweets, you will gain weight.

sentences.sentence: そんな暗いところで本を読ん{1:でいては}目が悪くなってしまうよ。
sentences.translation: If you keep reading books in such a dark place, your eyes will go bad.

sentences.sentence: いつも親に頼っ{1:ていては}、成長が出来ないよ。
sentences.translation: If you keep always relying on your parents, you will never be able to grow as a person.

sentences.sentence: 毎日そんなに遅くまで残業をし{1:ていては}体を壊しますよ。
sentences.translation: If you keep working overtime late like that you're going to destroy your body.

sentences.sentence: そんなに毎日甘いものばかり食べ{1:ていては}虫歯になりますよ。
sentences.translation: If you keep eating nothing but sweets every day, you're going to get some cavities.

sentences.sentence: あの男の金を返すのを待っ{1:ていては}きりが無い。
sentences.translation: If you wait for him to pay, you will have to wait for ever.

sentences.sentence: 毎日睡眠薬を使っ{1:ていては}、体が壊れるよ。早く病院に行ったほうがいい。
sentences.translation: If you use sleeping pills every day, your body will break. You should go to the hospital soon.

sentences.sentence: こんなに物価が上昇し{1:ていては}、生活が苦しくなるばかりです。
sentences.translation: If prices keep going up like this, life will only get more difficult.

sentences.sentence: この問題が分からない{1:ようでは}N２には合格できないよ。
sentences.translation: If you don't understand this problem, then you won't be able to pass the N2.

sentences.sentence: 試験の前の日に勉強を始める{1:ようでは}、合格はできない。
sentences.translation: If you start studying the day before the exam, you will not be able to pass.

sentences.sentence: この問題が解決できない{1:ようでは}困るよ。
sentences.translation: If we can't resolve this problem, there's going to be trouble.

sentences.sentence: 最初の日から、仕事に遅刻する{1:ようでは}悪い印象になるよ。
sentences.translation: If you are late to work from the first day, it will leave a bad impression.

sentences.sentence: 報告書にこんなにミスがある{1:ようでは}、君に仕事を任せられない。
sentences.translation: If there are this many errors in your written report, then I will not be able to entrust any work with you.

sentences.sentence: 自分の管理もできない{1:ようでは}、人の上に立つこともできない。
sentences.translation: If you cannot control yourself, you will not be able to be in a position above others.

sentences.sentence: 敬語がちゃんと使えない{1:ようでは}、接客の仕事はできない。
sentences.translation: If you can't properly use keigo (formal Japanese), then you will not be able to do work dealing with customers.

sentences.sentence: 勝負において、相手のミスを願う{1:ようでは}プロにはなれない。
sentences.translation: During a match, if you pray for the opponent to make a mistake, then you can't become a true professional

sentences.sentence: 約束した{1:上は}、どんなことがあっても守ります。
sentences.translation: Since I’ve made a promise, I will keep it no matter what happens.

sentences.sentence: プロ選手になると決めた{1:上は}、苦しくても頑張らなければならない。
sentences.translation: Since you've decided to become a professional athlete, even if things get tough you have to always do your best.

sentences.sentence: N2を受験する{1:上は}、高得点で合格したいです。
sentences.translation: Since I will be taking the N2, I want to pass with a high score.

sentences.sentence: 家族を離れて日本で働く{1:上は}、十分な覚悟が必要である。
sentences.translation: Since you will be moving away from your family to work in Japan, you will need to properly prepare yourself.

sentences.sentence: 彼は仕事を引き受けた{1:上は}いつも全力を尽くします。
sentences.translation: He always does his best after taking a job.

sentences.sentence: このプロジェクトは失敗した。こうなった{1:上は}言い訳をしても無駄だ。
sentences.translation: This project failed. Since it's come to this, there is no point in making excuses.

sentences.sentence: 留学を決心した{1:上は}、仕事を頑張って留学の代金を貯金すべきだ。
sentences.translation: Since I've decided to study abroad, I need to work hard and save up money for the trip.

sentences.sentence: 高いお金を払って旅行する{1:上は}、たくさんの場所を観光して、その土地のおいしい物を食べたいです。
sentences.translation: Since I spend a lot of money for travelling, I want to sightsee at many places and eat delicious local foods.

sentences.sentence: 私はそう{1:せざるを得ない}。
sentences.translation: I have no choice but to do that.

sentences.sentence: いやな仕事でも、生活のためには続け{1:ざるを得ない}。
sentences.translation: Even if it's work you don't like, you must continue working in order to maintain your livelihood.

sentences.sentence: 彼は受験のため、サークル活動を休ま{1:ざるを得なかった}。
sentences.translation: In order to prepare for exams, he had no choice but to quit his club activities.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は進学したいが、家族が学費を払える状況でもないので、諦め{1:ざるを得ない}。
sentences.translation: She wants to go to university, but her family is not in a position to help support her so she has no choice but to give up.

sentences.sentence: 今回の旅行を楽しみにしていたが、母が急に入院したので、行くのをキャンセル{1:せざるを得ない}。
sentences.translation: I was looking forward to this trip, but my mother was suddenly hospitalized so we had to cancel it.

sentences.sentence: 留学したい気持ちは分かるが、この病状では、延期{1:せざるを得ない}だろう。
sentences.translation: I understand you want to study abroad, but with your medical condition there is no choice but to postpone.

sentences.sentence: 明日のテストの成績が悪いと、留年が決定するので、今日は徹夜でも勉強{1:せざるを得ない}。
sentences.translation: If tomorrow's test results are bad then I will have to repeat a year, so I must study today through the night.

sentences.sentence: 高校3年生の約3％が、生活が苦しいので、大学進学を諦め{1:ざるを得ない}そうです。
sentences.translation: About 3% of senior high school students have difficult lives and apparently have no choice but to give up on college.

sentences.sentence: {1:要するに}時と金の問題だ。
sentences.translation: In short, it is a question of time and money.

sentences.sentence: {1:要するに}、彼女は行きたくないって言ったでしょう。
sentences.translation: To sum up, she said she doesn't want to go, right?

sentences.sentence: その会合は勉強にならない。{1:要するに}時間の無駄だった。
sentences.translation: That gathering did not help with my studies, in short it was a waste of time.

sentences.sentence: 終電が出てしまった。{1:要するに}、今日は電車で帰れないということだ。
sentences.translation: The last train left.. In short, I won't be able to return home by train today.

sentences.sentence: 合格点に10点足りず、不合格でした。{1:要するに}、まだまだ努力が足りなかった。
sentences.translation: I was short 10 points of a passing score and failed. In short, I did not put in enough effort..

sentences.sentence: 彼は一度も入賞しなかった。{1:要するに}才能がなかったということだ。
sentences.translation: He's never even once placed in a contest. To put it simply, lacked talent.

sentences.sentence: 試合に大負けした。{1:要するに}、相手のチームと力の差があったということだ。
sentences.translation: We had a crushing defeat in the match. To put it simply, there was a big gap of strength between the opposing team.

sentences.sentence: 今日のスピーチは緊張して間違えてしまいました。{1:要するに}、練習不足ということです。
sentences.translation: In today's speach, I was nervous and made a mistake. In short, I lacked in practice.

sentences.sentence: 電車が{1:わずかに}遅れている。
sentences.translation: The train is running slightly late.

sentences.sentence: 道はここで{1:わずかに}右に曲がっている。
sentences.translation: The road bends slightly to the right here.

sentences.sentence: 財布の中に残っていたお金は{1:わずかに}500円だった。
sentences.translation: The money remaining in the wallet was only 500 yen.

sentences.sentence: 私は学校へ{1:わずかに}二ヶ月しか行っていません。
sentences.translation: I only went to school for barely 2 months.

sentences.sentence: {1:わずかに}4日間でそんなにたくさんの仕事をしたとは驚きだ。
sentences.translation: I'm surprised you did all that work in just four days.

sentences.sentence: バスの中には{1:わずかに}５人しか居なかった。
sentences.translation: There were no more than five passengers on the bus.

sentences.sentence: そのコンサートの出席者は{1:わずかに}６人だった。
sentences.translation: The number of people who attended the concert was no more than 6.

sentences.sentence: 私の会社の社員の数は３年前と比べると、{1:わずかに}減った 。
sentences.translation: The number of employees in my company has decreased slightly compared to that of three years ago.

sentences.sentence: この仕事は君に信頼する{1:よりほかはない}。
sentences.translation: I have no choice but to trust you with this job.

sentences.sentence: バスがないので、歩いていく{1:よりほか仕方がない}。
sentences.translation: Since there are no buses, i have no choice but to go on foot.

sentences.sentence: 頼れる人はいないから、自分がやる{1:よりほか仕方がない}。
sentences.translation: I have no one to depend on, so the only option is to do it myself.

sentences.sentence: 僕は学力が足りないから勉強で補う{1:よりほかはない}。
sentences.translation: I don't have great academic ability, so I need to make up for it by studying.

sentences.sentence: 自転車が壊れてしまった。学校へバスで行く{1:よりほか仕方がない}。
sentences.translation: My bicycle broke. Now I have no choice but to go to school by bus.

sentences.sentence: 台風が来るので、残念だが明日の大会は延期する{1:よりほかない}。
sentences.translation: A typhoon is coming, so although it is unfortunate the only option is to delay the event.

sentences.sentence: こんな経営状況が続くようであれば、店を閉める{1:よりほかない}ですよ。
sentences.translation: If business conditions keep continuing like this, there will be no choice but to close up shop.

sentences.sentence: 薬は嫌いだが、飲まないと病気を治せないから、飲む{1:よりほか仕方がない}。
sentences.translation: I hate medicine, but if I don't take it, I can't cure my disease, so I have no choice but to take it.

sentences.sentence: バスケットボール、サッカー{1:といった}スポーツは大学生に人気がある。
sentences.translation: Sports such as basketball and soccer are popular with college students.

sentences.sentence: とんかつや天ぷら{1:といった}揚げ物の料理が好きです。
sentences.translation: I love fried foods like "tonkatsu" and "tempura".

sentences.sentence: 彼女はアイスクリームやチョコレート{1:といった}甘い物が好きだ。
sentences.translation: She likes sweets such as ice cream and chocolate.

sentences.sentence: トヨタやホンダ{1:といった}車の会社は世界で有名だ。
sentences.translation: Car companies such as Toyota and Honda are famous in the world.

sentences.sentence: この日本語学校にはタイ、ベトナム{1:といった}東南アジアからの留学生が多い。
sentences.translation: This Japanese language school has many students from Southeast Asia such as Thailand and Vietnam.

sentences.sentence: 私は、「こんにちは」「さようなら」{1:といった}簡単な言葉を話せます。
sentences.translation: I can say simple words like "hello" and "goodbye".

sentences.sentence: うどんや寿司{1:といった}日本の食べ物を好む外国人が増えてきた。
sentences.translation: Foreigners who prefer Japanese food such as udon and sushi are beginning to increase.

sentences.sentence: この店では古い洗濯機やテレビ{1:といった}電子品がたくさん売っています。
sentences.translation: This shop sells a lot of electronic goods such as old washing machines and TVs.

sentences.sentence: これは今年最高の映画だ{1:と考えられている}。
sentences.translation: This is thought of to be this year's best movie.

sentences.sentence: 彼が死んだ原因は事故だ{1:と考えられる}。
sentences.translation: An accident is considered to be the cause of his death.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は優秀な医者である{1:と考えられている}。
sentences.translation: She is considered to be an excellent doctor.

sentences.sentence: このデータは今後の研究に役に立つ{1:と考えられる}。
sentences.translation: I believe that this data will be helpful for future research.

sentences.sentence: その事故はスピードの出しすぎのせいだ{1:と考えられる}。
sentences.translation: The accident is believed to be due to fast driving.

sentences.sentence: 日本製品{1:と考えられる}と、イメージはアップしている。
sentences.translation: A product's brand image improves when it is thought to be a Japanese product.

sentences.sentence: 日本人は礼儀正しい{1:と考えられています}。
sentences.translation: Japanese people are considered to be polite.

sentences.sentence: 低脂肪食が長寿の秘訣だ{1:と考えられている}。
sentences.translation: Low-fat diets are considered the key to longevity.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は信じられない{1:というふうに}頭を振った。
sentences.translation: She shook her head in disbelief.

sentences.sentence: 彼はいつも自分が天才だ{1:というふうに}思い込んでいた。
sentences.translation: He always fancied himself as a genius.

sentences.sentence: これは非常に大事なことだ{1:という風に}思っております。
sentences.translation: I believe that this is extremely important.

sentences.sentence: 日本にはどういう影響がある{1:というふうに}見ていますか。
sentences.translation: How do you see this affecting Japan?

sentences.sentence: 彼はどうしようもない{1:という風に}首を振った。
sentences.translation: He shook his head as if to say it's hopeless.

sentences.sentence: ぜひ皆様のご協力、ご指導も頂きたい{1:というふうに}思っています。
sentences.translation: I would appreciate everyone's cooperation and advice.

sentences.sentence: 彼女は月曜日、あなたは火曜日{1:という風に}交代で当番になったらどうですか？
sentences.translation: How about we rotate shifts in this way, with her on Monday and you on Tuesday?

sentences.sentence: 総理のお考えをお聞きした上で、この問題を判断したい{1:というふうに}思っております。
sentences.translation: I would like to make a decision on this issue after listening to the leader's opinion.

sentences.sentence: 過去を忘れ{1:てはならない}。
sentences.translation: We must never forget the past.

sentences.sentence: 教師はいじめを見逃し{1:てはならない}。
sentences.translation: Teachers must not overlook bullying.

sentences.sentence: 水は生きるために{1:なくてはならない}。
sentences.translation: Water is necessary for life.

sentences.sentence: どんなことでも失敗したら、人のせいにし{1:てはなりません}。
sentences.translation: No matter the failure, you must not place the blame on others.

sentences.sentence: 友達と約束したから、秘密を漏らし{1:てはならない}。
sentences.translation: I promised my friend, so their secret must not be leaked out.

sentences.sentence: 自分の利益のために法律を違反することがあっ{1:てはならない}。
sentences.translation: You must never break the law for your own benefit.

sentences.sentence: 自分の行動に自分で責任を持た{1:なくてはならない}と学校で先生によく言われる。
sentences.translation: I am often told by my teacher at school that one must take responsibility for their actions.

sentences.sentence: 世界で色んな人が食べ物がないから、食べ物を捨て{1:てはならない}！と子供の頃から両親が教えてくれた。
sentences.translation: When I was a child, my parents taught me that there are a lot of people without food in this world so we must never throw away food.

sentences.sentence: 入り{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: Come in.

sentences.sentence: 分からない事があったら何でも聞き{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: Ask anything if you don't understand.

sentences.sentence: この金は君の好きなように使い{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: Use this money as you like.

sentences.sentence: ご飯を食べる前に手を洗い{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: Wash your hands before eating.

sentences.sentence: 静かに！ちゃんと上司の説明を聞き{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: Be quiet! Make sure to listen to the boss's explanation.

sentences.sentence: もう8時だよ。早く起き{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: It's already 8 o'clock! Hurry up and get up!

sentences.sentence: 君が考えて良いと思ったようにし{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: You may do as you think fit.

sentences.sentence: 僕はまだ仕事が残っているから, 先に帰り{1:たまえ}。
sentences.translation: I still have some work to do here, so you may leave before me.

sentences.sentence: ぐずぐずし{1:てはいられない}。
sentences.translation: We have no time to lose.

sentences.sentence: 泣か{1:ないではいられない}。
sentences.translation: I can't help crying.

sentences.sentence: 彼の言うことを信じ{1:ないではいられない}。
sentences.translation: I cannot help believing what he says.

sentences.sentence: もうすぐ試験だから遊ん{1:ではいられない}。勉強に集中しなきゃ。
sentences.translation: My exams are near so I can't afford to slack off. I need to focus on my studies.

sentences.sentence: 今年から大学生になるから、いつまでも親に頼っ{1:てはいられない}。
sentences.translation: I'll be a college student this year, so I can't rely on my parents forever.

sentences.sentence: 明日は早く起きるので、いつものように遅くまで本を読ん{1:ではいられない}。
sentences.translation: I will get up early tomorrow, so I can't stay up and read late as usual.

sentences.sentence: やると決めたら、のんびりし{1:てはいられない}。今すぐ準備を始めよう。
sentences.translation: If you decide to do it, you can't be carefree about it. Let's start the preparations right away.

sentences.sentence: あんなひどいことを言われて、私も黙っ{1:てはいられなかった}。
sentences.translation: I couldn't stay silent after being told something so horrible.

sentences.sentence: 仕事が予定より遅れているから、今度の日曜日は、仕事を休ん{1:ではいられない}。
sentences.translation: I’m already behind in my work, so i can’t afford to take a day off this Sunday.

sentences.sentence: 試験終了時間まであと数分だから、この問題にそんなに時間をかけ{1:てはいられない}。
sentences.translation: There are only few minutes left until the test is over, so i can’t spend too much time on this question.

sentences.sentence: 今日から自転車で{1:出勤しよう}。
sentences.translation: Let's start commuting by bicycle from today!

sentences.sentence: もう11時だ。早く{1:寝よう}。
sentences.translation: It's already 11pm, let's hurry and go to sleep.

sentences.sentence: 重たそうだね。{1:手伝おう}か。
sentences.translation: That looks heavy, shall I give you a hand?

sentences.sentence: 今日は食堂で昼食を{1:食べよう}。
sentences.translation: Let's eat lunch at the dining room today.

sentences.sentence: 図書館で一緒に{1:勉強しよう}。
sentences.translation: Let's study together at the library.

sentences.sentence: 明日は週末ですから、飲みに{1:行こう}。
sentences.translation: Tomorrow is the end of the week, so let's go out for some drinks.

sentences.sentence: 雨が降っているよ。駅まで{1:送ってあげよう}か？
sentences.translation: It's raining... Shall I give you a lift to the station?

sentences.sentence: あなたが気にいる{1:といい}な。
sentences.translation: I hope you like it.

sentences.sentence: 見られ{1:たらいい}ね。
sentences.translation: I hope I can see it.

sentences.sentence: 明日晴れる{1:といい}な。
sentences.translation: I hope the weather will clear up tomorrow.

sentences.sentence: 旅行中は雨が降らない{1:といい}なあ。
sentences.translation: I hope it doesn't rain during our trip.

sentences.sentence: いつか日本で出会え{1:たらいい}な。
sentences.translation: It would be nice if we can meet in Japan one day.

sentences.sentence: 風邪ひいちゃった。早く良くなる{1:といい}んだけど。
sentences.translation: I caught a cold, I hope I can recover quickly.

sentences.sentence: 痩せたかったら、この薬を飲む{1:といい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: If you want to lose weight, you should take this medicine.

sentences.sentence: 勉強に疲れたら、チョコレートを食べる{1:といい}ですよ。
sentences.translation: If you're tired from studying, you should eat some chocolate.

sentences.sentence: もう少し給料を上げてくれ{1:たらいい}のだが。
sentences.translation: I wish they would raise my salary..

sentences.sentence: ダイエットをしてから少し痩せてきたが、もっと体重が減っ{1:たらいい}のに。
sentences.translation: Since starting my diet I've lost some weight, but I was really hoping to lose more.
